analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar 'dogs pa spangs na /
translated: If you eliminate the conception of imputation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa yang rung ste /
translated: then the afflictions will cease.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs pa yin pas /
translated: This is the object of the wisdom of the āryas.

original: de yang chad ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir @13a * //
analyzed: de yang chad ma yin te / de'i phyir @13a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not nihilism.

original: brjod du med par rtog pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod du med par rtog pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not meaningless to conceive of the inexpressible.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar 'dogs pa spong ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar 'dogs pa spong ba yin na /
translated: postulations is on the basis of the positing of the reasons, then it follows🔽that any one of the noble beings’ wisdoms would eliminate all things that🔽are included in reasons and conceptualization, as well as all things that are

original: de lta na 'phags pa'i ye shes gang yang rung ba gcig gis rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa'i sems can dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad 'gog par thal bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'phags pa'i ye shes gang yang rung ba gcig gis rgyu mtshan dang rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa'i sems can dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad 'gog par thal bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: not included in sentient beings.🔽This is just like the magician and his

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan dang sgyu ma'i las bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan dang sgyu ma'i las bzhin no zhe na /
translated: magic.🔽Reply: Since things arise from causes that are not shared by conceptual

original: smras pa / dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thun mong pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thun mong pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas /
translated: fabrications and from causes that are shared by conceptual fabrications,🔽those that are fabricated from causes that are not shared by conceptual

original: rnam par rtog pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog par 'gyur la /
translated: fabrications are eliminated.

original: rnam par rtog pa thun mong ba'i rgyu las byung ba rnam par ma brtags pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas zin pa yin pas mi 'gog ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thun mong ba'i rgyu las byung ba rnam par ma brtags pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas zin pa yin pas mi 'gog ste /
translated: The uninvestigated that arises from a common cause of discursive thought is not refuted, because it is grasped by the discursive thought of others.

original: gzhan du na gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the discursive thought of others would be pointless.

original: de ma 'gags na yang rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de ma 'gags na yang rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: And if that is not refuted, then it should be understood that the vision of the pure nature is pure.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa rab tu mang pos dngos po gcig la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas sna tshogs su mos par byed pa dag la mthong ba sna tshogs dag dmigs par 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //🔽dngos po lnga po de dag las du zhig gzung ba dag yin /
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa rab tu mang pos dngos po gcig la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas sna tshogs su mos par byed pa dag la mthong ba sna tshogs dag dmigs par 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o // dngos po lnga po de dag las du zhig gzung ba dag yin /
translated: it is like the case of many yogis who, with their minds in meditative equipoise on one thing, imagine various things and various visions are perceived.

original: du zhig 'dzin pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'dzin pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: From among those five things, how many are objects and how many are subjects?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / gsum ni gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum ni gzung ba yin no //
translated: Three are objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa ni 'dzin pa yang yin /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa ni 'dzin pa yang yin /
translated: Conceptual thought and right knowledge are also grasping.🔽

original: gzung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba yang yin no //
translated: Conceptualization and right knowledge are both grasping and the object of grasping.

original: dngos po lnga po dag la mdor bsdu na rnam pa du zhig 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po lnga po dag la mdor bsdu na rnam pa du zhig 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How many aspects should one see as the object of the domain of grasping in brief with regard to the five things?

original: smras pa / rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is said:

original: brjod pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul dang / brjod du med la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul dang / mtshan ma med pa 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul dang / brjod du med la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul dang / mtshan ma med pa 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: There are three aspects: the domain of grasping that is verbal and has signs, the domain of grasping that is inexpressible and has signs, and the domain of grasping that is signless.

original: de la dang po ni tha snyad rjes su sad pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de la dang po ni tha snyad rjes su sad pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The first is the domain of grasping that is the aftermath of conventional knowledge.

original: gnyis pa ni tha snyad bag la 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tha snyad bag la 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The second is the domain of grasping that is the retention of conventional knowledge.

original: @13b gsum pa ni tha snyad bag la nyal ba ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: @13b gsum pa ni tha snyad bag la nyal ba ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The third is the domain of grasping that is not the latency of conventional knowledge.

original: dang po gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The first two grasp the conventional truth.

original: tha ma ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: tha ma ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The latter is the apprehension of ultimate reality.

original: gzhan yang bag la nyal med pa de'i rjes las thob pa'i 'dzin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bag la nyal med pa de'i rjes las thob pa'i 'dzin pa yang yod de /
translated: Moreover, there is a subsequent attainment of the absence of latent impressions.

original: de'i spyod yul ni bden pa gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni bden pa gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gzung ba yin te /
translated: Its domain is the apprehended objects belonging to both realities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane cognition.

original: de'i spyod yul ni rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa yin pa'i phyir de'i spyod yul bden pa gnyi gar gtogs pa yin par rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa yin pa'i phyir de'i spyod yul bden pa gnyi gar gtogs pa yin par rnam par gzhag go /
translated: Since its domain is the reality of the established, its domain is established as belonging to both realities.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dzin pa de gnyis kyang rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dzin pa de gnyis kyang rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those two apprehensions, mundane and supramundane, should be understood through two causes:

original: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad dang tha snyad ma yin pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad dang tha snyad ma yin pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of familiarity and unfamiliarity, and because of dependence on conventional and non-conventional.

original: 'jig rten na mtshan ma dang bcas pa la 'dzin par ni grags kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na mtshan ma dang bcas pa la 'dzin par ni grags kyi /
translated: In the world, apprehension with signs is well-known.

original: mtshan ma med pa la 'dzin par ni ma grags pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la 'dzin par ni ma grags pas /
translated: But it is not well known that the absence of signs is apprehended.

original: rgyu med pa dang rkyen med par ni mi rung na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang rkyen med par ni mi rung na /
translated: If it is not suitable to be without a cause and without conditions,

original: de'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang zhe na /
translated: what is its cause and what are its conditions?

original: smras pa / tha snyad kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la 'dzin par grags pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / tha snyad kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la 'dzin par grags pa yin te /
translated: It is said: The result of apprehension that is completely imbued with conventional expressions is known as the apprehension of that which possesses signs.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of complete affliction.

original: don dam pa'i shes pas yongs su bsgos pa'i 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu ni mtshan ma med pa la 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes pas yongs su bsgos pa'i 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu ni mtshan ma med pa la 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The result of apprehension that is completely imbued with knowledge of the ultimate is the apprehension of that which is without signs.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of complete purification.

original: de'i phyir de gnyi ga yang rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rkyen dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyi ga yang rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rkyen dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, both of these are endowed with causes and endowed with conditions.

original: mig la rab rib kyi skyon yod pa la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma dmigs pa lta bu dang / skyon med pa la de mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: mig la rab rib kyi skyon yod pa la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyi mtshan ma dmigs pa lta bu dang / skyon med pa la de mi dmigs shing /
translated: It is like the case of the signs of cataracts, such as floating hairs, that are perceived by those whose eyes are afflicted by cataracts, and like the case of the absence of those signs for those whose eyes are healthy.

original: tha mal par snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha mal par snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of the appearance of the ordinary.

original: gal te mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la mtshan mar 'dzin na ni mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la mtshan mar 'dzin na ni mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one grasps the signless realm as a sign, then one does not grasp the signless.

original: gal te mi 'dzin na ni de lta na yang mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dzin na ni de lta na yang mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one does not grasp it, then in that case also one does not grasp the signless.

original: smras pa / 'dzin pa ni tha snyad bag la nyal med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la 'dzin pa na yang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dzin pa ni tha snyad bag la nyal med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la 'dzin pa na yang /
translated: We reply: When one grasps the signless realm, one does not grasp it as a sign, because one does not have the latent tendency to conceptualize it.

original: de la mtshan ma mar mi 'dzin pas mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par 'thad do //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma mar mi 'dzin pas mtshan ma med pa 'dzin par 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that one grasps the signless.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas de ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /🔽de'i mtshan ma @14a * //
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas de ji ltar 'dzin zhe na / de'i mtshan ma @14a * //
translated: If one does not grasp it as a sign, how does one grasp it?🔽Because one destroys its sign.

original: bshig pa'i phyir dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: bshig pa'i phyir dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa med pas so //
translated: And because one does not superimpose grasping as a sign.

original: ji ste mtshan mar mi 'dzin na yang mngon rtags su 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa med na /
analyzed: ji ste mtshan mar mi 'dzin na yang mngon rtags su 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa med na /
translated: If one does not grasp it as a sign, but does not superimpose grasping as a sign,

original: mtshan ma nyid ci 'dra bar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid ci 'dra bar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: how should one understand the sign itself?

original: smras pa / don dam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ; mtshan ma med pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po lnga po la mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / don dam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ; mtshan ma med pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po lnga po la mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: He said: Because of the apprehension of the ultimate, because of the non-apprehension of the signless, and because of the non-appearance of all signs in the five things, that is their characteristic.

original: gal te mi gsal bar 'dzin par rnam par bzhag na /
analyzed: gal te mi gsal bar 'dzin par rnam par bzhag na /
translated: If it is established as the apprehension of the unclear,

original: 'dzin pa de 'gog pa kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa de 'gog pa kho na yin par ci'i phyir mi rtag ce na /
translated: why is that apprehension not considered to be cessation itself?

original: smras pa / 'gog par ni mngon par 'du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa ni de 'gog pa'i phyir mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'gog par ni mngon par 'du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa ni de 'gog pa'i phyir mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: He said: Because of the non-performance of cessation, the yogi does not perform the non-performance of cessation.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ji ltar so sor rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ji ltar so sor rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should its characteristic be individually cognized?

original: smras pa / so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: He said: By the individually intuited gnosis.

original: de ji ltar so sor rig par byed pa de ltar ci'i phyir lan 'debs par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar so sor rig par byed pa de ltar ci'i phyir lan 'debs par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why does he not answer in the way that it is individually cognized?

original: smras pa / so sor rig pa de ni brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / so sor rig pa de ni brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He said: Because that individual cognition is not the basis of expression.

original: gal te shes pa dang po mtshan ma med pa ma yin na ni /🔽de med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa goms pa yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang po mtshan ma med pa ma yin na ni / de med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa goms pa yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: If the first cognition is not signless,🔽then, because it would not exist, there would be no cultivation of the signless cognition.

original: de la goms pa med na ni mtshan ma med pa rgyu med pa las skye bar mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de la goms pa med na ni mtshan ma med pa rgyu med pa las skye bar mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: And if there is no cultivation of that, then the signless would arise without a cause.

original: smras pa / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang bcas pa yang mtshan ma med pa'i rgyu rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang bcas pa yang mtshan ma med pa'i rgyu rung ste /
translated: We reply: It is possible that the signless is the cause of that which possesses signs,

original: de dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na 'jig rten pa la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa skye ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa la brten nas zag pa med pa dang / sems yod pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas sems med pa skye ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa skye ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa la brten nas zag pa med pa dang / sems yod pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas sems med pa skye ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: the supramundane arises in dependence on the mundane, the uncontaminated arises in dependence on the contaminated, and the mindless meditative attainment arises in dependence on a mind that possesses a mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dag pa'i rgyur sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dag pa'i rgyur sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavån has stated that the knowledge of suffering, etc. is the cause of purification.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag sdug bsngal la sogs par yongs su rtog par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag sdug bsngal la sogs par yongs su rtog par byed na ni /
translated: If one fully understands the truths of suffering, etc. by means of the knowledge of suffering, etc.,

original: de na mtshan ma dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na mtshan ma dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that would be with signs.

original: ji ste yongs su rtog par mi byed na ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ji ste yongs su rtog par mi byed na ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: But if one does not fully understand, then one does not know suffering, etc.

original: de med na ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de med na ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And if that does not exist, how can there be purification?

original: smras pa / bden pa rnams la @14b 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / bden pa rnams la @14b 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: We reply: The purification of mundane and supramundane knowledge of the truths is due to the power of signless knowledge.

original: de nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam par spangs pas na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam par spangs pas na /
translated: And since that very thing eliminates the afflictions,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gyur pa nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de nyid la rgyu 'bras bu gdags pa byas nas sdug bsngal la sogs pa bshes pas nye bar gdags pas nyes pa med do
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gyur pa nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de nyid la rgyu 'bras bu gdags pa byas nas sdug bsngal la sogs pa bshes pas nye bar gdags pas nyes pa med do
translated: The cognition of the absence of signs is the cause of the cognition of suffering and so on. It is the elimination of affliction. The designation of cause and effect is made in relation to that. There is no fault in designating suffering and so on as the object of cognition.

original: / sngar bzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu can yin na zhes bstan na 'dzin pa de'i 'bras bu gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na //
analyzed: / sngar bzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu can yin na zhes bstan na 'dzin pa de'i 'bras bu gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na //
translated: If it is taught that the apprehended object is the result of the apprehending subject, then what is the result of that apprehending subject?

original: smras pa / gnyi ga gcig gi 'bras bu gcig yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga gcig gi 'bras bu gcig yin no //
translated: Both are the result of the other.

original: gang gi tshe shes bya mi rtag pa 'dris pa brten pa dang dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes bya mi rtag pa 'dris pa brten pa dang dpag tu med pa /
translated: When the object of cognition is impermanent, familiar, supported, immeasurable,

original: phal cher lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i tshe /
analyzed: phal cher lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i tshe /
translated: and mostly hidden,

original: rnal 'byor pa des ji ltar de la dmigs par byed cing rnam par zlog par yang byed ce na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des ji ltar de la dmigs par byed cing rnam par zlog par yang byed ce na /
translated: how does the yogi observe it and also turn away from it?

original: smras pa / thos pa dang bsam pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / thos pa dang bsam pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur la /
translated: It is said that through the power of hearing and contemplation, one attains concentration.

original: des shes bya rnam pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: des shes bya rnam pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan mngon du byas nas /
translated: Having manifested the image of concentration on the five kinds of objects of knowledge,

original: shes bya de la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: shes bya de la dmigs par byed do //
translated: he focuses on that object of knowledge.

original: zil gyis gnon pas ni rnam par zlog par byed do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pas ni rnam par zlog par byed do //
translated: By the subjugation, he turns it back.

original: shes bya rnam pa lngas zil gyis gnon pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: shes bya rnam pa lngas zil gyis gnon pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of subjugation by the five kinds of objects of knowledge?

original: smras pa / gnas par gyur pa /
analyzed: smras pa / gnas par gyur pa /
translated: It is said:🔽The characteristic of the unsurpassed is the state of being,

original: 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan 'das 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan 'das 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa yin no //
translated: the unconditioned, and nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nirvana?

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the pure realm of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal nye bar gzhi ba'i don gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal nye bar gzhi ba'i don gyis yin gyi /
translated: It is the meaning of the pacification of afflictions and suffering,

original: med pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the meaning of non-existence.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tshe /
translated: When the mere pacification of afflictions and suffering is called nirvana,

original: ci'i phyir de med pa'i don gyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de med pa'i don gyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the meaning of non-existence?

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dper na chu'i khams la rnyog pa dangs pa tsam gsal ba yin yang rnyog pa dangs par gyur pas gsal ba nyid med pa ma yin pa dang / gser skyon dang bral ba tsam bzang ba nyid yin yang de dang bral bas bzang ba nyid med pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: dper na chu'i khams la rnyog pa dangs pa tsam gsal ba yin yang rnyog pa dangs par gyur pas gsal ba nyid med pa ma yin pa dang / gser skyon dang bral ba tsam bzang ba nyid yin yang de dang bral bas bzang ba nyid med pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: For example, the water element is clear merely by the clarity of turbidity, but the clarity is not non-existent by the clarity of turbidity. Gold is good merely by being free from faults, but the goodness is not non-existent by being free from that.

original: nam mkha' sprin dang / khug rnal sogs pa dang bral ba tsam rnam par dag pa nyid yin yang de dang bral bas rnam par @15a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' sprin dang / khug rnal sogs pa dang bral ba tsam rnam par dag pa nyid yin yang de dang bral bas rnam par @15a * //
translated: Space is pure merely by being free from clouds, mist, and so forth, but the purity is not non-existent by being free from that.

original: dag pa nyid med pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dag pa nyid med pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, the dharmadhatu is pure merely by being free from the stains of the two obscurations, but the purity is not non-existent by being free from that.

original: 'di lta tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be viewed in the same way.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purity of the dharmadhatu?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa bsgom pa la brten nas mtshan ma thams cad bsal bas de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa bsgom pa la brten nas mtshan ma thams cad bsal bas de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is suchness that is cleared of all signs by relying on the cultivation of correct knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na mi la zhig gnyid log pa'i tshe bdag nyid chu bo'i chus khyer ba rmis nas de chu bo de las rgal bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po la rtsom par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: dper na mi la zhig gnyid log pa'i tshe bdag nyid chu bo'i chus khyer ba rmis nas de chu bo de las rgal bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po la rtsom par 'gyur ba las /
translated: For example, when a person is asleep and dreams that he is carried away by a river, he might make great effort to escape from the river.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa de nyid kyis sad par gyur cing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa de nyid kyis sad par gyur cing /
translated: But by the very effort of escaping, he wakes up,

original: sad nas kyang chub bo'i chu de nyid mi snang bar gyur ba de bzhin du mtshan ma sel ba 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sad nas kyang chub bo'i chu de nyid mi snang bar gyur ba de bzhin du mtshan ma sel ba 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: and upon waking, the river in the dream disappears. In the same way, one should see the elimination of signs in this way.

original: cig gang gi tshe tha snyad kyi bag la nyal spong bar byed pa de nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: cig gang gi tshe tha snyad kyi bag la nyal spong bar byed pa de nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: When one abandons the latent tendencies of conventions,

original: mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed dam /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed dam /
translated: does one eliminate signs then,

original: 'on te spangs pa'i 'og tu dus gzhan gyi tshe na rnam par 'jig par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te spangs pa'i 'og tu dus gzhan gyi tshe na rnam par 'jig par byed ce na /
translated: or does one eliminate them at another time after they have been abandoned?

original: smras pa / de spong bar byed pa dang / de rnam par 'jig par byed pa ni srang mnga'i mthon dam gyi tshul bzhin du mgo mnyam zhing dus gcig tu ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de spong bar byed pa dang / de rnam par 'jig par byed pa ni srang mnga'i mthon dam gyi tshul bzhin du mgo mnyam zhing dus gcig tu ste /
translated: He says: The abandonment and destruction of that is like the balance of a scale, i.e., simultaneous.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na ri mo'i dbyibs la tshon rtsi byed pa na /
analyzed: dper na ri mo'i dbyibs la tshon rtsi byed pa na /
translated: For example, when a picture is painted,

original: dbyibs kyang byed par 'gyur ba dang / rab rib kyi skyon bsal ba na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyang bsal bar mgo mnyam pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang byed par 'gyur ba dang / rab rib kyi skyon bsal ba na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa rab rib kyang bsal bar mgo mnyam pa bzhin du /
translated: the shape is also made. And like the removal of the fault of blurred vision, the blurred vision of the hair tuft, etc., is removed.

original: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should see that this is also like that.

original: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar dmigs pa zil gyis gnon zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar dmigs pa zil gyis gnon zhe na /
translated: How does the yogi suppress the object of observation?

original: smras pa / sems mnyam par gzhag pa la shes bya'i gzugs brnyan byung ba na /
analyzed: smras pa / sems mnyam par gzhag pa la shes bya'i gzugs brnyan byung ba na /
translated: He says: When the reflection of the object of knowledge arises in the mind that is in equipoise,

original: sngar don dam pa legs par rtogs pa yid la byed pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa nyid ni rnam par ldog / mtshan ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar don dam pa legs par rtogs pa yid la byed pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa nyid ni rnam par ldog / mtshan ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the possession of signs is reversed by the attention that previously well understood the ultimate, and becomes signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de yang gnas skabs lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de yang gnas skabs lnga ste /
translated: Signlessness is fivefold:

original: nyi tshe ba dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang / g-yo ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / grub pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang / g-yo ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / grub pa'o //
translated: limited, universal, wavering, accompanied by formative influence, and accomplished.

original: grub pa de yang mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa de yang mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of that accomplishment?🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir /🔽gtan du gnod pa byar med pa yin pas na gnas grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir / gtan du gnod pa byar med pa yin pas na gnas grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.

original: de yang de kho na'i don shin tu rnam par dag pa spyod yul pa dang / thams cad mngon sum gyi spyod yul pa @15b dang ; thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i spyod yul ba'o //🔽grub pa de yang theg pa dus rnam par 'jog par byed cing /🔽dus ji tsam gyis 'thob ce na /
analyzed: de yang de kho na'i don shin tu rnam par dag pa spyod yul pa dang / thams cad mngon sum gyi spyod yul pa @15b dang ; thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i spyod yul ba'o // grub pa de yang theg pa dus rnam par 'jog par byed cing / dus ji tsam gyis 'thob ce na /
translated: It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.

original: smras pa / dbang po rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It is the unshakability of all defilement and all harm.🔽It

original: theg pa gnyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the two vehicles are rooted in the vehicle of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gnyis kyis ni dus nges pa med pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni dus nges pa med pa 'thob ste /
translated: By the first two, one attains the time of enlightenment without delay,

original: rkyen ji lta ba dang / ji ltar yongs su smin pas so //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba dang / ji ltar yongs su smin pas so //
translated: because one is in accord with the conditions and one is fully matured.

original: tha mas ni gnas ngan len gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi dus kyis 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mas ni gnas ngan len gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi dus kyis 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the last, one attains the time of enlightenment in three incalculable aeons, in terms of the three kinds of negative reflex action.

original: gnas ngan len rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of negative reflex action?

original: ngan song la mi dga' ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa lpags shun la yod pa lta bu gang spangs pas ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ngan song la mi dga' ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa lpags shun la yod pa lta bu gang spangs pas ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The first is the negative reflex action that is like the outer bark of a tree, which, when eliminated, prevents one from going to the lower realms.

original: sbyor ba byed pas na yang mi dga' ba dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa phra mo yod pa lta bu gang yang spangs pas rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa shin tu phra mo yang kun tu mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: sbyor ba byed pas na yang mi dga' ba dang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa phra mo yod pa lta bu gang yang spangs pas rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa shin tu phra mo yang kun tu mi 'byung zhing /
translated: Since one has abandoned the subtle aspects of the obscurations of affliction, such as the subtle afflictions that are not completely eliminated by the practice of yoga, the afflictions do not arise in any way.

original: bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms par ni mi 'gyur ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa snying po la yod pa lta bu gang yang spangs pas mi shes pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms shing shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms par ni mi 'gyur ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa snying po la yod pa lta bu gang yang spangs pas mi shes pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms shing shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one has abandoned the subtle aspects of the obscurations of knowledge, such as the subtle aspects of the obscurations of knowledge that are present in the essence, the latent states of ignorance are completely destroyed and the wisdom that engages all objects of knowledge without obscuration arises.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the śrāvakas presented?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / rgyu gsum gyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu gsum gyis te /
translated: By three causes:

original: sprul pa dang / smon lam dang / chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / smon lam dang / chos nyid kyis so //
translated: emanation, aspiration, and reality.

original: de la sprul pa ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas de dang der nyan thos sprul pa sprul par mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sprul pa ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas de dang der nyan thos sprul pa sprul par mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Emanation is when the Tathagata emanates a disciple in such and such a place, through the power of those to be trained.

original: de la smon lam ni gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa par smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: de la smon lam ni gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa par smon lam btab pa /
translated: Vow is when a person makes a vow to be a disciple.

original: nyan thos zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Buddha designates them as disciples.

original: de la chos nyid ni gang zag gang rang bzhin gyis snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa de rgyu de gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don kyang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gang zag gang rang bzhin gyis snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa de rgyu de gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don kyang mi 'dod la /
translated: Reality is when a person has little natural compassion and is afraid of suffering. For those two reasons, they do not desire the welfare of others.

original: gzhan dag gi don du 'khor ba yang mi 'dod pas de la chos nyid des nyan thos su 'dogs par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don du 'khor ba yang mi 'dod pas de la chos nyid des nyan thos su 'dogs par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Since they do not desire samsara for the sake of others, the Buddha designates them as disciples by that reality.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i chos can yin yang rnam par @16a * //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i chos can yin yang rnam par @16a * //
translated: Even though they have the quality of fully awakening, they do not fully awaken.

original: gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la skrag pa'i rnam pas shas cher 'jug pas des na de yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la skrag pa'i rnam pas shas cher 'jug pas des na de yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva is the opposite of the śrāvaka, because he is not afraid of the truths to be realized, and because he is engaged in the realization of the truth of the highest meaning.

original: nyan thos ji lta ba bzhin du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang de bzhin te /🔽de ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyan thos ji lta ba bzhin du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang de bzhin te / de ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bas /
translated: The pratyekabuddha is like the śrāvaka,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: because he is not afraid of the truths to be realized, but he is superior to the śrāvaka, because he can realize the truth without the appearance of a Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pa'i rgyu gsum kho nas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pa'i rgyu gsum kho nas blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is to be seen as the opposite of the śrāvaka for three reasons.

original: ji ltar nyan thos chos 'dul ba las rab tu nyams pa yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos chos 'dul ba las rab tu nyams pa yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is the śrāvaka to be seen as having fallen away from the Dharma and Vinaya?

original: gal te nyon mongs pa'i rims nad med pa tsam 'gog pa yin par yongs su rtog pa na /🔽bdag chad par 'gyur ro //🔽chud zos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa'i rims nad med pa tsam 'gog pa yin par yongs su rtog pa na / bdag chad par 'gyur ro // chud zos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he imagines that cessation is merely the absence of the sickness of the defilements,🔽he is afraid that he will be annihilated,🔽that he will be destroyed,

original: mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du skrag pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du skrag pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: that he will not exist.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is:

original: dper na mi la la zhig rims kyis btab par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig rims kyis btab par gyur pa na /
translated: For example, suppose a person is afflicted by a fever.

original: de rims nad byung na rnams thams cad du nad med par 'gyur ba mi shes pas lus thams cad 'gag par 'gyur bar yongs su rtog cing skrag par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de rims nad byung na rnams thams cad du nad med par 'gyur ba mi shes pas lus thams cad 'gag par 'gyur bar yongs su rtog cing skrag par gyur pa na /
translated: Not knowing that when the fever breaks, the illness will be gone, he imagines that his entire body is paralyzed and becomes frightened.

original: rims kyi nad las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rims kyi nad las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: He will not be cured of the fever.

original: de ltar de rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar nyan thos kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar nyan thos kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the Hearers should be seen as being like that.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po las rab tu nyams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po las rab tu nyams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do the Bodhisattvas fall away from the Great Vehicle?

original: gal te chos rnams kyi zab pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa thos nas rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i rims nad med par yongs su rtog cing /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi zab pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa thos nas rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i rims nad med par yongs su rtog cing /
translated: If, having heard about the profundity and essencelessness of phenomena, they imagine that they are free of the fever of the afflictions by nature,

original: bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa ste /
translated: and if they become conceited, thinking that they are free of illness,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na mi rims kyis btab par gyur ba de nyid bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa na /
analyzed: dper na mi rims kyis btab par gyur ba de nyid bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa na /
translated: For example, a person who is afflicted with a fever imagines himself to be free from illness.

original: rims kyi nad las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rims kyi nad las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: He is not freed from the fever,

original: rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' de yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //🔽dngos po lnga po de dag las du zhig 'jig tshogs yin /
analyzed: rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' de yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // dngos po lnga po de dag las du zhig 'jig tshogs yin /
translated: and he is even worse off. The bodhisattva should be viewed in the same way.

original: du zhig 'jig tshogs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'jig tshogs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Among these five things, how many are the perishing aggregates and how many are not the perishing aggregates?

original: smras pa / rgyu mtshan ni gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu mtshan ni gnyi ga yin no //
translated: It is said: The reason is both.

original: gnyis ni 'jig tshogs yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'jig tshogs yin no //
translated: Two are the perishing aggregates.

original: gcig ni 'jig tshogs ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni 'jig tshogs ma yin no //
translated: One is not the perishing aggregates.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gnyi ga yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gnyi ga yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Suchness should be said to be neither.

original: 'jig tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du srid pa dang / 'jig rten pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du srid pa dang / 'jig rten pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Existence and the world should be viewed in the same way as the perishing aggregates.

original: de kho na bzhi dang dngos @16b po lnga po dag las dngos po lngas de khon du dag bsdus she na /
analyzed: de kho na bzhi dang dngos @16b po lnga po dag las dngos po lngas de khon du dag bsdus she na /
translated: Among these four realities and five things, by how many of the five things are the four realities included?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na dang / rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na ni dngos po gsum gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na dang / rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na ni dngos po gsum gyis bsdus so //
translated: It is said: The reality that is renowned in the world and the reality that is renowned through reasoning are subsumed by three things.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ni dngos po gnyis kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ni dngos po gnyis kyis bsdus so //
translated: The reality that is the domain of the wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions and the reality that is the domain of the wisdom that purifies the obstructions to omniscience are subsumed by two things.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang dngos po lnga po dag las /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang dngos po lnga po dag las /
translated: From among the four thorough investigations and the five things,

original: dngos po lngas yongs su tshol ba du dag bsdus she na /
analyzed: dngos po lngas yongs su tshol ba du dag bsdus she na /
translated: how many thorough investigations are subsumed by how many things?

original: smras pa / rnam par rtog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas yongs su tshol ba bzhi po thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rtog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas yongs su tshol ba bzhi po thams cad bsdus so //
translated: It is said: All four thorough investigations are subsumed by proper mental activity that is conceptual.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa bzhi dang dngos po lnga po dag las dngos po du dag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa du dag bsdus she na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa bzhi dang dngos po lnga po dag las dngos po du dag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa du dag bsdus she na /
translated: From among the four thorough knowledges that are in accordance with reality and the five things, by how many things are how many thorough knowledges that are in accordance with reality subsumed?

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i shes pas bzhi po thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i shes pas bzhi po thams cad bsdus so //
translated: He said, “All four are included in right knowledge.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “With what intention did the Lord teach that all dharmas are nondual?”

original: smras pa / dngos po lnga po de dag nyid la tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po lnga po de dag nyid la tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: He said, “He taught with the intention that those very five entities are devoid of essence by way of the nature of verbal expression, and that they are endowed with essence by way of their own individual characteristics.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “With what intention did the Lord teach that all dharmas are essenceless?”

original: smras pa / 'dul ba'i dbang gis de dang der ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum las dgongs nas gsungs te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dul ba'i dbang gis de dang der ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum las dgongs nas gsungs te /
translated: He said, “He taught with the intention that the three types of essencelessness are in all dharmas, in all times, and in all modes of being.”🔽“What are the three types of essencelessness?”

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: He said, “The essencelessness of nature, the essencelessness of arising, and the essencelessness of the ultimate.”

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-entityness of characteristics?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: chos rnams kyi tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the entityness that arises from the conventions of phenomena.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-entityness of arising?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: 'du byed rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba yin gyi /
translated: because conditioned phenomena arise in dependence on conditions, they arise through the power of conditions,

original: rang mi skye ba ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang mi skye ba ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: and not by themselves. This is called the non-entityness of arising.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-entityness of the ultimate?

original: de kho na'i don gyis mtshan nyid dang bral pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyis mtshan nyid dang bral pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Any phenomenon that is devoid of the characteristic of reality is called the non-entityness of the ultimate.

original: dper na dge slong spyod pas rus pa'i keng rus mang po @17a * //
analyzed: dper na dge slong spyod pas rus pa'i keng rus mang po @17a * //
translated: For example, a monk who is practicing meditation may imagine a skeleton,

original: la mos par byas nas rnam par 'jig par ma nus pa na /
analyzed: la mos par byas nas rnam par 'jig par ma nus pa na /
translated: but is unable to make it disappear.

original: rus pa'i keng rus de la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus de la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: It is as though one were constantly and uninterruptedly to perceive the ultimate realitylessness of the skeleton.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang /
translated: Just as the perception of the ultimate unreality of the skeleton constantly and uninterruptedly arises in regard to the skeleton of bones,

original: de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //🔽de la dngos po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // de la dngos po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: so should the ultimate unreality of all things be seen.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pa yang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pa yang /
translated: Among the five things, the five characteristics are not unreal because of the unreality of essence.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: But they are unreal because of the unreality of origination and the ultimate unreality.

original: de yang ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this is appropriate in each case.

original: de la rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa ni gnyis kyis so//
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa ni gnyis kyis so//
translated: Among them, the sign, the name, and the imagination are unreal because of the duality of the imagined.

original: de bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang gis kyang ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang gis kyang ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin te /
translated: Reality is not unreal because of any unreality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de las dgongs nas bden pa gcig ste gnyis pa med par smras zhes tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de las dgongs nas bden pa gcig ste gnyis pa med par smras zhes tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, intending just that, said, “There is one truth, not a second.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: What was the Bhagavat’s intention when he said,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “All things are unproduced, unceasing, originally quiescent, and intrinsically in cessation?”

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kho na las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kho na las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: He said, “I said that intending just the naturelessness of character.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: What was the Bhagavat’s intention when he said,

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “All things are like space?”

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de kho na las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de kho na las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: He said, “I said that intending just the naturelessness of character.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas /
translated: What was the Bhagavat’s intention when he said,

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “All things are like illusions?”

original: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: It was stated with the intention of the lack of entityness of production and the lack of entityness of ultimate reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis je las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis je las dgongs nas /
translated: The Bhagavān, intending the former,

original: gzugs na yod do //
analyzed: gzugs na yod do //
translated: said, “Form exists.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
translated: Consciousness exists.

original: mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: It is seen as impermanent.”

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: He replied: It was stated with the intention of the lack of entityness of character.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rtag pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de ni mi rtag par yod par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de ni mi rtag par yod par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what was said, “It is seen as impermanent,” is the same as saying, “It is seen as existing as impermanent.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: The Bhagavān, intending the latter,

original: gzugs ni yod @17b do ;
analyzed: gzugs ni yod @17b do ;
translated: said, “Form exists.

original: / rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
translated: Consciousness exists.

original: sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: It is seen as suffering.”

original: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: It was in consideration of the fact that there is no essential nature in arising, and the fact that there is no ultimate essential nature, that he said this.

original: gzugs ni yod do //
analyzed: gzugs ni yod do //
translated: The Lord has said, “Form exists,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yod de /
translated: and so on up to consciousness exists.

original: stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: But they are also seen to be empty.”🔽He replied:

original: smras pa / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid dang / de dag nyid kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid dang / de dag nyid kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: It was in consideration of the fact that the characteristics of phenomena are devoid of an essential nature, the fact that there is no essential nature in the arising of those very phenomena, and the fact that there is no ultimate essential nature, that he said this.

original: bral ba nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid las dgongs nas bdag med par gsungs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bral ba nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid las dgongs nas bdag med par gsungs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is with regard to being devoid of an essential nature, so it is with regard to the fact that the characteristics are not similar. It should be seen that he said this intending that there is no self.🔽The Lord has said, “Form exists,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: and so on up to consciousness exists.🔽But they are also seen to be empty.”

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar la tshul bzhin du lta ba dang nges par rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa'i bar du byed pa de la ni tshul bzhin du snang zhing /
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar la tshul bzhin du lta ba dang nges par rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa'i bar du byed pa de la ni tshul bzhin du snang zhing /
translated: The Buddha said that the bodhisattva who properly views, properly ascertains, and properly investigates form up to consciousness sees it as proper,

original: de la med par yang snang ngo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la med par yang snang ngo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: and also sees it as not existing.

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: We say that this was stated with the absence of nature in terms of characteristics in mind.

original: de la gsog dang gsob dang snying po me dpar yang snang ngo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la gsog dang gsob dang snying po me dpar yang snang ngo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: With what intention did the Bhagavān say, “It appears as a fraud, a lie, and as having no essence”?

original: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: We say that this was stated with the absence of nature in terms of arising and the absence of nature in terms of the ultimate in mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: With what intention did the Bhagavān say, “It appears as a fraud, a lie, and as having no essence”?

original: de lta bas na gang la mig kyang 'gag cing kha dog gi 'du shes dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / yid kyi bar yang 'gag cing chos kyi 'du shes dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de rig par bya'o zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang la mig kyang 'gag cing kha dog gi 'du shes dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / yid kyi bar yang 'gag cing chos kyi 'du shes dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de rig par bya'o zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Therefore, the place where the eye ceases and the discrimination of form is removed, up to where the mind ceases and the discrimination of phenomena is removed should be known.

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so //
translated: We say: It is stated without any regard for the lack of intrinsic reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: With what intention did the Bhagavān say,

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du sems kyi 'du shes thams cad rnam par bshig par gyur pa de ci la bsten cing bsam gtan byed pa ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis kyang mi shes so zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du sems kyi 'du shes thams cad rnam par bshig par gyur pa de ci la bsten cing bsam gtan byed pa ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis kyang mi shes so zhes gsungs she na /
translated: “Since all mental discriminations are completely destroyed everywhere, the one who relies on that and practices concentration is not known even by the gods with their superior knowledges”?

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so //
translated: We say: It is stated without any regard for the lack of intrinsic reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs @18a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs @18a * //
translated: With what intention did the Bhagavān say,🔽“The one who relies on that and practices concentration is not known even by the gods with their superior knowledges”?

original: nas ; mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i bar gyi chos yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag la dag pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nas ; mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i bar gyi chos yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag la dag pa nyid dam /
translated: The Buddha also said that the phenomena that are objects of eye consciousness up to and including the phenomena that are objects of mental consciousness, which are the bases of mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, and equanimity, are not pure,

original: bden pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bden pa nyid dam /
translated: not true,🔽not unmistaken,

original: ma nor ba nyid dam /🔽phyin ci ma ma log pa nyid med do zhes kyang gsungs la /🔽'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: ma nor ba nyid dam / phyin ci ma ma log pa nyid med do zhes kyang gsungs la / 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni /
translated: and not unerring.

original: bden pa yin par bka' stsal to zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: bden pa yin par bka' stsal to zhes gsungs she na /
translated: The Buddha also said that the noble transcendent wisdom is true.

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad las dgongs te gsungs pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so ;🔽/ bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad las dgongs te gsungs pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so ; / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji las dgongs nas /
translated: We reply: The Buddha spoke with the thought of the lack of entityness in all things, and he spoke without thinking of any lack of entityness.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs she na /
translated: With what thought did the Bhagavat say that the object of concentration of those in meditative concentration and the object of a buddha are inconceivable?

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad las dgongs te gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad las dgongs te gsungs pa'am /
translated: Response: It is stated with the intention of all three kinds of identitylessness.🔽Or else, it is stated with the intention of any one of the three kinds of identitylessness.

original: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so / dngos po lnga po de dag las ci'i phyir dang po kho nar rgyu mtshan gdags pa la sogs pa go rims de ltar gdags pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang las kyang ma dgongs par gsungs so / dngos po lnga po de dag las ci'i phyir dang po kho nar rgyu mtshan gdags pa la sogs pa go rims de ltar gdags pa mdzad ce na /
translated: Why is the order of imputation of the reason, etc., presented in that way among those five things?

original: smras pa / gzhi med pa la ming gdags su mi rung bas de'i phyir dang por rgyu mtshan gdags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhi med pa la ming gdags su mi rung bas de'i phyir dang por rgyu mtshan gdags pa mdzad do //
translated: Response: Since it is not suitable to impute a name to a nonexistent basis, therefore the reason is imputed first.

original: de'i 'og tu gang gis ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang gis ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa'am /
translated: After that, since that which imputes an essential or

original: bye brag tu 'dogs par las de 'dogs par byed pas /
analyzed: bye brag tu 'dogs par las de 'dogs par byed pas /
translated: a specific attribute imputes that,

original: de'i phyir ming gdags pa mdzad do //🔽de'i 'og tu gang gis rgyu mtshan nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming gdags pa mdzad do // de'i 'og tu gang gis rgyu mtshan nam /
translated: therefore the imputation of names is presented.🔽After that, since the occurrence of the conceptualization that conceptualizes the reason,

original: ming ngam / de gnyi ga la rnam par rtog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bas /
analyzed: ming ngam / de gnyi ga la rnam par rtog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bas /
translated: the name, or both of those,

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gdags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gdags pa mdzad do //
translated: therefore the imputation of conceptualization is presented.

original: de ltar chos gsum po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i go rims yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos gsum po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i go rims yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these three topics completely teach the order of the thoroughly afflicted class.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi skabs yin skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi skabs yin skabs yin no //
translated: After that, the order of the completely purified class is explained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag gis de bzhin nyid mthong ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa mthong na rnam par dag par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag gis de bzhin nyid mthong ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa mthong na rnam par dag par 'gyur bas /
translated: When the suchness that is seen by those thoroughly afflicted phenomena and the suchness that is seen by right knowledge are seen, there is purification.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i go rims yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i go rims yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, those two completely teach the order of the completely purified class.

original: de ltar na de ni de dag gi gom rims yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni de dag gi gom rims yin no //
translated: This is their order.

original: de kho na'i don gyi le'u dngos po'i rnam par gtan @18b la dbang ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi le'u dngos po'i rnam par gtan @18b la dbang ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the meaning of thatness, the perfection of mastery over the categories of things.

original: // / de kho na'i don rnam par shes par 'dod pas /
analyzed: // / de kho na'i don rnam par shes par 'dod pas /
translated: Those who wish to understand the meaning of thatness

original: ngo bo nyid gsum la brtson par bya ba'i sdom ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum la brtson par bya ba'i sdom ni /
translated: should strive in the three natures. The synopsis is:

original: rten dang rnam par dbye ba dang // rten dang rab dbye brten pa dang // phra la mngon par zhen pa dang // ming brjod ji bzhin mngon par zhe na //
analyzed: rten dang rnam par dbye ba dang // rten dang rab dbye brten pa dang // phra la mngon par zhen pa dang // ming brjod ji bzhin mngon par zhe na //
translated: 1. support, 2. analysis, 3. support and analysis, 4. subtle attachment, 5. attachment to the literal meaning of names.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three natures?

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The imagined nature, the dependent nature, and the absolute nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined nature?

original: ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ming dang brda las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ming dang brda las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature that arises from the discrimination of unreal things, such as the postulation of the substantiality of the personal entity and the substantiality of the elements of existence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dependent nature?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature that arises from the other.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: What is the absolute nature?🔽It is the absence of duality in the dependent nature.

original: rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
analyzed: rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
translated: In order to purify, in order to be liberated from all the bonds of signs and bad states, and in order to accomplish all good qualities, the suchness of phenomena is the domain of the noble wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the noble wisdom.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na /
translated: What is the imagined nature?

original: smras pa / rgyu mtshan dang ming 'brel pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu mtshan dang ming 'brel pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
translated: It is that which is well known in the world.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na /🔽smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na / smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
translated: What is the dependent nature?🔽It is that which is the basis for the imagined nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten nas rab tu shes she na /
translated: What is the perfectly established nature?🔽It is the absence of duality in the dependent nature.

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gtan yongs su ma grub pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gtan yongs su ma grub pa la brten nas rab tu shes so //
translated: It is said: The imagined nature is fully known in dependence on the dependent nature, which is not at all established.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa der ni de'i rnam par dag pa 'thob pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa der ni de'i rnam par dag pa 'thob pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: In that regard, the Bhagavat said in the sutra, “Knowledge occurs in dependence on the attachment to the imagined nature.” He said that with the attainment of its purification in mind,

original: de'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with its characteristic in mind.
