original: don 'dir ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don 'dir ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this meaning, its characteristic should be seen.

original: de las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: de las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of imagined natures are there?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is said: In brief, there are five kinds:

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / @19a * //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / @19a * //
translated: The imagination of the nature of an object,

original: ming gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: the essence of name, the essence of the afflicted class, the essence of the purified class, and the essence of neither the afflicted class nor the purified class.

original: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: the essential nature of name, the essential nature of defilement, the essential nature of purification, and the essential nature of neither defilement nor purification.

original: de la don gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la don gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The essential nature of the object is fourfold:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid yongs su rtog pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid yongs su rtog pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: the essential nature of the characteristic, the essential nature of the specific, the essential nature of the apprehended object, and the essential nature of the apprehending subject.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The essential nature of the characteristic is fourfold:🔽the essential nature of form, the essential nature of feeling, the essential nature of conception, and the essential nature of consciousness.

original: dngos po 'di ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essential nature of form is twofold:🔽the essential nature of the form aggregate and the essential nature of the form element.

original: dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid do //🔽dngos po 'di ni mig gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid do // dngos po 'di ni mig gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of form up to consciousness.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the eye up to this is the intrinsic nature of mental phenomena.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the eye consciousness up to this is the intrinsic nature of the mental consciousness.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the realm of desire up to this is the intrinsic nature of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dngos po 'di ni chos kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs par yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni chos kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs par yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the perfection of giving up to this is the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the applications of mindfulness up to this is the intrinsic nature of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the fruit of a stream-enterer up to this is the intrinsic nature of the supreme enlightenment.

original: gzugs 'di ni yid du 'ong ba'o //🔽'di ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni yid du 'ong ba'o // 'di ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the past up to this is the intrinsic nature of the future.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the conditioned up to this is the intrinsic nature of the unconditioned.

original: 'di ni yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa'o //🔽'di ni bstan du yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa'o // 'di ni bstan du yod pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the internal up to this is the intrinsic nature of the external.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the internal and external.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the wholesome up to this is the intrinsic nature of the indeterminate.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the past up to this is the intrinsic nature of the future.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the conditioned up to this is the intrinsic nature of the unconditioned.

original: 'di ni bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan du med pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the internal up to this is the intrinsic nature of the external.

original: 'di ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the internal and external.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the wholesome up to this is the intrinsic nature of the indeterminate.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the past up to this is the intrinsic nature of the future.

original: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the conditioned up to this is the intrinsic nature of the unconditioned.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the internal up to this is the intrinsic nature of the external.

original: 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o // 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the internal and external.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the wholesome up to this is the intrinsic nature of the indeterminate.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the past up to this is the intrinsic nature of the future.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the conditioned up to this is the intrinsic nature of the unconditioned.

original: 'di ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas so //
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of the internal up to this is the intrinsic nature of the external.🔽This is the intrinsic nature of the internal and

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis gzugs de gcig pu'i bye brag la yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis gzugs de gcig pu'i bye brag la yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This is unconditioned.🔽This is the form aggregate.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: This is the feeling aggregate.🔽This is the perception aggregate.

original: phung po lhag ma rnams dang skye mched thams cad la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //🔽de la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma rnams dang skye mched thams cad la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // de la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the formation aggregate.🔽This is the consciousness aggregate.🔽This is the eye base.

original: gzugs 'di ni mig gi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni mig gi gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the form base.🔽This is the eye-consciousness base.🔽This is the ear base.🔽This is the sound base.🔽This is the ear-consciousness base.🔽This is the nose base.🔽This is the smell base.🔽This is the nose-consciousness base.🔽This is the tongue base.🔽This is the taste base.🔽This is the tongue-consciousness base.

original: 'di ni rna ba dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi gzung ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rna ba dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi gzung ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the body base.🔽This is the tangible object base.🔽This is the body-consciousness base.

original: 'di ni gzugs na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the mind base.🔽This is the dharma base.

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the mind-consciousness base.🔽This is the earth element.🔽This is the water element.🔽This is the fire element.🔽This is the wind element.🔽This is the space element.🔽This is the consciousness element.🔽This is the earth aggregate.🔽This is the water aggregate.🔽This is the fire aggregate.🔽This is the wind aggregate.🔽This is the space aggregate.🔽This is the consciousness aggregate.🔽This is the earth sense base.🔽This is the water sense base.🔽This is the fire sense base.🔽This is the wind sense base.🔽This is the space sense base.🔽This is the consciousness sense base.🔽This is the earth constituent.🔽This is the water constituent.🔽This is the fire constituent.🔽This is the wind constituent.🔽This is the space constituent.🔽This is the consciousness constituent.🔽This is the earth truth.🔽This is the water truth.🔽This is the fire truth.🔽This is the wind truth.🔽This is the space truth.🔽This is the consciousness truth.🔽This is the earth accumulation.🔽This is the water accumulation.🔽This is the fire accumulation.🔽This is the wind accumulation.🔽This is the space accumulation.🔽This is the consciousness accumulation.🔽This is the earth stage.🔽This is the water stage.🔽This is the fire stage.🔽This is the wind stage.🔽This is the space stage.🔽This is the consciousness stage.🔽This is the earth sphere.🔽This is the water sphere.🔽This is the fire sphere.🔽This is the wind sphere.🔽This is the space

original: 'di ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i yid @19b kyi gzung ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i yid @19b kyi gzung ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the mental apprehension of the non-associated.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The imagination of the characteristic of the apprehender is as follows:

original: gzugs 'di ni gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This form apprehends form.🔽This form apprehends sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas.

original: gzugs 'di ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This feeling, this discrimination, these formative factors, and this consciousness apprehend form.

original: 'di ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This apprehends sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas.

original: de la ming gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la ming gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The imagination of the nature of a name is twofold:

original: bye brag med pa dang / bye brag can no //
analyzed: bye brag med pa dang / bye brag can no //
translated: that which is not differentiated and that which is differentiated.

original: de la bye brag med pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba'i ming gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bye brag med pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba'i ming gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among those, the non-specific is the name of all phenomena.

original: de la bye brag can ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bye brag can ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among those, the specific is as follows:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ming rab tu dbye ba'i chos so so ba de dag la ming tshad med grangs med par yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ming rab tu dbye ba'i chos so so ba de dag la ming tshad med grangs med par yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The name form, the name feeling, the name perception, the name volitional formations, the name consciousness, and so on, and the name of each of those phenomena that are differentiated in that way, are conceived of as immeasurable and innumerable names.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among those, the conception of the nature of affliction is as follows:

original: gzugs 'di ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang ; gti mug dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ma bral pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang ; gti mug dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ma bral pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: This form is associated with desire, associated with anger, associated with delusion, not free from desire, anger, and delusion, and is devoid of faith and other virtuous qualities.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: These feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness are associated with desire, associated with anger, associated with delusion, not free from desire, anger, and delusion,

original: gti mug dag dang ma bral ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: gti mug dag dang ma bral ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: and are devoid of faith and other virtuous qualities.

original: / de la rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //🔽de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin /
analyzed: / de la rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o // de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin /
translated: The investigation of the nature of purification should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs 'di ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste / gzugs 'di ni gzung ba'o //
translated: The investigation of the nature of neither afflicted nor purified is as follows:

original: 'di ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This form is the apprehended object.🔽This is the apprehending subject.

original: @20a * // chor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: @20a * // chor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed 'di dag dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzung ba'o //
translated: This feeling, this perception, these volitions, and this consciousness are the apprehended object.🔽This is the apprehending subject.

original: 'di ni 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the investigation of indeterminate dharmas as indeterminate dharmas.

original: yang ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the investigation of the nature is to be known as fivefold:

original: ming la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / don la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / ming la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / don la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang /
analyzed: ming la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / don la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / ming la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang / don la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa dang /
translated: the nature of the object based on the name, the nature of the name based on the name, the nature of the object based on the object,

original: de gnyi ga la brten pa'i de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la brten pa'i de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: and the nature of both based on both.

original: de la ming la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ming la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the object based on the name is as follows.

original: gzugs kyi dngos po 'di ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po 'di dang / rnam par shes pa'i dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos po 'di ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po 'di dang / rnam par shes pa'i dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin no zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This entity of feeling, perception, and formation is fully accomplished by the intrinsic reality of formation. This entity of consciousness is fully accomplished by the intrinsic reality of consciousness.

original: de la don la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, conceptualization in regard to the intrinsic reality of names based on objects is as follows:

original: dngos po 'di'i ming ni gzugs zhes bya'i /
analyzed: dngos po 'di'i ming ni gzugs zhes bya'i /
translated: This object is called “form.”🔽This object is not form.

original: dngos po 'di ni gzugs ma yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po 'di'i ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni gzugs ma yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po 'di'i ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i //
translated: This object is called “feeling,” “perception,” “formation,” or “consciousness.”

original: dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de la ming la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o // de la ming la brten pa'i ming gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni /
translated: This is the postulation that this entity is not consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Postulation that the nature of a name is based on a name is as follows:

original: dngos po ma rtogs pa'i ming gzugs zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po ma rtogs pa'i ming tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: dngos po ma rtogs pa'i ming gzugs zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po ma rtogs pa'i ming tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams /
translated: This is the postulation that conceptualizes the name form when the entity is not understood, and the postulation that conceptualizes the names feeling, perception, volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and consciousness when the entities are not understood.

original: de la don la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don la brten pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Postulation that the nature of an entity is based on an entity is as follows:

original: ming las ma gtogs @20b pa'i gzugs kyi dngos po la ming dmigs kyis ma bsal bar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / ming ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po dang /
analyzed: ming las ma gtogs @20b pa'i gzugs kyi dngos po la ming dmigs kyis ma bsal bar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / ming ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po dang /
translated: It is the imagination that imagines a thing called form, which is not distinguished from its name, and the imagination that imagines a thing called feeling, perception, and formation, which is not distinguished from its name.

original: ming ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dngos po la ming dmigs kyis ma bsal bar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dngos po la ming dmigs kyis ma bsal bar rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the imagination that imagines a thing called consciousness, which is not distinguished from its name.

original: de la de gnyi ga la brten pa'i de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de gnyi ga la brten pa'i de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The imagination of the nature of both, based on both, is as follows.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di'i ming ni gzugs zhes bya'o zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di'i ming ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di'i ming ni gzugs zhes bya'o zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di'i ming ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa'o // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The conception that this entity which has the nature of form is called 'form,' and the conception that this entity which has the nature of feeling, conceptualization, volitional factors, and consciousness is called 'consciousness.'

original: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The grasping of the imagined reality is to be understood in brief as twofold:

original: mngon par 'du byed pas 'dzin pa dang / ming gi brdas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas 'dzin pa dang / ming gi brdas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: grasping through the formative forces and grasping through verbal designation.

original: de la mngon par 'du byed pas 'dzin pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'du byed pas 'dzin pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, grasping through the formative forces should be understood as fivefold:

original: rjes su chags pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / khong khro ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / phrad pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / 'bral ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / khong khro ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / phrad pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / 'bral ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: the formative influence of attachment, the formative influence of anger, the formative influence of contact, the formative influence of separation and the formative influence of indifference.

original: de la ming gi brdas 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ming gi brdas 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The apprehension of the conventional should be understood as twofold:

original: yi ge med pa las gyur pa dang / yi ge las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge med pa las gyur pa dang / yi ge las gyur pa'o //
translated: that which is based on the name and that which is based on the letter.🔽That which is based on the name is again twofold:🔽that which is based on the name without letters and that which is based on the name with letters.

original: de la yi ge med pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge med pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is based on the name without letters is, for example,🔽when one apprehends by asking: “What is this?

original: 'di ci yin /🔽'di ci lta bu yin zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ci yin / 'di ci lta bu yin zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is this like?

original: de la yi ge las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is based on the name with letters is, for example,

original: 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: when one apprehends by saying: “This is this and that is like this,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: it is called form,🔽it is called feeling,🔽it is called perception,🔽it is called the formative forces,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes ba'am /
translated: it is called consciousness,

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: it is called conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'am /🔽rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'am / rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: it is called unconditioned,🔽it is called permanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: it is called impermanent,

original: dge zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dge zhes bya ba'am /
translated: It is the grasping of the five aggregates of clinging as virtuous,

original: mi dge zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge zhes bya ba'am /
translated: nonvirtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: indeterminate,

original: de lta de lta bu la sogs par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta de lta bu la sogs par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or as such and such.

original: phra pa la mngon par zhen pa phra ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phra pa la mngon par zhen pa phra ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The subtle clinging to the subtle is to be understood as these five:

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par @21a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par @21a * //
translated: clinging to the impermanent as permanent,

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar mngon par zhen pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar mngon par zhen pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang / mtshan ma la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o /🔽// / bam po sum cu lnga pa /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar mngon par zhen pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar mngon par zhen pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang / mtshan ma la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o / // / bam po sum cu lnga pa /
translated: clinging to suffering as happiness, clinging to the impure as pure, clinging to the selfless as having a self, and clinging to the imagined nature as the real nature.

original: de la byis pa rnams ni brjod par bya ba'i dngos po la rgyu lngas ming ji lta ba dang brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa rnams ni brjod par bya ba'i dngos po la rgyu lngas ming ji lta ba dang brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the childish are to be understood as clinging to the nature of things just as they are named and described, due to five causes.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang yin zhes dris na /
translated: If asked, “What is the intrinsic reality of this thing?”

original: ngo bo nyid gzugs yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzugs yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed kyi /
translated: they would answer, “Its intrinsic reality is form,”🔽but they would not answer, “Its name is form.”

original: ming gzugs yin no zhes lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed kyi /
analyzed: ming gzugs yin no zhes lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed kyi /
translated: They would answer, “Its intrinsic reality is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,”🔽but they would not answer, “Its name is consciousness.”

original: ming rnam par shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / gzhan yang gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: ming rnam par shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / gzhan yang gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: Moreover, when they go to a solitary place

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa la zhugs pa na /
translated: and engage in analysis of the specific and general characteristics of phenomena,

original: dngos po 'di'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs yin gyi //
analyzed: dngos po 'di'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs yin gyi //
translated: they think, “The specific characteristic of this thing is form.”

original: ming ni gzugs ma yin no zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / dngos po 'di'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ming ni gzugs ma yin no zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / dngos po 'di'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: They investigate, “The name is not form.”🔽They investigate, “The defining characteristic of this thing is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The name is not consciousness.”

original: ming ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / gzhan yang gzugs kyi dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ming ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / gzhan yang gzugs kyi dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when they investigate the defining characteristic of that thing called form,

original: ma rnyed pa na mi dga' la /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa na mi dga' la /
translated: they are unhappy when they do not find it.

original: ming gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ming gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they investigate the name as form,🔽they are not unhappy when they do not find it.

original: ma rnyed pa ni mi dga' ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa ni mi dga' ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i dngos po de'i mtshan nyid gzugs yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they investigate the defining characteristic of that thing called feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: ma tshe / ma rnyed pa la mi dga' la /
analyzed: ma tshe / ma rnyed pa la mi dga' la /
translated: they are unhappy when they do not find it.

original: rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When he searches for consciousness,🔽he does not find it and is not disappointed.

original: ma rnyed na ni mi dga' ba med pa dang / gzhan yang tshig ni ming ni don la 'jug la ming ni don la 'jug ste /🔽de la ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa de ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid @21b kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma rnyed na ni mi dga' ba med pa dang / gzhan yang tshig ni ming ni don la 'jug la ming ni don la 'jug ste / de la ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa de ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid @21b kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin /
translated: Moreover, the word is the name that expresses the object, and the name expresses the object.🔽The name that expresses the object of the specific characteristic does not express the object of the universal characteristic.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin /🔽'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The name that expresses the object of the universal characteristic does not express the object of the specific characteristic.🔽The name that expresses the object of the apprehended characteristic does not express the object of the apprehending characteristic.🔽The name that expresses the object of the apprehending characteristic does not express the object of the apprehended characteristic.

original: ming gang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don gsal bar byed pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bar gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ming gang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don gsal bar byed pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bar gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The name that expresses the object of the apprehended characteristic does not express the object of the specific characteristic.

original: gal te ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don la yang 'jug par 'gyur na ni des na de las gzhan pa'i ming rnams kyi don so so tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur🔽ba mi dmigs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don la yang 'jug par 'gyur na ni des na de las gzhan pa'i ming rnams kyi don so so tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba mi dmigs par mi rung ngo //
translated: If the name that engages the object of its own character also engages the object of the character of apprehension, then the individual different objects of the other names would not be suitable not to be observed.

original: de ltar so so'i don tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i ming de dag las ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don la 'jug pa dang / ming gang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba de /🔽de ltar yod pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar so so'i don tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i ming de dag las ming gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don la 'jug pa dang / ming gang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar gyi don la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba de / de ltar yod pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ram /
translated: Thus, from among those names that engage individual different objects, the name that engages the object of its own character and the name that engages the object of the character of apprehension would

original: 'on te med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: engage an existent object or would engage a nonexistent object.

original: re zhig yod pa'i don la 'jug par ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa'i don la 'jug par ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable for them to engage an existent object.

original: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni sngar dngos po brtags pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni sngar dngos po brtags pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
translated: Why it is not suitable is explained earlier in the section on the examination of things.

original: gal te de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur na ni des na mtshan nyid med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'gyur te /🔽gang mtshan nyid med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i don ni de ltar yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur na ni des na mtshan nyid med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'gyur te / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i don ni de ltar yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If one engages with an object that does not exist in that way, then one engages with an object that lacks a defining characteristic.

original: de ltar gsal bar byed pa de yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gsal bar byed pa de yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object that one engages with is not existent in that way, and the one who engages with it in that way is a superimposer.

original: gang sgro 'dogs shing 'dzin par byed pa de ni mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir ming ji lta ba dang / brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par rab tu grub pa yin pa dang /🔽gzhan yang byis pa thams cad ni mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa yin pa'i phyir ming ji lta ba dang / brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gang sgro 'dogs shing 'dzin par byed pa de ni mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir ming ji lta ba dang / brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par rab tu grub pa yin pa dang / gzhan yang byis pa thams cad ni mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa yin pa'i phyir ming ji lta ba dang / brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: The one who superimposes and apprehends is one who is attached. Therefore, it is established that one is attached to entities as having an essence in accordance with names and expressions.

original: dngos po la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, because all childish beings are bound by the expression of signs, one should view them as being attached to entities as having an essence in accordance with names and expressions.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa nyid du rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa nyid du rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one know that one is bound by verbal expression of signs?

original: smras pa / rigs pa dang lung gis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs pa dang lung gis rig par bya ste /
translated: It is said: One should know by reasoning and scripture.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / brjod pa med pa na dngos po la mngon par dga' ba mi dmigs pa dang / brjod pa dang bcas pa na de la mngon par dga' ba mi dmigs @22a * //
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na / smras pa / brjod pa med pa na dngos po la mngon par dga' ba mi dmigs pa dang / brjod pa dang bcas pa na de la mngon par dga' ba mi dmigs @22a * //
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: When there is no verbal expression, one does not observe delight in things, and when there is verbal expression, one does not observe delight in that.

original: de ni rgyu cig yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu cig yin no //
translated: This is one cause.

original: gzhan yang gcig gi skye ba'i gnas gcig yin pa'i phyir te /🔽'di ltar dngos po la brten nas brjod pa skye ba yang dmigs la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gcig gi skye ba'i gnas gcig yin pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar dngos po la brten nas brjod pa skye ba yang dmigs la /
translated: Moreover, it is because there is one abode of the arising of one.🔽Thus, one observes the arising of verbal expression in dependence on things,

original: brjod pa la brten nas kyang dngos po skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brjod pa la brten nas kyang dngos po skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir te 'di lta ste /
translated: and one observes the arising of things in dependence on verbal expression.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa dag dngos po yod na /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa dag dngos po yod na /
translated: For example, worldly people, when things exist,

original: ming du yang brjod pas rab tu rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: ming du yang brjod pas rab tu rtog par byed kyi /
translated: conceive by verbal expression,

original: dngos po med pa la ni yongs su rtog par mi nus pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni yongs su rtog par mi nus pas /
translated: but they cannot conceive when things do not exist.

original: de ltar na dngos po la brten nas ming dang brjod pa skye bar dmigs pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po la brten nas ming dang brjod pa skye bar dmigs pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, it is observed that names and expressions arise in dependence on things.

original: dper na bsam gtan ba so so'i bdag nyid la bsam gtan byed pa na /
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan ba so so'i bdag nyid la bsam gtan byed pa na /
translated: For example, when a meditator is practicing concentration,

original: ji lta ji ltar yid la brjod pa'i yid la byed pa de lta de ltar sems kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan dag snang bar 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar yid la brjod pa'i yid la byed pa de lta de ltar sems kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan dag snang bar 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: the mental image that is consistent with the object of knowledge that is included in the mindstream arises in such a way that it appears to the mental expression that is focused on the object.

original: de ltar na brjod pa la brten nas dngos po skye ba yang dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod pa la brten nas dngos po skye ba yang dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is observed that things arise in dependence on expressions.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa'i gnyen po mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la sems nye bar gtod pa'i mtshan ma thams cad ni mi snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa'i gnyen po mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la sems nye bar gtod pa'i mtshan ma thams cad ni mi snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, when the mind is focused on the sphere of signlessness, which is the antidote to expressions, all signs do not appear.

original: nye bar mi gtod pa'i sems ni mi 'dod pa bzhin du mtshan ma rnams kyis khrid par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nye bar mi gtod pa'i sems ni mi 'dod pa bzhin du mtshan ma rnams kyis khrid par 'gyur bas /
translated: But when the mind is not focused, the mind is led by signs against its will.

original: rnam grangs des kyang mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang mtshan ma la brjod pas bcings pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this enumeration, it should be understood that one is bound by verbal expression in regard to signs.

original: lung gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung gang zhe na /
translated: What is scripture?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis //
translated: The Lord has said:

original: byis pa rmongs pa'i sems ldan pa //
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa'i sems ldan pa //
translated: The childish, whose minds are confused,

original: mtshan ma dag la brjod pas bcings //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag la brjod pas bcings //
translated: are bound by verbal expression in regard to signs.

original: brjod pa'i 'ching las rnam grol ba /
analyzed: brjod pa'i 'ching las rnam grol ba /
translated: Those who are liberated from the bondage of verbal expression

original: mtshan ma'i dbang ldan thub pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i dbang ldan thub pa yin //
translated: are sages who are not under the influence of signs.

original: yang dag mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who sees reality

original: yang dag shes la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: yang dag shes la rab tu gnas //
translated: is well-established in right knowledge.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing //
translated: The essence is not observed

original: de yi gnas kyang mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi gnas kyang mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: and its basis is not seen.

original: yang dag shes pa rnam dag de //
analyzed: yang dag shes pa rnam dag de //
translated: That right knowledge is pure

original: des na yang dag pa rig ces bya //
analyzed: des na yang dag pa rig ces bya //
translated: and therefore called right knowledge.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis dang rnam bral ba //
translated: Free from the two graspings,

original: des na gnyis su med ces bya //
analyzed: des na gnyis su med ces bya //
translated: it is called non-dual.

original: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na so so'i skye bo phung po rnams la bdag med pa la mkhas pa ni phung po tsam la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa tsam nyid du lta yang /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo phung po rnams la bdag med pa la mkhas pa ni phung po tsam la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa tsam nyid du lta yang /
translated: For example, ordinary beings who are skilled in the selflessness of the aggregates view the aggregates as mere imputations as a self,

original: de'i bdag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: but because they have not abandoned the sleep of self,

original: de la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung @22b ba yang ma yin pa bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung @22b ba yang ma yin pa bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: their clinging to a self does not arise.

original: sdom ni / bsdu dang ngo bo nyid dang ni //
analyzed: sdom ni / bsdu dang ngo bo nyid dang ni //
translated: The summary is:🔽The three natures, the five dharmas, the two selflessnesses,🔽the three knowledges, the four purities,

original: yongs su shes dang dgongs pa dang // spyod yul rtog dang rjes 'jug dang // rnam par rten ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: yongs su shes dang dgongs pa dang // spyod yul rtog dang rjes 'jug dang // rnam par rten ni tha ma yin //
translated: the ten masteries, and the two embodiments of a buddha.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum dang rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa chos lnga po dag las ngo bo nyid dang po chos lnga po de dag las du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum dang rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa chos lnga po dag las ngo bo nyid dang po chos lnga po de dag las du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: From among the three natures and the five dharmas such as the character base, name, and conception, by how many of the five dharmas is the first nature included?

original: smras pa / gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
translated: It is said: It is not included by any.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many is the second nature included?

original: smras pa / bzhis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bzhis so //
translated: He says: By four.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum pa du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many is the third nature included?

original: smras pa / gcig gis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gis so //
translated: He says: By one.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas bsdus pa yang yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas bsdus pa yang yin na /
translated: If the other-dependent nature is also included in the knowledge of reality,

original: des na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhe gang smras pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ro zhe gang smras pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: then how is it that the other-dependent nature is known in dependence on the attachment to the imagined nature?

original: smras pa / der ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la bsams pa yin gyi /🔽rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / der ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la bsams pa yin gyi / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba las ni ma yin te /
translated: He says: There, the other-dependent nature that is the cause of affliction is meant,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: not the other-dependent nature that is the cause of purification.🔽The other-dependent nature that is the cause of purification

original: de la mngon par ma zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par ma zhen pa la brten nas shes par 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: is known in dependence on the non-attachment to that.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la /
translated: The three natures and the three types of naturelessness are the naturelessness of character, the naturelessness of production, and the ultimate naturelessness.

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //🔽de la skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin no // de la skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: The imagined nature is natureless in terms of the naturelessness of character.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /🔽rang mi skye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin te / rang mi skye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dependent nature is natureless in terms of the naturelessness of production and ultimate naturelessness.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kho nas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kho nas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: The perfected nature is natureless only in terms of ultimate naturelessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag las du zhig yongs su @23a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro // ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag las du zhig yongs su @23a * //
translated: because it is the ultimate of all phenomena and because it is distinguished by the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: shes par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many of the three natures are to be understood?

original: smras pa / thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad do //
translated: All of them.

original: du zhig spang bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig spang bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are to be eliminated?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: One.

original: du zhig thob par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig thob par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are to be attained?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽ngo bo nyid gsum pa de dag gis drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad kyi don kyang drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // ngo bo nyid gsum pa de dag gis drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad kyi don kyang drang bar bya'o //
translated: One.🔽The meaning of all the sutras of interpretable meaning should be interpreted in terms of these three natures.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa tshad med pa brtan pa dang ldan pa dag dang byang chub sems dpas dgongs te bshad pa dag gi don kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa tshad med pa brtan pa dang ldan pa dag dang byang chub sems dpas dgongs te bshad pa dag gi don kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the limitless teachings of the Tathagata, which are based on the three natures, should be understood by the bodhisattvas.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa de'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa de'i rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is the formulation of the acceptance of non-arising to be understood?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid gsum gyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid gsum gyis te /
translated: By means of the three natures.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni /
translated: Based on the imagined nature,

original: gzod ma nas mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzod ma nas mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the acceptance of non-arising from the beginning is formulated.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni /
translated: Based on the dependent nature,

original: rang mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rang mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the acceptance of non-arising by itself is formulated.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi dri ma mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi dri ma mi skye ba la bzod pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Based on the perfected nature, the acceptance of the non-arising of the stains of affliction and suffering is formulated.

original: de ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That should be known as the stage of non-retrogression.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag ni /
translated: These three gates of liberation

original: ngo bo nyid gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: are formulated based on the three natures.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go //🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go // gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation is established on the basis of the imagined nature.🔽The wishless gate of liberation is established on the basis of the dependent nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa rnam par gzhag go //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid byis pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la brten nas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa rnam par gzhag go // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid byis pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: The signless gate of liberation is established on the basis of the perfected nature.🔽What is the imagined nature?

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes sam /🔽shes pa gang gi spyod yul ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes sam / shes pa gang gi spyod yul ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is it the object of the cognition of the childish or of the cognition of the noble ones?🔽Is it the object of any cognition?

original: smras pa / gang gi spyod yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi spyod yul yang ma yin te /
translated: It is said: It is not the object of any cognition.

original: mtshan nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of characteristics.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa gang gi spyod yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa gang gi spyod yul yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the dependent nature?

original: smras pa / de gnyi ga'i spyod yul ni yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / de gnyi ga'i spyod yul ni yin mod kyi /
translated: It is said: It is the object of both.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod yul ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of the supramundane knowledge of the āryas.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa gang gi @23b spyod yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa gang gi @23b spyod yul yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the knowledge of the perfected nature?

original: smras pa / 'phags pa'i ye shes kho na'i spyod yul yin no //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa mtshan ma la spyod par brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: smras pa / 'phags pa'i ye shes kho na'i spyod yul yin no // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa mtshan ma la spyod par brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: It is said: It is the object of the knowledge of the āryas alone.

original: mtshan ma med pa la spyod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la spyod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should the yogin who has realized the imagined nature be said to practice with signs or to practice without signs?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i shes pas rtogs pa ni mtshan ma ma spyod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i shes pas rtogs pa ni mtshan ma ma spyod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said: Realization through mundane knowledge is said to be practice with signs.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas rtogs pa ni mtshan ma med pa la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas rtogs pa ni mtshan ma med pa la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Realization through supramundane knowledge is said to be practice without signs.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The dependent nature and the perfected nature should be viewed in the same way as the imagined nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ngo bo nyid gang gi rjes su 'jug ce na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ngo bo nyid gang gi rjes su 'jug ce na /
translated: When a yogin enters into the imagined nature, what nature does he enter into?

original: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ngo bo nyid gang rnam par 'jig par byed ce na /
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ngo bo nyid gang rnam par 'jig par byed ce na /
translated: It is said: He enters into the perfected nature. When a yogin enters into the perfected nature, what nature does he destroy?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: It is said: He destroys the dependent nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of imagined nature are there?

original: smras pa / ji tsam du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag tu 'dogs pa rnam par 'jog pa de tsam du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / ji tsam du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag tu 'dogs pa rnam par 'jog pa de tsam du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is said: As long as the designation of entity and attributes is established in the dependent nature, there are that many kinds of imagined nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ni dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the classification of the imagined nature should be understood as immeasurable.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the manifest clinging to the imagined nature in the relative nature should be understood as twofold:

original: sad pa dang / de la goms pa'i bag chags bag la nyal ba'o //
analyzed: sad pa dang / de la goms pa'i bag chags bag la nyal ba'o //
translated: the manifest and the latent propensities of that habituation.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of relative nature are there?

original: smras pa / 'di'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni rgyu mtshan bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni rgyu mtshan bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: Its classification should be understood according to the signs.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the relative nature is twofold:

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas kun nas bslang ba dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pas kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas kun nas bslang ba dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pas kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: that which is motivated by manifest clinging to the imagined nature and that which is motivated by the absence of such manifest clinging.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of perfect nature are there?

original: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du ro gcig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba rnam par @24a * //🔽gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du ro gcig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba rnam par @24a * // gzhag pa med do //
translated: and because there is no classification of aspects in it.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined nature said to be based on?

original: smras pa / dngos po gsum la ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po gsum la ste /
translated: It is said: It is based on the three things,

original: rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: the causal process, names, and conceptualization.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the dependent nature said to be based on?

original: smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa de nyid dang / bdag gi rgyu mtshan mthun pa la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa de nyid dang / bdag gi rgyu mtshan mthun pa la'o //
translated: It is said: It is based on the very attachment to the imagined nature and on the causal process that is its cause.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang la brten par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the perfected nature said to be based on?

original: mi gnas pa dang / mi rten par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / mi rten par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said: It is said to be based on the nonabiding and the nondependent.

original: sdom ni / med dang las dang phra sogs dang / lus med skye dang mngon zhen dang // yongs su shes dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: sdom ni / med dang las dang phra sogs dang / lus med skye dang mngon zhen dang // yongs su shes dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: nonembodiment, birth, manifest clinging,🔽thorough knowledge, and the afflictions,

original: sdug bsngal 'dra dang brten pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'dra dang brten pa yin //
translated: suffering, and resemblance, and dependence.

original: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the imagined nature did not exist, what faults would there be?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la tha snyad med pa dang / tha snyad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la tha snyad med pa dang / tha snyad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: We reply: There would be no conventional usage with regard to the dependent nature, and there would be no manifest clinging to conventions.

original: de med na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
analyzed: de med na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
translated: If that were not so, there would be no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be no purification.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the dependent nature did not exist, what faults would there be?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyi thams cad du bstsal mi dgos par kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyi thams cad du bstsal mi dgos par kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: We reply: It would be absolutely unnecessary to eliminate the afflictions, and there would be no afflictions at all.

original: de med na rnam par byang ba yang med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na rnam par byang ba yang med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, there would be no purification at all.

original: gal te yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the consummate nature did not exist, what faults would there be?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be utterly impossible for there to be any purification.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
translated: How many functions does the imagined nature have?

original: smras pa / lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lnga ste /
translated: It has five:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa dang / de nyid la tha snyad 'jug par byad pa dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed pa dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa dang / de nyid la tha snyad 'jug par byad pa dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed pa dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: it generates the dependent nature, it causes engagement in conventional expressions, it generates the conception of persons, it generates the conception of phenomena,

original: de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: and it generates the latent propensities of the afflicted mind that are the negative tendencies of both of those.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
translated: How many functions does the dependent nature have?

original: smras pa / lnga kho na ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lnga kho na ste /
translated: It has five:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar byed pa dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo @24b nyid kyi rten byed pa dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar byed pa dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo @24b nyid kyi rten byed pa dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa dang /
translated: It is the basis for the arising of the nature of complete affliction, the basis for the imagined reality and the perfected reality, the basis for the attachment to the personal entity, the basis for the attachment to the dharmas,

original: de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len gyi rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len gyi rten byed pa'o //
translated: and the basis for the negative reflex actions of the latent impressions of the attachment to both of those.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid las du dag byed ce na /
translated: How many functions does the perfected reality have?

original: smras pa / lnga ste ;
analyzed: smras pa / lnga ste ;
translated: It is said: five.

original: de gnyi ga'i las rnam pa lnga po dag gi gnyen po skye ba'i dmigs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i las rnam pa lnga po dag gi gnyen po skye ba'i dmigs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
translated: Because it is the objective support for the arising of the counteragents to the five kinds of function of those two.

original: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should the imagined reality be described as subtle or gross?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / phra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / phra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be described as subtle.

original: phra ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar dka' ba dang / nye bar mtshon dka' ba yang de bzhin no //🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: phra ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar dka' ba dang / nye bar mtshon dka' ba yang de bzhin no // gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
translated: It is also difficult to see and difficult to illustrate just as it is.

original: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should the dependent nature be described as subtle or coarse?

original: smras pa / rags par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rags par brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said: It should be described as coarse,

original: 'on kyang mthong bar dka' ba dang / nye bar mtshon par dka' ba yin no //🔽yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong bar dka' ba dang / nye bar mtshon par dka' ba yin no // yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid phra bar brjod par bya'am /
translated: but it is difficult to see and difficult to illustrate.

original: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rags par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should the consummate nature be described as subtle or coarse?

original: smras pa / mchog tu phra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mchog tu phra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said: It should be described as supremely subtle,

original: mchog tu phra ba ji lta ba bzhin du mchog tu mthong bar dka' ba dang / mchog tu nye bar mtshon par dka' ba yang de bzhin no //🔽ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag las du zhig lus med pa yin la /
analyzed: mchog tu phra ba ji lta ba bzhin du mchog tu mthong bar dka' ba dang / mchog tu nye bar mtshon par dka' ba yang de bzhin no // ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag las du zhig lus med pa yin la /
translated: and it is supremely difficult to see and supremely difficult to illustrate.

original: lus dang bcas pa 'jug par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa 'jug par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: Among those three natures, how many are formless and how many are with form?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: It is said: One is.

original: du zhig lus dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: du zhig lus dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: How many are embodied?

original: lus dang bcas pa dang / lus med par 'jug par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa dang / lus med par 'jug par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are embodied and disembodied?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽du zhig lus dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // du zhig lus dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: One.

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are embodied and do not engage?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽du zhig ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // du zhig ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: One.

original: skyes pa skyed par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa skyed par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not arisen and cause the arisen to arise?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽du zhig skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // du zhig skyes pa yin la /
translated: One.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are arisen and cause the arisen and the non-arisen to arise?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽du zhig skyes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // du zhig skyes pa ma yin la /
translated: One.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag skyes par mi byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag skyes par mi byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not arisen and do not cause the arisen and the non-arisen to arise?

original: smras pa / gcig go //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la /🔽mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta @25a * //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la / mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta @25a * //
translated: One.

original: par bya zhe na /
analyzed: par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the characteristic of non-apprehension and apprehension with regard to the imagined nature be viewed?

original: smras pa / de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /🔽de sad pa la mngon par zhen pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste / de sad pa la mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: He said, “It should be seen in two ways:🔽when one is awake, one may be attached to it,

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / de bag la nyal ba la mngon par zhen pa'am /
