analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / de bag la nyal ba la mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: or one may not be attached to it; and when one is asleep, one may be attached to it,

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: or one may not be attached to it.

original: de la tha snyad kyi brda las byung ba'i ming la chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rtog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de la tha snyad kyi brda las byung ba'i ming la chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rtog par byed pa yin /
translated: “ When one is awake, one may be attached to the essential nature of things as conceived on the basis of names that arise from conventional expressions.

original: de sad pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la ming tsam la mkhas pa 'di ni ming tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: de sad pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la ming tsam la mkhas pa 'di ni ming tsam yin gyi /
translated: One should understand that this is the case when one is awake.🔽“ When one is skilled in mere names, one should understand that this is the case when one is not attached to it, thinking, ‘This is mere names;

original: 'di ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid du ma yin no snyam pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med par yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid du ma yin no snyam pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med par yin par rig par bya'o//
translated: this is not the essential nature of things.’

original: bag chags bag la nyal de ma spangs pa'i phyir ji srid du bag chags gnas ngan len de spongs par mi byed pa de srid du ni de bag la nyal ba mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags bag la nyal de ma spangs pa'i phyir ji srid du bag chags gnas ngan len de spongs par mi byed pa de srid du ni de bag la nyal ba mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: “ As long as one does not eliminate the latent afflictions, one is attached to the latent tendencies.

original: spangs pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spangs pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Abandonment should be understood as the absence of attachment to that.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the characteristics of attachment to the other-dependent nature and the absence of attachment to that?

original: smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid sad pas /
analyzed: smras pa / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid sad pas /
translated: It is said:

original: de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog par byed pa ni dang po'i de la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog par byed pa ni dang po'i de la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: The first attachment to that is the conceptualization of the imagined nature as the essence and the entity of that.

original: mtshan ma tsam ste de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par yongs su rtog par byed pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma tsam ste de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par yongs su rtog par byed pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin no //
translated: The absence of attachment to that is the conceptualization that it is merely a sign, not the essence and the entity of that.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba ma spangs pa mtshan ma la dmigs pa ni gnyis pa'i de la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba ma spangs pa mtshan ma la dmigs pa ni gnyis pa'i de la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: The second attachment to that is the nondiscarding of the bondage of signs, the observation of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching pa spangs pa mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rab tu shes pa mtshan mar mi dmigs pa dang / de'i 'og tu ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching pa spangs pa mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rab tu shes pa mtshan mar mi dmigs pa dang / de'i 'og tu ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: After that, the observation of things as they are should be understood as the absence of attachment to that.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should the characteristic of the thoroughly established nature be viewed, as well as the absence of attachment to it?

original: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni mngon par zhen pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni mngon par zhen pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is said: The thoroughly established nature is only without attachment.

original: dbyings de ni mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyings de ni mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that realm is not the basis for the foundation of attachment.

original: de mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / mngon du ma byas pa la mngon du byas par mngon pa'i nga rgyal @25b dang mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / mngon du ma byas pa la mngon du byas par mngon pa'i nga rgyal @25b dang mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And the pride and clinging to the imagined nature, which is not seen, known, or actualized, should be seen as clinging to the dependent nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the imagined nature be understood?

original: smras pa // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming tsam du yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming tsam du yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: It is said: The imagined nature should be understood as mere name.

original: kun brtags pa tsam dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa tsam dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is mere imagination, without characteristics, without essence, unborn, unceasing, not defiled, not purified,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'das pa ma yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa dang / da ltar byung ba ma yin pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'das pa ma yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa dang / da ltar byung ba ma yin pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is primordially peaceful and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa. It is not past, not future, and not present. It is not possessed and

original: mi ldan pa ma yin pa dang / ma bcings pa dang / ma grol ba dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ma yin pa dang / ma bcings pa dang / ma grol ba dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: not unpossessed. It is not bound and not liberated. It is not happiness and not suffering. It is not even not suffering and not happiness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / thams cad du nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / thams cad du nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Like space, it is of one taste everywhere. It should be understood in terms of such aspects.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhen ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhen ;
translated: How should one understand the other-dependent nature?

original: smras pa / brjod par bya ba 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa las yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / brjod par bya ba 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa las yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood from the inclusion of all the conditioned things that are to be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What are all the things that are to be expressed?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: phung po'i dngos po dang / khams kyi dngos po dang / skye mched kyi dngos po dang / rten cing 'bral bar 'byung ba'i dngos po dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po dang / dbang po'i dngos po dang / las kyi dngos po dang /
translated: the things of the aggregates, the things of the elements, the things of the sense spheres, the things of dependent origination, the things of what is possible and impossible, the things of the faculties, the things of karma,

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang / skye ba'i dngos po dang / ngan 'gro'i dngos po dang / bde 'gro'i dngos po dang / skye gnas kyi dngos po dang / rigs kyi dngos po dang / sems can dmyal ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: the things of the afflictions, the things of the secondary afflictions, the things of birth, the things of the miserable realms, the things of the happy realms, the things of the wombs, the things of the families, the things of the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i dngos po dang / yi dags kyi dngos po dang / gling gi dngos po dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi dngos po dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi dngos po @26a * //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i dngos po dang / yi dags kyi dngos po dang / gling gi dngos po dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi dngos po dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi dngos po @26a * //
translated: the things of animals, the things of hungry ghosts, the things of the continents, the things of the Caturmaharajakayikas, up to the things of the Paranirmitavashavartins,

translated: the realm of the Brahma group of the Brahmapurohita gods, the realm of the Brahmakāyika gods, the realm of the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the realm of the Mahābrahma gods, the realm of the Parīttābha gods, the realm of the Apramāṇābha gods, the realm of the Ābhāsvara gods, the realm of the Parīttaśubha gods, the realm of the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the realm of the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the realm of the Bṛhatphala gods, the realm of the Avṛha gods, the realm of the Atapa gods, the realm of the Sudarśana gods, the realm of the Akaniṣṭha gods, the realm of the Ākāśānantyāyatana gods, up to the realm of the Naiva­saṃjñā­nāsaṃjñāyatana gods, the realm of those who follow trust,🔽the realm of those who follow the teachings, the realm of the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration, the realm of the path of seeing, the realm of the path of meditation, the realm of the result of entering the stream,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi dngos po dang / rang byang chub kyi dngos po dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i dngos po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi dngos po dang / rang byang chub kyi dngos po dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dngos po dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i dngos po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po dang /
translated: up to the realm of arhatship, the realm of individual enlightenment, the realm of perfect enlightenment, the realm of the cessation of conceptualization and sensation, the realm of the perfections,

translated: the things related to the applications of mindfulness, up to the things related to the branches of the path, the things related to the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless meditative absorptions, the things related to the cultivation of the perceptions,🔽the things related to the cultivation of the recollections, the things related to the cultivation of the liberations, the masteries, and the totalities, the things related to the powers, the forms of fearlessness, the forms of knowledge of a specific kind resulting from a vow,

original: bsrungs pa med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe bya dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: bsrungs pa med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe bya dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi dngos po ste /
translated: the absence of protection, the applications of mindfulness, great compassion, the complete destruction of the habitual tendencies, the marks, the minor marks, all the aspects, the knowledge of the most sublime, and all the distinct qualities of a buddha.

analyzed: de dag kyang sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bur shes par bya'o // dbu rdos pa lta bu dang / chu'i chu bur lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang ; chu shing gi sdong po lta bu dang / smyon pa lta bu dang / myos pa lta bu dang / gshed ma lta bu dang / gcin ldud pa'i dgra bo lta bu dang /
translated: They should be understood as being like an illusion, a dream, a mirage, an echo, the moon in the water, a reflection, and a magical creation.🔽They should be understood by means of such synonyms as being like a head wound, like a water bubble, like a mirage, like a plantain tree, like a madman, like one who is intoxicated, like an executioner, like an enemy who has been bound,

original: gzhan gyi bu lta bu dang / sprul gyi prog ma lta bu dang / stong pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben pa dang / gzung ba med pa dang / @26b gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med pa dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag gis yongs su shes par bya'o //

translated: like a borrowed son, like a snake’s coil, and as being empty, signless, void, ungraspable, hollow, void, insubstantial, and so on.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the perfected nature be understood?

original: smras pa / sngar bstan pa'i rnam grangs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sngar bstan pa'i rnam grangs 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the enumeration that was previously taught, namely:

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings shes par bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: suchness, the perfect limit, the realm of phenomena, and so on, and also this:

original: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / gzhi med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rten med pa dang / brjod du med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / gzhi med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rten med pa dang / brjod du med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang /
translated: the formless, the unmanifest, the baseless, the groundless, the non-appearing, the non-cognizant, the non-dependent, the inexpressible, the unelaborated,🔽the unaccepted, the unrejected, and so on.

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag gis yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag gis yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood by these enumerations.

original: ngo bo nyid du gsum po de dag las du zhig bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du gsum po de dag las du zhig bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la /
translated: From among those three natures, how many are not themselves thoroughly afflicted,

original: gzhan kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: but are thoroughly afflicted by others?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: It is said: One.

original: du zhig bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many are only defiled?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: One.

original: du zhig bdag nyid rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: du zhig bdag nyid rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: How many are pure by nature

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyir 'jug pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyir 'jug pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: and are engaged in purification?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: One.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: As with the defiled, so should suffering be understood.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined reality like?

original: smras pa / nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like space.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of dependence like?

original: smras pa / gshed ma dang / phyir rgol ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gshed ma dang / phyir rgol ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a magical creation and like an enemy.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of full perfection like?

original: smras pa / mi zad pa'i gter chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mi zad pa'i gter chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a great treasure and like an utpala flower.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas yongs su brtags par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas yongs su brtags par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: On the basis of what is the imagined constructed?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas so //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas so //
translated: Response: It is based on the dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Based on what is the dependent nature dependent?”

original: smras pa / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas so //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas so //
translated: Response: It is based on causes and conditions.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas yongs su grub pa yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med @27a * //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji la brten nas yongs su grub pa yin zhe na / smras pa / nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med @27a * //
translated: If you ask, “Based on what is the consummate nature consummate?”🔽Response: It is based on the absence of the afflictive and

original: pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid la brten nas so //
analyzed: pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid la brten nas so //
translated: the absence of the suffering of the afflicted, and on permanence.

original: de kho na'i don 'dzin pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin par rig par bya /
analyzed: de kho na'i don 'dzin pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin par rig par bya /
translated: “The wisdom that apprehends the meaning of thatness is nonconceptual.” If that is so, how should it be understood that it is nonconceptual?

original: ci yid la mi byed pa las sam /
analyzed: ci yid la mi byed pa las sam /
translated: Is it nonconceptual because it does not engage the mind?

original: yang dag par 'das pa las sam /
analyzed: yang dag par 'das pa las sam /
translated: Or is it nonconceptual because it transcends?

original: dngos po med pa las sam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las sam /
translated: Or is it nonconceptual because it is a nonentity?

original: rang bzhin las sam /
analyzed: rang bzhin las sam /
translated: Or is it nonconceptual because it is a nature?

original: dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa las rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa las rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
translated: Or is it nonconceptual because it does not form mental formations in relation to an object?

original: gal te yid la mi byed pa las yin na ni des na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te yid la mi byed pa las yin na ni des na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: If it is from non-attention, then it is not suitable to say that it is associated with proper attention.

original: gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / rab tu myos pa rnams la yang de thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / rab tu myos pa rnams la yang de thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that sleep, intoxication, and madness would also be wisdom.

original: gal te yang dag par 'das pa las yin na ni des na khams gsum pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa'i gzhung dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yang dag par 'das pa las yin na ni des na khams gsum pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa'i gzhung dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is from the past, then how could it not contradict the statement that the mind and mental factors of the three realms are conceptual?

original: gal te dngos po med pa las yin na ni des na shes rab sems las byung ba'i chos su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa las yin na ni des na shes rab sems las byung ba'i chos su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is from non-entity, then it would not be a mental factor of wisdom.

original: gal te rang bzhin las yin na ni des na shes rab ngo bo nyid dang / yang dag par rnyog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin las yin na ni des na shes rab ngo bo nyid dang / yang dag par rnyog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is from its nature, then how could wisdom not be by nature uncontaminated and non-conceptual?

original: gal te dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa la yin na ni ni des na rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid la ji ltar skur pa btab par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa la yin na ni ni des na rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid la ji ltar skur pa btab par mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is the case that it is the non-conceptual wisdom that is the object of negation, then how could it be that the non-conceptual wisdom is itself negated?

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag mi rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag mi rigs pa yin na /
translated: If these aspects are not tenable,

original: ji ltar shes rab de rnam par mi rtog pa yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab de rnam par mi rtog pa yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: how should that wisdom be viewed as non-conceptual?

original: smras pa / de ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: Because it is not the case that it is the object of negation.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos de bzhin nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos de bzhin nyid yin la /
translated: Its object is the suchness that is the opposite of entity and non-entity.

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: And that is non-conceptual.

original: de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med kyang sngon gyi shugs kyis gang gi tshe de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med kyang sngon gyi shugs kyis gang gi tshe de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: Even though it is not the object of negation, when the wisdom that is endowed with the samādhi of suchness arises through the force of previous [practice],

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma des mngon sum du 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma des mngon sum du 'dzin par byed de /
translated: at that time it directly apprehends the sign of the object.

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “non-imagination.”

original: de kho na'i don gyi le'u'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi le'u'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs so /
translated: The definitive explanation of the chapter on the meaning of reality is complete.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab @27b pa ni rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab @27b pa ni rgyu lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The inconceivable power of the bodhisattvas should be understood through five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jig rten na dpe dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mthu de sems shin tu sbyang ba byas pa kho na dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang gcig tu cha mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jig rten na dpe dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mthu de sems shin tu sbyang ba byas pa kho na dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang gcig tu cha mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is utterly beyond all speculation, because there is no example in the world for it, because that power is connected only with a well-purified mind, because it is utterly incompatible with a mind on the non-concentrated stages,

original: de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang 'brel pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang 'brel pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is connected with a mind on the concentrated stages.

original: theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos spyod pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos spyod pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the Great Vehicle, these ten Dharma activities of bodhisattvas bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug ste 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug ste 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang / ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Having the bodhisattva collection of scriptures written out in the form of the Mahayana sutras and so on, retaining them, likewise making offerings to them, giving them to others, listening respectfully when they are being taught,

original: bdag nyid klog pa dang / de bzhin du kun chub par lung nod pa dang / lung phog pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / gcig pu dben par song ste sems pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid klog pa dang / de bzhin du kun chub par lung nod pa dang / lung phog pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / gcig pu dben par song ste sems pa dang /
translated: reading them oneself, likewise receiving the oral transmission of them, chanting them aloud, teaching them extensively to others and going to a solitary place and reflecting on them.

original: 'jal ba dang / nye bar rtog par byed pa dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jal ba dang / nye bar rtog par byed pa dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: and by the aspect of cultivation.

original: chos spyod pa bcu po de dag las du zhig bsod nams rgya chen po skye ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos spyod pa bcu po de dag las du zhig bsod nams rgya chen po skye ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: Among these ten Dharma activities, how many are the path for generating great merit?

original: smras pa / thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad do //
translated: It is said: all of them.

original: du zhig sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many are the path of preparation?

original: smras pa / gcig ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig ste dgu pa'o //
translated: It is said: one, the ninth.

original: du zhig sgrib pa'i rnam par dag pa'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig sgrib pa'i rnam par dag pa'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many are the path of purifying obscurations?

original: smras pa / gcig ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig ste bcu pa'o //
translated: It is said: one, the tenth.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The remaining texts of this type of treatise are not seen.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sar theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i skabs su byang chub ni rnam pa lnga po ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa las rig par bya'o zhes ji skad bstan pa de'i rab tu dbye ba gang yin /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sar theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i skabs su byang chub ni rnam pa lnga po ngo bo nyid dang / mthu dang / thabs dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa las rig par bya'o zhes ji skad bstan pa de'i rab tu dbye ba gang yin /
translated: In the chapter on the stage of learning, it is said that the Great Vehicle should be understood from five aspects: nature, power, means, engagement, and disengagement. What is the classification of that?

original: byang chub chen po'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the very essence of great enlightenment?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the transmutation which is superior to that of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya @28a * //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya @28a * //
translated: It should be understood as being fourfold:

original: ste ; 'jug pa'i gnas dang / mi 'jug pa'i gnas dang / shes bya legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ste ; 'jug pa'i gnas dang / mi 'jug pa'i gnas dang / shes bya legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: as the basis for the path of entry, as the basis for the path of no more learning, as the result of the thorough analysis of the knowable, and as the characteristic of the purification of the realm of reality.

original: de la 'jug pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la mnga' ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i gnas ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la mnga' ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The basis for the path of entry is the transmutation of the six sense faculties, because it is the basis for the entry of the supramundane path in the stream of being of the bodhisattva.

original: de de lta ma yin du zin te gnas gyur pa de la ma brten par lam skye par mi 'gyur zhing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de lta ma yin du zin te gnas gyur pa de la ma brten par lam skye par mi 'gyur zhing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, if the path were not based on that transmutation, it would not arise and would not enter the stream of being.

original: gal te gnas gyur pa med kyang /
analyzed: gal te gnas gyur pa med kyang /
translated: If it were to enter without transmutation,

original: 'jug par gyur na ni dang po nyid nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par gyur na ni dang po nyid nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would enter from the very beginning.

original: de la mi 'jug pa'i gnas ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'jug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la mi 'jug pa'i gnas ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'jug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The basis of non-engagement is the basis of the non-engagement of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: de de lta ma yin du zin te gnas gyur ba de la ma brten par rkyen tshogs kyang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'jug pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de lta ma yin du zin te gnas gyur ba de la ma brten par rkyen tshogs kyang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'jug pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, the non-engagement of the afflictions together with their traces would not be observed without depending on that transformation, even when the conditions are assembled.

original: de la shes bya legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni shes bya'i de kho na shes bya'i de bzhin nyid legs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gnas gyur pa de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la shes bya legs par yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni shes bya'i de kho na shes bya'i de bzhin nyid legs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gnas gyur pa de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The result of the thorough examination of objects of knowledge is the thorough knowledge of the reality of objects of knowledge. The result of the thorough knowledge of the suchness of objects of knowledge is that transformation, because

original: de de lta ma yin du zin na sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / dgag par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de lta ma yin du zin na sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / dgag par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: if that were not so, the intrinsic reality of the dharmas of the buddhas would have to be thoroughly known, abandoned, and stopped.

original: de la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir gnas gyur pa de ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par ngag pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir gnas gyur pa de ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par ngag pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the pure dharmadhatu is the transformation of the basis, because it overwhelms all signs.

original: de de lta bu ma yin du zin na mi rtag pa dang bsam du rung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de de lta bu ma yin du zin na mi rtag pa dang bsam du rung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were not so, it would be impermanent and conceivable.

original: de ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught to be nondual by the characteristic of permanence and the characteristic of inconceivability.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yang rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yang rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: That inconceivability should be understood in five ways:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / yul dang / gnas pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid dang / bya ba bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / yul dang / gnas pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid dang / bya ba bsgrub pas so //
translated: by nature, by object, by abiding, by sameness, and by accomplishing activity.

original: de la ji ltar ngo bo nyid las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar ngo bo nyid las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it inconceivable by nature?

original: gzugs sam / gzugs las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par @28b shes pa'am /🔽rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sa'i khams sam /🔽sa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs sam / gzugs las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par @28b shes pa'am / rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sa'i khams sam / sa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams sam /
translated: feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness or other than consciousness,🔽the earth element or other than the earth element,

original: rlung gi khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mig gi skye mched dam /
analyzed: rlung gi khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mig gi skye mched dam /
translated: the water element, the fire element, the wind element, or other than the wind element,🔽the eye base or other than the eye base,

original: mig gi skye mched las gzhan zhes bya ba de lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched dam /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched las gzhan zhes bya ba de lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched dam /
translated: the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind base or other than the mind base,

original: yid kyi skye mched las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dngos po'am /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dngos po'am /
translated: The mental sense-sphere is inconceivable.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Existence and non-existence are inconceivable.

original: de la ji ltar yul las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /🔽'dod pa'i khams sam /🔽'dod pa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: de la ji ltar yul las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na / 'dod pa'i khams sam / 'dod pa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: How is the object inconceivable?🔽The desire realm is inconceivable.🔽The form realm is inconceivable.

original: gzugs kyi khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams sam /🔽gzugs med pa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams sam / gzugs med pa'i khams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi rnams sam /
translated: The formless realm is inconceivable.🔽Humans are inconceivable.

original: mi rnams las gzhan nam /🔽lha rnams sam /🔽lha rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / shar phyogs sam /
analyzed: mi rnams las gzhan nam / lha rnams sam / lha rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / shar phyogs sam /
translated: Non-humans are inconceivable.🔽Gods are inconceivable.🔽The east is inconceivable.

original: shar phyogs las gzhan nam /
analyzed: shar phyogs las gzhan nam /
translated: The west is inconceivable.

original: lho dang / nub dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams sam /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams sam /
translated: south,🔽west,🔽below,🔽above,🔽and in the intermediate directions.

original: phyogs mtshams rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: the south, the west, the nadir, the zenith, the intermediate directions, or other than the directions.

original: de la ji ltar gnas pa las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na //🔽bde bar gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / zhi bar gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas pa 'di dang /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gnas pa las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na // bde bar gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / zhi bar gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas pa 'di dang /
translated: How is it inconceivable in terms of abiding?🔽It is inconceivable in terms of abiding in such and such a way through abiding in bliss, in terms of abiding in such and such a way through abiding in peace, in terms of abiding in such and such a way through abiding with mind,

original: 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de @29a * //
analyzed: 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de @29a * //
translated: and in terms of abiding in such and such a way through abiding without mind.

original: ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'di dang 'di lta bus gnas so zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is inconceivable that they abide in such and such divine abodes and they abide in such and such pure abodes.

original: de la ji ltar gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gcig pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it inconceivable in terms of identity and difference?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽zag pa med pa'i dbyings gcig la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ci gcig pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / zag pa med pa'i dbyings gcig la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ci gcig pa nyid yin nam /
translated: It is as follows.

original: tha dad pa nyid yin zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid yin zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: It is inconceivable that the Buddhas abiding in the one uncontaminated realm are identical or different.

original: de la ji ltar bya ba bsgrub pa las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bya ba bsgrub pa las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it inconceivable in terms of the accomplishment of action?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa khams mnyam pa dang / ye shes dang / mgyogs pa dang / stobs dang / pha rol gnon pa mnyam pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa rnams gnas gyur pa de nyid la brten nas 'di lta 'di ltar sems can gyi don dang sems can gyi bya ba mdzad do zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa khams mnyam pa dang / ye shes dang / mgyogs pa dang / stobs dang / pha rol gnon pa mnyam pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa rnams gnas gyur pa de nyid la brten nas 'di lta 'di ltar sems can gyi don dang sems can gyi bya ba mdzad do zhes bya ba de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no
translated: That is inconceivable.

original: // de yang rgyu gnyis kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: // de yang rgyu gnyis kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be seen as inconceivable due to two causes:

original: brjod du med pa'i don gyis tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pas de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis 'jig rten na de'i dpe med pas de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i don gyis tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pas de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis 'jig rten na de'i dpe med pas de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: it is inconceivable because it transcends the domain of words by the meaning of inexpressibility, and it is inconceivable because there is no example for it in the world by being supramundane.

original: mthu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthu gang zhe na /
translated: What is power?

original: mdor bsdu na dbang bcu la mthu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na dbang bcu la mthu zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, power is called the ten masteries.🔽They are mastery over:

original: tshe la dbang ba la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: life,

original: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the methods?

original: mdor bsdu na sprul pa rnam pa bzhi ni thabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sprul pa rnam pa bzhi ni thabs zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, the four kinds of emanations are called methods.

original: sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ripen those sentient beings who are not yet ripe,🔽bodhisattvas emanate as beings in various states of existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sprul pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sprul pa'i thabs yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sprul pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sprul pa'i thabs yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: In order to liberate those sentient beings who are ripe, they emanate as the body of a tathagata in a billion worlds in a billion Jambudvipas in a billion great trichiliocosms.

original: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams la de sprul pa ste /
translated: They emanate as shravakas for those who are to be guided by shravakas, and they emanate as pratyekabuddhas for those who are to be guided by pratyekabuddhas.

original: @29b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyogs bcur sprul pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag la thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @29b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyogs bcur sprul pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag la thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, should be seen as having the power of the four kinds of magical emanations, without obstruction, in the ten directions.

original: de la 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is engagement?

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bltar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bltar bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as twofold:

original: de'i mod la 'jug pa dang / de gtan du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la 'jug pa dang / de gtan du 'jug pa'o //
translated: engagement in the present and engagement for a long time.

original: de la de'i mod la 'jug pa ni ji srid du sems can rnams yongs su ma smin zhing rnam par ma grol ba de srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la de'i mod la 'jug pa ni ji srid du sems can rnams yongs su ma smin zhing rnam par ma grol ba de srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: In this regard, engagement in the present is the engagement of the magical emanations of the Buddhas for as long as sentient beings are not fully matured and liberated.

original: de la de gtan du 'jug pa ni ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi zang cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: de la de gtan du 'jug pa ni ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi zang cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: In this regard, engagement for a long time is the engagement of the magical emanations of the Buddhas for as long as the world exists, because the nature of the Buddhas is inexhaustible and inconceivable,

original: 'jig rten ji srid yod kyi bar du sems can rnams kyi bya ba bsgrub pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid yod kyi bar du sems can rnams kyi bya ba bsgrub pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: and because they engage in the accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings.

original: de la ldog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ldog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is disengagement?

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood in two ways:

original: de'i mod la ldog pa dang / de gtan ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la ldog pa dang / de gtan ldog pa'o //
translated: immediate cessation and ultimate cessation.

original: de la de'i mod la ldog pa ni sems can rnams yongs su smin cing rnam par grol bar gyur pa ni de'i mod la sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas ldog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de la de'i mod la ldog pa ni sems can rnams yongs su smin cing rnam par grol bar gyur pa ni de'i mod la sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas ldog par mdzad do //
translated: Immediate cessation is the cessation of the Buddhas, due to their complete liberation and the complete maturity of all sentient beings.

original: de la de gtan ldog pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang sdug bsngal gnas dang bcas pa gtan zad pa las rig par bya'o//🔽ji ltar na bstod pa byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa la phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la de gtan ldog pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang sdug bsngal gnas dang bcas pa gtan zad pa las rig par bya'o// ji ltar na bstod pa byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa la phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Ultimate cessation is to be understood as the complete cessation of the afflictions along with their traces, and the complete cessation of suffering along with its ground.🔽How does praise benefit the Tathagata?

original: ji ltar bstod na bdag nyid la phan par spyod pas yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bstod na bdag nyid la phan par spyod pas yin gyi /
translated: It benefits him by acting for his welfare,

original: bstod pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstod pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not by the praise itself.

original: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bstod pa dag gis g-yo bar mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bstod pa dag gis g-yo bar mdzad de /
translated: Otherwise, the Tathagata would be moved by the praise.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / mchog tu 'dod chen chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / mchog tu 'dod chen chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata does not praise himself, and he is supremely free from desire.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa mngon par brjod pa la ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te /🔽bstod pa byed pa bdag nyid kho na 'ba' zhig la phan par kun tu spyod pa na bsod nams dpag tu med pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa thams cad dang bral ba la phan gdags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa mngon par brjod pa la ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te / bstod pa byed pa bdag nyid kho na 'ba' zhig la phan par kun tu spyod pa na bsod nams dpag tu med pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa thams cad dang bral ba la phan gdags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: There are two things that are amazing and marvelous about the Tathāgata’s praise:🔽the praise that is done for the sake of the one who is praised itself generates immeasurable merit, and the praise that is done for the sake of the one who is not the Tathāgata generates the merit of the one who is the Tathāgata.🔽The praise that is done for the sake of the one who is praised itself generates immeasurable merit.

original: ji lta ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa byed pa de lta de ltar bdag nyid la phan pa sgrub par byed pa @30a * //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa byed pa de lta de ltar bdag nyid la phan pa sgrub par byed pa @30a * //
translated: The praise that is done for the sake of the one who is not the Tathāgata generates the merit of the one who is the Tathāgata.

original: yin la / ji lta ji ltar bdag nyid la phan pa sgrub par byed pa de lta de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas /🔽de'i phyir dngos po gnyis dang ldan pa'i bsod nams shin tu rgya che zhing mi zad pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin la / ji lta ji ltar bdag nyid la phan pa sgrub par byed pa de lta de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas / de'i phyir dngos po gnyis dang ldan pa'i bsod nams shin tu rgya che zhing mi zad pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: and it is also the case that the more one benefits oneself, the more one benefits the Tathagata by making offerings to him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / mi bzhed pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / mi bzhed pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the merit that is produced by the two things, i.e., by the thing that is desired by the Tathagata and by the thing that is not desired by the Tathagata, is very extensive and inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni rnam pa drug gis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni rnam pa drug gis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: The good qualities of the Tathagata should be known as being comprised by six aspects:

original: mtha' dag dang / dri ma med pa dag dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi las can dang / mthus so //
analyzed: mtha' dag dang / dri ma med pa dag dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi las can dang / mthus so //
translated: in their entirety, in their purity, in their immobility, in their lack of equality, in their function of benefiting sentient beings, and in their power.

original: de la ji ltar mtha' dag gis she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar mtha' dag gis she na /
translated: How are they comprised in their entirety?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is endowed with all mundane and supramundane virtues that are practiced in the three realms.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan de dag kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan de dag kyang /
translated: And those supramundane virtues

original: ngag gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin pas /
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin pas /
translated: are beyond the range of speech.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bstod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa de'i phyir bstod par 'os pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bstod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa de'i phyir bstod par 'os pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the Tathāgata is beyond all praise, he is worthy of praise.

original: ji ltar dri ma med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dri ma med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he stainless?

original: yon tan gyi dri ma ni bdun po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dri ma ni bdun po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The stains of virtue are these seven:

original: 'dod pa dang ; lta ba dang / yid gnyis dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / bag la nyal dang / ser sna'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ; lta ba dang / yid gnyis dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / bag la nyal dang / ser sna'o //
translated: desire, view, doubt, pride, arrogance, latent dispositions, and stinginess.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is completely and totally free of them.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag la gzhan dag gis 'di ni yon tan dang / ldan pa yin no zhes shes par gyur na ci ma rung snyam du yon tan dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe tshol bar mi mdzad pa dang / yon tan de dag la blta bas mngon par zhen par mi mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag la gzhan dag gis 'di ni yon tan dang / ldan pa yin no zhes shes par gyur na ci ma rung snyam du yon tan dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe tshol bar mi mdzad pa dang / yon tan de dag la blta bas mngon par zhen par mi mdzad pa dang /
translated: Thus, the Tathagata does not seek gain from others by proclaiming his own good qualities, thinking, “How nice it would be if others knew me to be endowed with good qualities!”🔽He does not become attached to those good qualities by looking at them.🔽He does not doubt whether those good qualities are good qualities or faults.

original: yon tan de dag la 'di dag yon tan yin nam skyon yin snyam du yid gnyis mi mnga' ba dang ; yon tan de dag gis bdag nyid gzhan dag dang bskrun cing yongs su 'jal bar mi mdzad pa dang / bdag nyid kyi yon tan rjes su gzigs pa na rgyags pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan de dag la 'di dag yon tan yin nam skyon yin snyam du yid gnyis mi mnga' ba dang ; yon tan de dag gis bdag nyid gzhan dag dang bskrun cing yongs su 'jal bar mi mdzad pa dang / bdag nyid kyi yon tan rjes su gzigs pa na rgyags pa dang /
translated: He does not compare himself with others on the basis of those good qualities.🔽When he sees his own good qualities, he is not conceited.

original: rgod pa dang / dga' ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / yon tan de dag bag chags @30b dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / dga' ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / yon tan de dag bag chags @30b dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: because they do not give rise to pride, conceit, arrogance, haughtiness, or vanity; because they do not give rise to agitation, joy, or delight; and because they are not associated with the latent tendencies of the mental afflictions, since they have completely conquered all the mental afflictions together with their latent tendencies.

original: yon tan de dag la gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du sems shin tu kun tu 'dzin pa'i sems mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan de dag la gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du sems shin tu kun tu 'dzin pa'i sems mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because they do not have a mind that is extremely focused on the thought, “It is not appropriate for others to realize these good qualities.”

original: ji ltar mi g-yo bas she na ;
analyzed: ji ltar mi g-yo bas she na ;
translated: How are they unshakable?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mi zad pa rnams ni mu stegs can rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / bdud rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / chom rkun pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir dang / nye du rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mi zad pa rnams ni mu stegs can rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / bdud rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / chom rkun pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir dang / nye du rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because the thus-gone ones’ inexhaustible good qualities cannot be shaken by tīrthikas, cannot be shaken by māras, cannot be stolen by thieves, cannot be shaken by relatives,

original: rgyal po rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba chen pos dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / tshe zad pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan de dag mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po rnams kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba chen pos dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir dang / tshe zad pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan de dag mi zad pa ste /
translated: Because they are not shaken by kings, by the great elements, by water, fire, or wind, and because they do not decline from the exhaustion of life, those qualities of the Tathagata are inexhaustible.

original: des na de dag mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: des na de dag mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are unshakable.

original: ji ltar mi mnyam pas she na ;
analyzed: ji ltar mi mnyam pas she na ;
translated: How are they unequalled?

original: mthu rgya chen po phul du phyin pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can dag pa dang ma dag pa rnams dang mi mnyam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthu rgya chen po phul du phyin pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can dag pa dang ma dag pa rnams dang mi mnyam pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are unequalled by pure and impure beings through their various and preeminent great powers.

original: des na de dag mi mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag mi mnyam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are unequalled.

original: ji ltar sems can gyi don gyi las can gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gyi don gyi las can gyis she na /
translated: How are they the work of benefiting beings?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba rgya chen po brnyes pa spangs nas ;
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba rgya chen po brnyes pa spangs nas ;
translated: Having attained the great bliss that is irreproachable,

original: gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: they demonstrate the application to the benefit of others.

original: des na de dag sems can gyi don gyi las can yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag sems can gyi don gyi las can yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the work of benefiting beings.

original: ji ltar mthus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthus she na /
translated: How is it by power?

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i smon lam yang dag par grub pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs shes pas yong su bskor ba'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel pa la yang dag par gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i smon lam yang dag par grub pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs shes pas yong su bskor ba'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel pa la yang dag par gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the prayers for the benefit of beings are fulfilled, because they know the means of that, because they are always engaged in that, and because they are dedicated to that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni skyabs kyi 'os yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni skyabs kyi 'os yin la /
translated: The Tathagatas are the proper refuge.

original: lha rnams skyabs kyi 'os ma yin pa ni rgyu lngas rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: lha rnams skyabs kyi 'os ma yin pa ni rgyu lngas rig par bya ba ste /
translated: The gods are not the proper refuge, for five reasons.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bus so //
analyzed: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bus so //
translated: By reason of their sign, their nature, their action, their qualities, and their results.

original: de la ji ltar rtags las she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar rtags las she na /
translated: How is it by reason of their sign?

original: lha rnams ni bltar mi snang ba'i phyir kun tu tha snyad byar med pa dang / drag po cha byad can yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / bag med pa la brten pa'i phyir sred pa dang bcas pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mi blta ba'i phyir @31a * //
analyzed: lha rnams ni bltar mi snang ba'i phyir kun tu tha snyad byar med pa dang / drag po cha byad can yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / bag med pa la brten pa'i phyir sred pa dang bcas pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mi blta ba'i phyir @31a * //
translated: The gods are not the proper refuge because they are not visible, because they are fearful, because they are attached, because they are not disinterested, and because they are not the cause of the ultimate goal.

original: snying rje med pa dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa mi shes pa'i phyir dang / de kho na'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje med pa dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa mi shes pa'i phyir dang / de kho na'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are devoid of compassion, they do not know what has been done and what has not been done, and they have not realized the meaning of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar rtags las skyabs kyi 'os yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar rtags las skyabs kyi 'os yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the Tathāgata be known as a refuge on the basis of these?

original: bltar snang ba'i phyir kun tu tha snyad byar yod pa dang / rab tu zhi ba'i cha byad mnga' ba'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bral ba dang / bag yod pa'i phyir sred pa mi mnga' ba dang / gzhan gyi don la gzigs pa'i phyir thugs rje dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: bltar snang ba'i phyir kun tu tha snyad byar yod pa dang / rab tu zhi ba'i cha byad mnga' ba'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bral ba dang / bag yod pa'i phyir sred pa mi mnga' ba dang / gzhan gyi don la gzigs pa'i phyir thugs rje dang bcas pa dang /
translated: He is a refuge because he is visible, because he is free from fear, because he is free from craving, because he is compassionate,

original: byas pa dang ma byas pa mkhyen pa'i phyir dang de kho na'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa mkhyen pa'i phyir dang de kho na'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he knows what has been done and what has not been done, and because he has realized the meaning of reality.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtags lngas skyabs kyi 'os kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtags lngas skyabs kyi 'os kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata should be known as a refuge on the basis of five other characteristics.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sems can gyi don gyi phyir byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul yang dag par rjes su 'jug par mdzad pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la mnyam par phan pa'i thugs mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi phyir byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir chos kyi tshul yang dag par rjes su 'jug par mdzad pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la mnyam par phan pa'i thugs mnga' ba dang /
translated: Because they perfectly accomplish enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings, they are not afraid of samsara. Because they are free of attachment and aversion, they perfectly engage the way of the Dharma. Because they have an attitude of impartial benefit for sentient beings who help or harm them, they are not afraid of the ultimate.

original: pho brang dang btsun mo dang sras dang yongs su gzung ba la chags pa yongs su btang bas dbang po zhi ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom nges par 'grel par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: pho brang dang btsun mo dang sras dang yongs su gzung ba la chags pa yongs su btang bas dbang po zhi ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom nges par 'grel par mdzad pas so //
translated: Because they have relinquished attachment to their palace, queen, sons, and possessions, their senses are calm. Because they resolve the doubts of all sentient beings, they are not afraid of samsara.

original: ji ltar ngo bo nyid las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo nyid las she na /
translated: How are they not afraid from the point of view of their nature?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zag pa thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dul ba yin pa la 'dul bar mdzad pa yin par yang 'os kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zag pa thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dul ba yin pa la 'dul bar mdzad pa yin par yang 'os kyi /
translated: Because the tathāgatas are themselves disciplined because they are free of all defilements, it is fitting that they discipline others.

original: lha rnams ni zag pa dang ldan pa yin pas gdul bar bya ba yin te 'dul bar byed pa'i 'os ma yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams ni zag pa dang ldan pa yin pas gdul bar bya ba yin te 'dul bar byed pa'i 'os ma yin no //
translated: The gods are corruptible, so they are to be disciplined, but they are not fit to discipline others.

original: ji ltar las las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar las las she na /
translated: How is it from karma?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bsam gtan yangs shing rgya che ba la gnas par mdzad pa'i phrin las can dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phrin las can yin gyi lha rnams ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod la gnas par byed pa'i las can dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bsam gtan yangs shing rgya che ba la gnas par mdzad pa'i phrin las can dang / sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phrin las can yin gyi lha rnams ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod la gnas par byed pa'i las can dang /
translated: The Tathagatas have the karma of abiding in vast and extensive meditative stabilization, and they have the karma of acting for the benefit of sentient beings. But the gods have the karma of abiding in the enjoyments of desire,

original: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i las can yin par snang ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i las can yin par snang ngo //
translated: and they have the karma of harming sentient beings.

original: ji ltar chos las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos las she na /
translated: How is it from Dharma?

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni rang gi skyes bu'i byed pa la rag las pa yin pa'i @31b phyir skyes bu'i byed pa med na lha rnams la gus pa dam pos zhen pa rnams kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni rang gi skyes bu'i byed pa la rag las pa yin pa'i @31b phyir skyes bu'i byed pa med na lha rnams la gus pa dam pos zhen pa rnams kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur
translated: Since all mundane and supramundane perfections depend on one's own human action, if there is no human action, even those who are attached to the gods with the highest respect will not attain them.

original: la / skyes bu'i byed pa dang ldan pa de la gus pa med pa rnams kyis kyang de 'thob par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la / skyes bu'i byed pa dang ldan pa de la gus pa med pa rnams kyis kyang de 'thob par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even those who do not respect the person who has the power to help will obtain it.

original: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu las she na /
translated: How is it from cause and effect?

original: 'di la lha nyid ni lha nyid du 'gyur ba'i las kyis sam /
analyzed: 'di la lha nyid ni lha nyid du 'gyur ba'i las kyis sam /
translated: Here, is it obtained by the action of becoming a god?

original: de nyid la mchod pas sam /
analyzed: de nyid la mchod pas sam /
translated: Or by worshipping the gods?

original: rgyu med pas 'thob par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rgyu med pas 'thob par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it obtained without a cause?

original: gal te lha nyid du 'gyur ba'i las kyis yin na ni des na rang gi las nyid skyabs kyi 'os yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te lha nyid du 'gyur ba'i las kyis yin na ni des na rang gi las nyid skyabs kyi 'os yin gyi /
translated: If it is by the action of becoming a god, then one’s own action is the proper refuge,

original: lha rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: not the gods.

original: gal te rgyu med pas yin na ni des na rgyu med pa nyid skyabs kyi 'os yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pas yin na ni des na rgyu med pa nyid skyabs kyi 'os yin gyi /
translated: If it is without a cause, then non-causality is the proper refuge,

original: lha rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: not the gods.

original: gal te lha mchod pas yin na ni des na lha nyid kyi rgyu mchod pa nyid dam lha nyid dam de gnyi ga yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te lha mchod pas yin na ni des na lha nyid kyi rgyu mchod pa nyid dam lha nyid dam de gnyi ga yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is by worshipping the gods, then either the cause of becoming a god is worship, or the gods are worship, or both are worship.

original: gal te mchod pa nyid yin na ni des na mchod pa gang yang rung bas lha nyid du 'gyur bas lha nyid don med par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te lha nyid kyis yin na ni des na lha mchod pa med par yang lha nyid kyis lha nyid du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te mchod pa nyid yin na ni des na mchod pa gang yang rung bas lha nyid du 'gyur bas lha nyid don med par 'gyur ro // gal te lha nyid kyis yin na ni des na lha mchod pa med par yang lha nyid kyis lha nyid du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir //
translated: If it is the deity itself that is worshipped, then any worship would be a deity, and deity worship would be meaningless.🔽If it is the deity itself that worships, then deity worship would be meaningless, since the deity itself would become a deity without worshipping a deity.

original: lha mchod pa don med par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te de gnyi gas yin na ni des na mchod pas phan btags pa'i lha nyid gang sems par byed pa de ni yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lha mchod pa don med par 'gyur ro // gal te de gnyi gas yin na ni des na mchod pas phan btags pa'i lha nyid gang sems par byed pa de ni yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is both, then deity worship would be meaningless, since the deity itself would be worshipped by itself.

original: des na lha des bsam pa rnam pa bdun yang dag par 'grub par 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: des na lha des bsam pa rnam pa bdun yang dag par 'grub par 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, since the deity would be worshipped by itself, the deity would be accomplished by itself, and so the deity’s seven types of thought would be accomplished in error. But that is unacceptable.

original: mchod pa'i rkyen gyis phan btags pa dang / mos pa'i rkyen gyis phan btags pa dang / de la ma mos pa rnams mos par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha nyid khas blangs pa dang / longs spyod shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: mchod pa'i rkyen gyis phan btags pa dang / mos pa'i rkyen gyis phan btags pa dang / de la ma mos pa rnams mos par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha nyid khas blangs pa dang / longs spyod shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
translated: The benefits are: one benefits by the condition of worship, one benefits by the condition of faith, one causes those who have no faith to have faith, one accepts the state of a particularly exalted deity, one accomplishes the attainment of very exalted enjoyment,

original: lha ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig pa dang / 'chi 'pho la bsam pa yang dag par 'grub par 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jig pa dang / 'chi 'pho la bsam pa yang dag par 'grub par 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: one destroys the discordant class of titans, etc., and one accomplishes the attainment of the thought of death and transmigration.

original: rnam par dag pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four purities:

original: ming rnam par dag pa dang / ngag rnam par dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / rtags rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: ming rnam par dag pa dang / ngag rnam par dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / rtags rnam par dag pa'o //
