translated: purity of name, purity of speech, purity of nature, and purity of sign.

original: de la rtags ni mthu dang / the tshom gcod pa dang / lung ston pa dang / gdul dka' ba 'dul ba dang / @32a * //
analyzed: de la rtags ni mthu dang / the tshom gcod pa dang / lung ston pa dang / gdul dka' ba 'dul ba dang / @32a * //
translated: The sign is power, the removal of doubt, prophecy, the taming of the difficult to tame,

original: lha dang mi rnams mngon par 'du bya ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag ston pa dang / mu stegs can pham par byed pa'o //🔽ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ming can gyi dngos po la /🔽gzugs la sogs par 'dogs pa btags pa las yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams mngon par 'du bya ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i gdams ngag ston pa dang / mu stegs can pham par byed pa'o // ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ming can gyi dngos po la / gzugs la sogs par 'dogs pa btags pa las yod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the instruction for the definite release of gods and men, and it is the refutation of the heterodox.🔽How should one understand that the entities which are called form, etc.

original: rdzas las ma yin par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas las ma yin par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: exist only nominally, not substantially, since they are designated as form, etc.?🔽The entity which is the basis of the name form, etc.

original: mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa'i ming la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang gis yod pa de ni bdag nyid des rdzas dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa'i ming la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang gis yod pa de ni bdag nyid des rdzas dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang
translated: is not substantially real, nor ultimately real, in the way that it is imagined by the consciousness which is habituated to verbalization and which is grounded in the name form, etc.

original: med do // de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa las des kun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni btags pa las yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med do // de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa las des kun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni btags pa las yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the imaginary nature is the existence of those entities which are called form, etc. as they are imagined by that consciousness.

original: mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa rnam par bstsal ba'i ming can gyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid gang gis yod pa de ni rdzas dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa rnam par bstsal ba'i ming can gyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi dngos po brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid gang gis yod pa de ni rdzas dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang
translated: That which exists as the inexpressible nature of things, such as form, which is the object of consciousness named “elimination of thorough familiarization with verbalization,” is both substantial and ultimate.

original: de bzhin du yod par rig par bya'o //🔽de la de rab tu grub par bya ba'i rigs pa brjod pa pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod par rig par bya'o // de la de rab tu grub par bya ba'i rigs pa brjod pa pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood as existing in that way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sar bstan pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sar bstan pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The reasoning that proves that is stated in the Bodhisattva Levels, and it should be understood as taught there.

original: de la mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa'i ming la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽nang na yang mi dmigs /🔽phyi rol na yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de la mngon par brjod pa la yongs su goms pa'i ming la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni / nang na yang mi dmigs / phyi rol na yang mi dmigs /
translated: Regarding that, the imagined nature, which is the object of consciousness based on the name of thorough familiarization with verbalization,🔽is not apprehended internally,🔽is not apprehended externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and is not apprehended between those two.

original: ma skyes pa dang / mi skye ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / mi skye ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma 'gags pa /
translated: It is unborn, unarisen, not arising, and unceasing.

original: mi 'gag pa /
analyzed: mi 'gag pa /
translated: It is not ceasing,

original: 'gag par mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'gag par mi 'gyur ba /
translated: and will not cease.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is primordially peace, natural nirvana.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni btags pa'i yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni btags pa'i yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it is imputed to exist,

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but does not exist ultimately.

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni byis pas bskyed pa'i log par yongs su rtogs pa la brten nas ni skyes pa dang / skye ba dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag pa @32b dang ; 'gag par 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni byis pas bskyed pa'i log par yongs su rtogs pa la brten nas ni skyes pa dang / skye ba dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag pa @32b dang ; 'gag par 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: The nature that is inexpressible is produced, arises, will arise, ceases, and will cease in dependence on the childish, who give rise to false understanding.

original: de ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: de ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: Because it is not abandoned and not fully understood, it is the full differentiation of affliction.

original: de spangs shing yongs su shes pas ni rnam par byang ba rab tu phye ba yin no /🔽// / bam po sum cu drug pa /
analyzed: de spangs shing yongs su shes pas ni rnam par byang ba rab tu phye ba yin no /🔽// / bam po sum cu drug pa /
translated: Because it is abandoned and fully understood, it is the full differentiation of purification.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mang du thos pa yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mang du thos pa yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four things that bodhisattvas who have heard much will correctly retain.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four dharmas that cause the bodhisattva to take up the true Dharma of learning:

original: mang du thos pa'i gzhi dang / mang du thos pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mang du thos pa'i 'bras bu dang / mang du thos pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i gzhi dang / mang du thos pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mang du thos pa'i 'bras bu dang / mang du thos pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the basis of learning, the accomplishment of learning, the result of learning, and the purification of learning.

original: de dag kyang byang chub kyi smon lam dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / rab tu dben par gnas pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang byang chub kyi smon lam dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / rab tu dben par gnas pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are, in order, the aspiration for enlightenment, reliance on holy people, the power of discernment, and dwelling in solitude.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ element of aspiration?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yod pa nyid du yid ches bas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yod pa nyid du yid ches bas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment that comes from confidence in the existence of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ element of superior intention?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du yid ches pas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du yid ches pas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the discernment of the qualities of the Buddha’s teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the element of aspiration of the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the discernment of the ability to attain the Buddha’s teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying brtse ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying brtse ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the compassion of the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rjes su snying brtse ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rjes su snying brtse ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the compassion for sentient beings who are in suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the great compassion of the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rjes su snying brtse ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rjes su snying brtse ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the compassion for sentient beings who are in the causes of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the wisdom of the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa / shes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yang gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / shes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yang gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the realization of the existence of the knowable objects just as they are.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: ” What is the knowledge of the bodhisattvas?

original: smras pa / shes bya la ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / shes bya la ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is the realization of the extent of the knowable objects.

original: sems pa'i skyon ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i skyon ni gsum ste /
translated: ” There are three faults of intention:

original: sems pa lhur len pa dang / gnas pa ma yin pa la sems pa dang / log par sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa lhur len pa dang / gnas pa ma yin pa la sems pa dang / log par sems pa'o //
translated: intentions that are excessive, intentions that are not stable, and intentions that are mistaken.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin pa de la @33a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin pa de la @33a * //
translated: How is it that bodhisattvas give gifts?

original: brten nas sbyin pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brten nas sbyin pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: In dependence on that, seven kinds of purity of giving should be known.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa dang / tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang ; shes pa yongs su dag pa dang /🔽dri ma yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa dang / tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang ; shes pa yongs su dag pa dang /🔽dri ma yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: They are the purity of the thing given, the purity of morality, the purity of view, the purity of mind, the purity of speech, the purity of knowledge, and the purity of freedom from defilements.

original: yongs su dag pa de dag thams cad kyang rnam pa bcu bcur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa de dag thams cad kyang rnam pa bcu bcur rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all of these perfections should be understood as tenfold.

original: de la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The tenfold purity of the thing given is as follows:

original: mang po dang sna tshogs pa nyid kyis 'di ltar rgya chen po sbyin par byed pa dang / mi mang mi nyung ba nyid kyis mtshungs par sbyin par byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i dus nyid kyis dus su sbyin par byed pa dang / kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis gya nom pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: mang po dang sna tshogs pa nyid kyis 'di ltar rgya chen po sbyin par byed pa dang / mi mang mi nyung ba nyid kyis mtshungs par sbyin par byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i dus nyid kyis dus su sbyin par byed pa dang / kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis gya nom pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: One gives extensively, by giving much and of various kinds. One gives equally, by giving neither too little nor too much. One gives at the right time, by giving when something is requested. One gives the best, by giving the best color, etc.

original: mi gtsang ba'i dngos po dang ma 'dres pa nyid kyis gtsang ba sbyin par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis rung ba sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis ci 'dod pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i dngos po dang ma 'dres pa nyid kyis gtsang ba sbyin par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis rung ba sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis ci 'dod pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: One gives pure things, by giving things unmixed with impurities. One gives suitable things, by giving things free of faults. One gives what is wanted, by giving what is wanted.

original: 'phrod pa nyid kyis phan pa sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo pa la ltos pa nyid cig car ram rim gyis sbyin par byed pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis rtag tu sbyin par byed pa'o //🔽de la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /

translated: It is a help through being suitable, since it is given in accordance with the petitioners wishes. It is given immediately or gradually, in dependence on the petitioners. It is given constantly, since it is given all the time.🔽The tenfold purity of morality is as follows:🔽

original: sdig pa las log pa dag sbyin par byed pa dang / dbang po thul bas sbyin par byed pa dang / gus par byas te sbyin par byed pa dang / rab tu btud de sbyin par byed pa dang / rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa las log pa dag sbyin par byed pa dang / dbang po thul bas sbyin par byed pa dang / gus par byas te sbyin par byed pa dang / rab tu btud de sbyin par byed pa dang / rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give with pure generosity, because they give without harming others, they give without detesting, they give without being attached, they give without boasting, and they give without desiring anything in return.🔽They give with pure dedication, because they dedicate it to the unsurpassed, to the attainment of the unsurpassed, to the unsurpassed field of action, and to the unsurpassed result.🔽They give with pure reliance, because they give without relying on a teacher other than the Buddha, without relying on a doctrine other than the Great Vehicle, without relying on a vehicle other than the Great Vehicle, and without relying on a path other than the Great Vehicle.

original: dang por rang rang gi tshal za'i 'khor rnams la legs par ri mor byas legs par mchod par byas nas de'i 'og tu slong mo pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa'o //🔽de la lta ba rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di @33b lta ste ;
analyzed: dang por rang rang gi tshal za'i 'khor rnams la legs par ri mor byas legs par mchod par byas nas de'i 'og tu slong mo pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pa'o // de la lta ba rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di @33b lta ste ;
translated: They give with a pure attitude, because they give without pride, without boasting, without contempt for others, and without detesting others.🔽They give with a pure field of action, because they give to those who do not have, to those who are suffering, to those who are unprotected, to those who have no companions, and to those who are in a bad situation.🔽They give with pure generosity, because they give without harming others, they give without detesting, they give without being attached, they give without boasting, and they give without desiring anything in return.🔽They give with pure dedication, because they dedicate it to the unsurpassed, to the attainment of the unsurpassed, to the unsurpassed field of action, and to the unsurpassed result.🔽They give with pure reliance, because they give without relying on a teacher other than the Buddha, without relying on a doctrine other than the Great Vehicle, without relying on a vehicle other than the Great Vehicle, and without relying on a path other than the Great Vehicle.

original: / bdag ni sbyin par byed pa'o bdag gi sbyin pa'o snyam du rlom sems med par sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gzhan dag dang mi sgrun par sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gzhan dag las che ba'am /
analyzed: / bdag ni sbyin par byed pa'o bdag gi sbyin pa'o snyam du rlom sems med par sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gzhan dag dang mi sgrun par sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gzhan dag las che ba'am /
translated: They give with a pure attitude, because they give without pride, without boasting, without contempt for others, and without detesting others.🔽They give with a pure field of action, because they give to those who do not have, to those who are suffering, to those who are unprotected, to

original: mnyam pa'am / chung ngo snyam du mi sems par sbyin par byed par dang / gzhan dag la lan du phan 'dogs pa la mi lta bar sbyin par sbyin par byed pa dang / phyi ma la srid pa khyad par can longs spyod khyad par can la mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa'am / chung ngo snyam du mi sems par sbyin par byed par dang / gzhan dag la lan du phan 'dogs pa la mi lta bar sbyin par sbyin par byed pa dang / phyi ma la srid pa khyad par can longs spyod khyad par can la mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give without thinking, “I am equal,” or “I am superior.” They give without looking for reciprocal benefit from others. They give without looking for special future existences or special enjoyments.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu med do snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'bras bu tshul dang mi mthun pa dang 'bras bu phyin ci log yin no snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ni dge ba'o snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu med do snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'bras bu tshul dang mi mthun pa dang 'bras bu phyin ci log yin no snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ni dge ba'o snyam du mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give without thinking, “There is no result of generosity.” They give without thinking, “The result is contrary to the way or the result is mistaken.” They give without thinking, “Generosity is virtuous even if it is harmful.”

original: ngo mtshar dang bkra shis su mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang bkra shis su mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi lta bar sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: He gives gifts without looking for fame, reputation, or praise.

original: de la sems rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten pure thoughts are as follows:

original: rang bzhin gyis sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: He gives gifts with a mind of love for all beings by nature.

original: sbyin pa la rin po che'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la rin po che'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: He gives gifts with a mind that values giving.

original: mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal ba dag la snyoms pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal ba dag la snyoms pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: He gives gifts with a mind that is impartial toward friends, foes, and strangers.

original: ser sna'i dri ma dang / sogs 'jog gi dri ma gzhan la mi gtong bas ser sna'i dri ma dang / bdag nyid yongs su longs spyod par mi byed pa las sogs 'jog gi dri mar rig par bya ba'i dri ma bstsal ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ser sna'i dri ma dang / sogs 'jog gi dri ma gzhan la mi gtong bas ser sna'i dri ma dang / bdag nyid yongs su longs spyod par mi byed pa las sogs 'jog gi dri mar rig par bya ba'i dri ma bstsal ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: They give gifts with a mind free of the stains of stinginess, the stains of other forms of miserliness, and the stains of not fully enjoying and using their possessions themselves.

original: mngon par dga' ba rnam pa bdun po slong mo pa ma 'ongs pa nas sems mngon par dga' ba dang / slong mo 'ongs pa na mthong ma thag tu sems rab tu dga' ba dang / sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa na yid bde ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba rnam pa bdun po slong mo pa ma 'ongs pa nas sems mngon par dga' ba dang / slong mo 'ongs pa na mthong ma thag tu sems rab tu dga' ba dang / sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa na yid bde ba'i sems dang /
translated: They give gifts with a mind that is delighted in seven ways: with a mind that is delighted in advance about the future beggar; with a mind that is delighted upon seeing the present beggar; with a mind that is delighted when giving the gift;

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang / ngoms mi shes pa'i sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i bsam pa med pa'i sems dang / byin nas 'gyod pa med pa'i sems kyis /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang / ngoms mi shes pa'i sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i bsam pa med pa'i sems dang / byin nas 'gyod pa med pa'i sems kyis /
translated: with a mind that is delighted in equipoise; with a mind that is delighted in being insatiable; with a mind that is delighted in being free of the intention to harm; and with a mind that is delighted in being free of regret after giving.

original: sems mngon par dga' bas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo @34a * //
analyzed: sems mngon par dga' bas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / slong mo @34a * //
translated: They give gifts with a mind that is delighted in advance about the future beggar; with a mind that is delighted upon seeing the present beggar; with a mind that is delighted when giving the gift;

original: ba'i dang na dus la bzod pa dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams la byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ba'i dang na dus la bzod pa dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams la byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: and giving with a mind of patience, because one is not discouraged or impatient when giving.🔽Giving with a mind of love to those who are violent, giving with a mind of compassion to those who are suffering,

original: yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / mdza' bshes rnams la btang snyoms kyi sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa dang / mdza' bshes rnams la btang snyoms kyi sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: giving with a mind of joy to those who have good qualities, and giving with a mind of equanimity to one’s friends.

original: de la ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Ten kinds of pure speech are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i snga rol nas sbyin pa'i skabs 'byed pa dang / 'ongs pa na tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / khro gnyer med cing bzhin gyi mdog gsal la 'dzum pa sngar gtong zhing tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis gtam 'dre bar byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i snga rol nas sbyin pa'i skabs 'byed pa dang / 'ongs pa na tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / khro gnyer med cing bzhin gyi mdog gsal la 'dzum pa sngar gtong zhing tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis gtam 'dre bar byed /
translated: One speaks to them with a clear and smiling face, free of frowns, and one engages in conversation with them using gentle speech.

original: phebs par smra bar byed /
analyzed: phebs par smra bar byed /
translated: One speaks in a friendly way.🔽One delights them by thinking, “I will give to those who ask,” and by delighting them with the things that are to be given.

original: kun dga' bar byed pa dang / slong mo pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su sbyin par bya'o snyam du sems shing sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pos kun tu dga' bar byed pa dang / da ni khyod la sbyin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba tshig kun tu rjod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bar byed pa dang / slong mo pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su sbyin par bya'o snyam du sems shing sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pos kun tu dga' bar byed pa dang / da ni khyod la sbyin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba tshig kun tu rjod par byed pa dang /
translated: One speaks the following words: “Now I am giving to you.”

original: dngan dus byed pa na khro bas kun nas slong ba'i tshig rtsub po rjod par mi byed pa dang / slong mo pa la mngon sum dang lkog nas mi smod mi sgrogs pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos mi 'dogs na yang legs par shad kyis sbyangs te gtong bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dngan dus byed pa na khro bas kun nas slong ba'i tshig rtsub po rjod par mi byed pa dang / slong mo pa la mngon sum dang lkog nas mi smod mi sgrogs pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos mi 'dogs na yang legs par shad kyis sbyangs te gtong bar byed pa dang /
translated: Even if they are not inclined to give something, they give it to them after they have properly explained the reason.

original: slong mo pa la mngon sum du smod par mi byed /🔽khyad du gsod par mi byed /🔽bsting bar mi byed /
analyzed: slong mo pa la mngon sum du smod par mi byed / khyad du gsod par mi byed / bsting bar mi byed /
translated: They do not criticize beggars in their presence.🔽They do not insult them.🔽They do not ridicule them.🔽They do not mock them.

original: co 'dri bar mi byed pa dang / sma 'bebs pa nye bar sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: co 'dri bar mi byed pa dang / sma 'bebs pa nye bar sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: They do not humiliate them.

original: de la shes pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten pure forms of knowledge are as follows:

original: sbyin pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / slong mo pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / slong mo pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is to have pure understanding in relation to generosity, pure understanding in relation to beggars, pure understanding in relation to the qualities that are given, pure understanding in relation to the application of generosity,

original: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: pure understanding in relation to bringing beings to maturity through generosity, pure understanding in relation to skill in means, pure understanding in relation to the shortcomings of desire,

original: @34b dri ma bsal ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gzung ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyogs drug gis bkab pa nyid la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'o /
analyzed: @34b dri ma bsal ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gzung ba la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyogs drug gis bkab pa nyid la brten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'o /
translated: the purity of knowledge based on the removal of impurities, the purity of knowledge based on the avoidance of bad companions and the cultivation of good friends, and the purity of knowledge based on the six directions of protection.

original: de la shes pa rnam par dag pa dang pos ni sbyin pa'i rnam grangs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes la /
analyzed: de la shes pa rnam par dag pa dang pos ni sbyin pa'i rnam grangs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes la /
translated: By the first purity of knowledge, one knows the synonyms of generosity as they are in reality.

original: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One knows the characteristics, the verbal definition, and the divisions of generosity as they are in reality.

original: de la gnyis pas ni sems can dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / skyon dang ; yon tan dang ldan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs pa thams cad la sbyin gnas kyi blo nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la gnyis pas ni sems can dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / skyon dang ; yon tan dang ldan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs pa thams cad la sbyin gnas kyi blo nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang /
translated: By the second, one establishes the idea of generosity toward all beings, whether inferior, excellent, or of the same status, whether possessing faults or good qualities, whether harmful or helpful.

original: slong mo pa'i 'dod pa nyid kyang zur tsam gyis shes pa dang / sbyin pa'i snga rol nyid nas sbyin par bya ba'i chos thams cad sems can thams cad la bsam pa thag pa nas legs par gtong bar byed pa dang / slong mo pa rang gis thug thub du blangs pa thams cad la yang rjes su gnang bar byed do //

analyzed: tshe 'di la phan pa dang / tshe phyi ma la phan par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the benefit of this life, and for the benefit of future lives.

original: de la bsam pa yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam pa yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The investigation of attitude should be understood as fourfold.

original: rgyu la phyin ci ma log pa'i bsam pa @36b dang ; 'bras bu la chags pa med pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la phyin ci ma log pa'i bsam pa @36b dang ; 'bras bu la chags pa med pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: One should give gifts with a mind that is not confused about the cause, with a mind that is not attached to the result, with a mind that is compassionate to sentient beings, and with a mind that is intent on perfecting the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: de la zhing yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhing yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The field should be understood as fivefold:🔽the field of those who are in need, the field of those who are virtuous, the field of those who are in distress, the field of those who are worthy of worship, and the field of those who are spiritually advanced.

original: gang la don du gnyer ba nyid dmigs pa dang / gang la don du gnyer ba yang yin la phongs pa yang yin pa dang / phongs pa yang yin la rton pa med pa gang yin pa dang / rton pa med pa yang yin la nyes par spyod pa las ldog par nus pa nyid kyang dmigs pa de ni zhing yin no //
analyzed: gang la don du gnyer ba nyid dmigs pa dang / gang la don du gnyer ba yang yin la phongs pa yang yin pa dang / phongs pa yang yin la rton pa med pa gang yin pa dang / rton pa med pa yang yin la nyes par spyod pa las ldog par nus pa nyid kyang dmigs pa de ni zhing yin no //
translated: The field of those who are in need is the field of those who are in need of the gift itself. The field of those who are virtuous is the field of those who are endowed with virtues such as faith, etc. The field of those who are in distress is the field of those who are in distress due to the loss of wealth or due to the loss of virtue. The field of those who are worthy of worship is the field of Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Arhats. The field of those who are spiritually advanced is the field of those who are spiritually advanced due to the cultivation of virtue.

original: de dag med na yang gang la legs par spyod pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs pa de ni zhing lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med na yang gang la legs par spyod pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs pa de ni zhing lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If these are not present, then the field is the fifth type, which is the object of good conduct and the special qualities.

original: zhing ma yin pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste /🔽slong mo pa gtum pa dang / phyir rgol ba la skyabs su song ba phyir rgol bar gyur nas slong bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa na dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems sam kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bsam pas slong bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: zhing ma yin pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste / slong mo pa gtum pa dang / phyir rgol ba la skyabs su song ba phyir rgol bar gyur nas slong bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa na dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems sam kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bsam pas slong bar byed pa dang /
translated: The non-field should be understood in seven ways:

original: bdud dam bdud kyis brlams par gyur nas tho 'tshams pa'i phyir slong bar byed pa dang / gnas ma yin pa slong bar byed de pha ma'am /
analyzed: bdud dam bdud kyis brlams par gyur nas tho 'tshams pa'i phyir slong bar byed pa dang / gnas ma yin pa slong bar byed de pha ma'am /

original: gzhan gang yang rung ba sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po slong bar byed pa dang / don du gnyer ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po slong bar byed pa dang / don du gnyer ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not giving to those who beg for things that should not be given, and it is not giving to those who are not in need.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis ni zhing ma yin pa yongs su brtag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis ni zhing ma yin pa yongs su brtag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In these ways, the field should be understood as not being a field.

original: thabs ma yin pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing thabs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /🔽de la thabs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing thabs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed de / de la thabs ni 'di yin te /
translated: Giving is giving by one who is free from the fault of not being a means and who possesses the virtue of being a means.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is the means:🔽It is the practice of giving,🔽the lack of regard for one's body and life,🔽compassion for sentient beings,🔽the knowledge of the meaning of reality,

original: sbyin pa la goms pa dang / lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / sems can la snying brtse ba dang / de kho na'i don shes pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la mos pa dang / bshad pa dang / nan gyis gnon pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la goms pa dang / lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / sems can la snying brtse ba dang / de kho na'i don shes pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la mos pa dang / bshad pa dang / nan gyis gnon pa dang /
translated: the aspiration for supreme enlightenment,🔽the explanation of the Dharma,🔽the application of assistance in return for assistance,

original: phan btags pa'i lan du phan 'dogs par sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang mthu'o //
analyzed: phan btags pa'i lan du phan 'dogs par sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang mthu'o //
translated: and the conformity with the birth of others.

original: 'dul ba ni bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ni bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Discipline should be understood in brief as threefold:

original: re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams kyi 'dul ba la /
analyzed: re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos rnams kyi 'dul ba la /
translated: First, the Bhagavān, in the Vinaya of the śrāvakas,

original: dang por sdom pa'i tshul @37a * //
analyzed: dang por sdom pa'i tshul @37a * //
translated: the method of restraint.

original: khrims kyi 'dul ba ji ltar bsdus pa de ni 'dul ba bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khrims kyi 'dul ba ji ltar bsdus pa de ni 'dul ba bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is the Vinaya of the restraint of moral discipline should be seen as the compilation of the Vinaya.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'dul ba bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'dul ba bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the compilation of the Vinaya of the moral discipline of gathering virtuous dharmas?

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpas mdor bsdu na sems drug la so sor brtags par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpas mdor bsdu na sems drug la so sor brtags par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is diligent in the moral discipline of gathering virtuous dharmas should, in brief, examine six minds.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: khyad par du gsod pa'i sems dang / le lo dang ldan pa'i sems dang / bsgribs pa'i sems dang / brtsal ba las yongs su skyo ba'i sems dang / gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang / bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems so /
analyzed: khyad par du gsod pa'i sems dang / le lo dang ldan pa'i sems dang / bsgribs pa'i sems dang / brtsal ba las yongs su skyo ba'i sems dang / gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang / bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems so /
translated: The mind of killing with a special intention, the lazy mind, the obscured mind, the mind of complete weariness from searching, the harmful mind, and the mind with obstacles.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la spong bar sems pa nyid dang / mi mos pa'i sems nyid dang / brnyas pa'i sems nyid dang gang yin pa de ni khyad du gsod pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la spong bar sems pa nyid dang / mi mos pa'i sems nyid dang / brnyas pa'i sems nyid dang gang yin pa de ni khyad du gsod pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought of abandoning the bodhisattva's virtuous natures, the thought of lack of interest, and the thought of contempt are called the thought of disregard.

original: le lo dang glag dal dang glag dal dang bag med pas kun nas dkris pa'i sems ni le lo dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le lo dang glag dal dang glag dal dang bag med pas kun nas dkris pa'i sems ni le lo dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that is bound up with laziness, procrastination, and carelessness is called the thought that is lazy.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gang yang rung bas kun nas dkris pa'i sems ni bsgribs pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gang yang rung bas kun nas dkris pa'i sems ni bsgribs pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that is bound up with any of the obscurations of the defilements and secondary defilements, such as longing for sensual pleasure, is called the thought that is obscured.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing gnas pa'i lus kyi ngal ba dang sems kyis 'khrug pas zil gyis gnon pa'i sems ni brtsal bas yongs su ngal ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing gnas pa'i lus kyi ngal ba dang sems kyis 'khrug pas zil gyis gnon pa'i sems ni brtsal bas yongs su ngal ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that is overwhelmed by the fatigue of the body and the agitation of the mind while one is engaged in striving is called the thought that is fatigued by striving.

original: gnod pa gang yang rung bas zil gyis non pa'i sems sbyor bar bzod pa'i mthu med pa de ni gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa gang yang rung bas zil gyis non pa'i sems sbyor bar bzod pa'i mthu med pa de ni gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: A mind that is overwhelmed by any kind of harm, and is unable to bear the power of the practice, is called a mind that is harmed.

original: smra ba la dga' ba la sogs pa bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems ni bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba la dga' ba la sogs pa bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems ni bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: A mind that is distracted by such things as delight in talking is called a mind that is distracted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems drug po de dag la 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems drug po de dag la 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should investigate these six kinds of mind in this way:

original: ci bdag gi sems la sems drug po de dag las gang yang rung ba rab tu spyod pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci bdag gi sems la sems drug po de dag las gang yang rung ba rab tu spyod pa yod dam /
translated: “Which of these six kinds of mind is active in me now?

original: 'on te med snyam du so sor rtog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te med snyam du so sor rtog par bya'o //
translated: Is it present or not?”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po gsum po dag ni skyes so cog gcig tu dang du mi blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po gsum po dag ni skyes so cog gcig tu dang du mi blang bar bya ste /
translated: Among these, the bodhisattva should not accept the first three kinds of mind, whatever they may be, as they arise.

original: gal te dang du len par byed cing spong bar mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te dang du len par byed cing spong bar mi byed na /
translated: If he accepts them and does not abandon them,

original: thams cad du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be always be in a state of sin.

original: brtsal bas yongs su skyo ba'i sems ni skyes pa na /
analyzed: brtsal bas yongs su skyo ba'i sems ni skyes pa na /
translated: When a mind that is weary of searching arises,

original: gal te 'di lta bu'i sems kyis dge @37b ba'i chos rnams la sbyor ba gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu'i sems kyis dge @37b ba'i chos rnams la sbyor ba gtong bar byed de /
translated: if one abandons application to virtuous qualities with a mind like this,

original: ji nas kyang lus dang sems ngal zhing 'khrug par byed pa 'di so sor bsal nas /
analyzed: ji nas kyang lus dang sems ngal zhing 'khrug par byed pa 'di so sor bsal nas /
translated: thinking, “I will dispel this weariness and agitation of body and mind

original: yang dge ba'i chos rnams la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du sems na ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dge ba'i chos rnams la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du sems na ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and then apply myself to virtuous qualities,” then there is no offense.

original: gal te bdag la dge ba la sbyor ba gang gis bdag tshe 'di la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba 'di lta bus ji zhig bya snyam du sems shing thams cad kyi thams cad du gtan spong bar byed na ni de la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag la dge ba la sbyor ba gang gis bdag tshe 'di la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba 'di lta bus ji zhig bya snyam du sems shing thams cad kyi thams cad du gtan spong bar byed na ni de la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks, “What is the use of this kind of application to virtue if it causes suffering in this life?” and completely abandons it, then there is an offense.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni nye bar gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni nye bar gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: When a mind that is afflicted with harmfulness arises,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i sbyor ba la 'dod dgur byar med pa yin pas de dang du blangs nas yang kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i sbyor ba la 'dod dgur byar med pa yin pas de dang du blangs nas yang kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: The bodhisattva is not free to engage in virtuous practices as he wishes, so if he accepts them, he is not morally at fault.

original: bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems ni nye bar gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: bar chad dang ldan pa'i sems ni nye bar gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: If the bodhisattva is in a situation where he is unable to help others,

original: gal te 'dod dgur byar med dam don ches chen po zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong nas dang du len par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gal te 'dod dgur byar med dam don ches chen po zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong nas dang du len par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: but sees that by helping them he will be unable to practice virtue as he wishes or will lose a great benefit, then he may reject them without moral fault.

original: gal te de la 'dod dgur byar yod dam /
analyzed: gal te de la 'dod dgur byar yod dam /
translated: If he is able to help them,🔽but sees that by helping them he will lose a small benefit or no benefit at all, then he may reject them without moral fault.

original: don med pa'am /
analyzed: don med pa'am /
translated: If he is able to help them,

original: don ches chung ba zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong nas dang du len par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ches chung ba zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong nas dang du len par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: but sees that by helping them he will lose a great benefit, then he may reject them with moral fault.

original: sems drug po de dag las sems snga ma gsum po dag gis byung ba dang du blangs so cog ni gcig tu kha na ma thob dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems drug po de dag las sems snga ma gsum po dag gis byung ba dang du blangs so cog ni gcig tu kha na ma thob dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: From among these six mental states, the first three are always morally faulty, whether or not he accepts the occurrence of the mental state.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig pu ni dang du blangs kyang gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig pu ni dang du blangs kyang gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: But a single thought of harm, even if accepted, is not a transgression.

original: sems lhag ma gnyis kyi byung ba dang du blangs so cog ni rnam grangs kyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems lhag ma gnyis kyi byung ba dang du blangs so cog ni rnam grangs kyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the rest of the thoughts, in the two other categories, are transgressions when they are accepted, and are not transgressions when they are not accepted.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnas drug la so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnas drug la so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is intent on the morality of working for the benefit of living beings should examine the six topics of right thinking.

original: bdag dang / gzhan dang / zang zing gis phongs pa dang / zang zing gis 'byor pa dang / chos kyis phongs pa dang / chos kyis 'byor pa ni gnas drug pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan dang / zang zing gis phongs pa dang / zang zing gis 'byor pa dang / chos kyis phongs pa dang / chos kyis 'byor pa ni gnas drug pa yin no //
translated: They are: oneself, others, the lack of material goods, the abundance of material goods, the lack of Dharma, and the abundance of Dharma.

original: de la zang zing gis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zang zing gis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The lack of material goods is

original: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa ma rnyed pa rnams mi rnyed pa dang / rnyed cing 'jug pa rnams rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa ma rnyed pa rnams mi rnyed pa dang / rnyed cing 'jug pa rnams rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The loss of the Dharma is the loss of the training and the non-existence of the opportunity to hear the words of the ultimate Dharma taught by the Tathagata that have not been heard before, and the non-existence of the opportunity to reflect on what has not been heard before, as it truly is.

original: zang zing gis 'byor pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //🔽chos kyis phongs @38a * //
analyzed: zang zing gis 'byor pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o // chos kyis phongs @38a * //
translated: The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.🔽The loss of the Dharma is the loss of the training and the non-existence of the opportunity to hear the words of the ultimate Dharma taught by the Tathagata that have not been heard before, and the non-existence of the opportunity to reflect on what has not been heard before, as it truly is.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa don dam pa'i chos kyi tshig sngon ma thos pa mnyan du med pa dang / sngon ma thos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngon ma bsams pa bsam du med pa dang /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa don dam pa'i chos kyi tshig sngon ma thos pa mnyan du med pa dang / sngon ma thos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sngon ma bsams pa bsam du med pa dang /
translated: The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.🔽The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.🔽The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.

original: thos pa'i bar chad dang / bsam pa'i bar chad dang / thos pa dang bsams pa brjod pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba ma thob pa mi dang / thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //🔽chos 'byor pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i bar chad dang / bsam pa'i bar chad dang / thos pa dang bsams pa brjod pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba ma thob pa mi dang / thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //🔽chos 'byor pa ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.🔽The loss of material things is the loss of what has been acquired and the non-acquisition of what has not been acquired.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid kyis chos kyis phongs pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid kyis chos kyis phongs pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva should not apply himself to the enrichment of others through material things because of his own poverty of Dharma.

original: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with the enrichment of material things, so also with the enrichment of Dharma.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir chos kyis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pas bsdus pa dang / bslab pa nyams pa dang rjes su mthun pas bsdus pa dang / thob pa'i chos yongs su nyams pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir chos kyis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pas bsdus pa dang / bslab pa nyams pa dang rjes su mthun pas bsdus pa dang / thob pa'i chos yongs su nyams pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this context, poverty of Dharma should be understood as being included in the degeneration of morality, and as being included in the degeneration of morality and its consequences, and as being included in the loss of acquired Dharma.

original: bdag nyid kyi zang zing gis phongs pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ni brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zang zing gis phongs pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ni brtson par bya ste /
translated: One should strive to enrich others through material things because of one’s own poverty of material things.

original: zang zing 'byor pa de yang gal te chos kyis phongs pa skyed par mi byed na'o //
analyzed: zang zing 'byor pa de yang gal te chos kyis phongs pa skyed par mi byed na'o //
translated: And that enrichment of material things should not cause poverty of Dharma.

original: gal te chos kyis phongs pa skyed par byed na ni brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chos kyis phongs pa skyed par byed na ni brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: If it produces a lack of Dharma, then one should not apply oneself.

original: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as for the sake of material prosperity, so also for the sake of Dharma prosperity.

original: bdag nyid kyi zang zing 'byor pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zang zing 'byor pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should also apply oneself for the sake of others' material prosperity through one's own material prosperity.

original: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as for the sake of material prosperity,

original: chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
translated: so also for the sake of Dharma prosperity.

original: bdag nyid kyi chos 'byor pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi chos 'byor pas gzhan dag gi zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should also apply oneself for the sake of others' material prosperity through one's own Dharma prosperity.🔽Just as for the sake of material prosperity,

original: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zang zing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'byor par bya ba'i phyir yang de bzhin no //
translated: so also for the sake of Dharma prosperity.

original: de ltar sbyor bar mi byed na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor bar mi byed na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur la /
translated: If one does not apply oneself in this way, one becomes guilty.

original: sbyor bar byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he engages in the act, he is not tainted by a transgression.

original: de ltar na de ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'dul ba bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'dul ba bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This, in brief, is the training in the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: de la byang chub sems @38b dpa' dus rtag tu yid la bya zhing bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems @38b dpa' dus rtag tu yid la bya zhing bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should always keep in mind and train in the three kinds of morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po gang yin pa de las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po gang yin pa de las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin par brjod par bya'am /
translated: If one of the three kinds of morality of the bodhisattva is incomplete,

original: bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: should one say that the bodhisattva is bound by the vow or not bound by the vow?

original: bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya'o // tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag las 'di lta ste /
translated: One should say that he is not bound by the vow.🔽Of these three kinds of morality, the morality of restraint

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di ni sdud par byed pa dang / 'byor par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di ni sdud par byed pa dang / 'byor par byed pa yin te /
translated: is the one that binds and the one that enriches.

original: de bsdams shing bsrungs na de las gzhan pa dag kyang bsdams shing bsrungs par gyur la /
analyzed: de bsdams shing bsrungs na de las gzhan pa dag kyang bsdams shing bsrungs par gyur la /
translated: If one restrains and protects that, one restrains and protects the others.

original: de ma bsdams shing ma bsrungs na de las gzhan bdag kyang ma bsdams shing ma bsrungs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ma bsdams shing ma bsrungs na de las gzhan bdag kyang ma bsdams shing ma bsrungs par 'gyur bas /
translated: If one does not restrain and protect that, one does not restrain and protect the others.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyams na sdom pa thams cad nyams pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyams na sdom pa thams cad nyams pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if a bodhisattva violates the morality of restraint, it should be said that all restraints are violated.

original: gang gzhan la grags par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi ngo bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis yang dag par len du bcug pa na /
analyzed: gang gzhan la grags par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi ngo bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis yang dag par len du bcug pa na /
translated: If one takes up a restraint in order to be famous, in order to do what others do, or in order to be induced by others,

original: de len par byed par zad kyi /
analyzed: de len par byed par zad kyi /
translated: one merely takes it up.

original: rang gi dad pas bsam pa thag pa nas rjes su brtags shing /
analyzed: rang gi dad pas bsam pa thag pa nas rjes su brtags shing /
translated: But if one does not take it up with a desire for virtue, having investigated it with one's own faith and

original: sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: having placed the mind of compassion for sentient beings in the forefront,

original: dge ba 'dod pas len par mi byed pa de yang bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba 'dod pas len par mi byed pa de yang bsdams pa ma yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: it should be said that one does not restrain oneself.

original: de ni des dge ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang sbyor bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni des dge ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang sbyor bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: It is not that they are not connected with the completion of virtue.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do not obtain the benefit of the result.

original: de las bzlog pas ni sdom pas bsdams pa dang / dge ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang sbyor bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i 'bras bu phan yon yang 'thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni sdom pas bsdams pa dang / dge ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang sbyor bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i 'bras bu phan yon yang 'thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the restraint of the vow, the connection with the completion of virtue, and the obtainment of the benefit of the result.

original: sdom pa de ma btang na ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa de ma btang na ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one does not give up that vow, it should be understood as following into other lives.

original: gal te btang na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te btang na ni ma yin no //
translated: If one gives it up, it does not.

original: de gtong pha ni mdor bsdu na rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gtong pha ni mdor bsdu na rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, giving it up is due to four causes:

original: yang dag par len pa'i sems kyis mi 'dra bar nges pa'i sems skyed par byed pa dang / mi brda phrad pa'i drung du 'bul ba dang ldan pa'i tshig rjod par byed pa dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po de dag las thams cad dam /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i sems kyis mi 'dra bar nges pa'i sems skyed par byed pa dang / mi brda phrad pa'i drung du 'bul ba dang ldan pa'i tshig rjod par byed pa dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po de dag las thams cad dam /
translated: the arising of a different mind, such as the mind of taking up the correct vow; the expression of words that are offered in the presence of someone who understands; all four of the dharmas that are like the grounds of defeat;

original: re re'i nyes pa 'byin pa dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po thams cad dam re re la kun nas dkris pa chen pos nyes pa 'byin par @39a * //
analyzed: re re'i nyes pa 'byin pa dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po thams cad dam re re la kun nas dkris pa chen pos nyes pa 'byin par @39a * //
translated: If a bodhisattva commits all four of these offenses, or even just one of them, with a very intense involvement,

original: byed na byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa btang bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byed na byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa btang bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that the bodhisattva has given up the vow.

original: gal te phyir blang ba'i sems yongs su dag pa thob par gyur na yang phyir blang bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: gal te phyir blang ba'i sems yongs su dag pa thob par gyur na yang phyir blang bar yang bya'o //
translated: But if he or she obtains a completely pure intention to take it up again, then should take it up again.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas chos gos gsum ma gtogs pa yo byad lhag pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas chos gos gsum ma gtogs pa yo byad lhag pa /
translated: A bodhisattva who is ordained should not accumulate more than three robes,🔽unless it is with the approval of the Buddha, and then only if it is in keeping with the practice of the ascetics and conducive to the practice of the way of the perfections.

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba lus kyi longs spyod dang bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa dag / gal te slong mo pa 'dod pa rnams la so sor brtags ni sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba med do
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba lus kyi longs spyod dang bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa dag / gal te slong mo pa 'dod pa rnams la so sor brtags ni sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba med do
translated: If a bodhisattva gives to beggars who ask for things, after considering the matter, there is no offense.

original: // gal te dge ba'i phyogs la ltos pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: // gal te dge ba'i phyogs la ltos pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: But if he or she does not give because of a desire to do something virtuous,

original: 'dod pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pas sbyin par mi byed na yang kha na ma tho ba med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pas sbyin par mi byed na yang kha na ma tho ba med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If one does not give because it is not in one's possession, there is no transgression.

original: gal te chos kyi glegs bam bris zin pa slong mo pa byis pa'i shes rab can rnams la sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos kyi glegs bam bris zin pa slong mo pa byis pa'i shes rab can rnams la sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives a written copy of the Dharma to petitioners who are of childish understanding and are not fit vessels, there is an offense.

original: de dag la sbyin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la slong bar byed na yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la sbyin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la slong bar byed na yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asks others to give it to them, there is an offense.

original: gal te bdag gis 'di chos zab mo rnams 'dzin du gzhug pa dang mos par bya nus so snyam pa de lta bu kho na'i sems kyis sbyin par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di chos zab mo rnams 'dzin du gzhug pa dang mos par bya nus so snyam pa de lta bu kho na'i sems kyis sbyin par byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: If one gives it with the thought, “I will make them understand the profound Dharma,” there is no offense.

original: gal te dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'i glegs bam mam mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos kyi glegs bam la dad pa'i sems can rnams la de yi ger 'drir bcug nas sam /
analyzed: gal te dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'i glegs bam mam mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos kyi glegs bam la dad pa'i sems can rnams la de yi ger 'drir bcug nas sam /
translated: If one has sentient beings who have faith in a text that is a counterfeit of the true Dharma or in a text of the tīrthikas copy it,

original: bris zin pa lag na bdog pa sbyin par byed dam /
analyzed: bris zin pa lag na bdog pa sbyin par byed dam /
translated: If he gives a book that he has already written, or if he has it written and then gives it, he commits an offense.

original: gzhan las bslangs te sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan las bslangs te sbyin par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he gives a book that he has already written, or if he has it written and then gives it, he commits an offense.

original: byang chub sems dpas glegs bam bris zin pa lag na bdog pa de yang phyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas glegs bam bris zin pa lag na bdog pa de yang phyis te /
translated: But if a bodhisattva has a written book in his possession, he should give it away.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yi ger 'drir gzhug pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yi ger 'drir gzhug pa'am /
translated: He should have the scriptures written out and then give them away.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang snying po med pa kho nar yongs su shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang snying po med pa kho nar yongs su shes par bya zhing /
translated: He should also understand that they are without essence,

original: gzhan dag la yang legs pa kho nar bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang legs pa kho nar bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: and he should proclaim their excellence to others.

original: gal te glegs bam ma bris pa slong ba zhig 'ongs na byang chub sems dpa' de la 'dis khyod la ji zhig bya zhes yongs su dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te glegs bam ma bris pa slong ba zhig 'ongs na byang chub sems dpa' de la 'dis khyod la ji zhig bya zhes yongs su dri bar bya ste /
translated: If someone asks him for an unwritten book, the bodhisattva should ask him, “What will you do with it?”

original: gal te btsongs la yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes zer na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gal te glegs bam de chos kyi don du sta gon byas pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te btsongs la yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes zer na / byang chub sems dpa' gal te glegs bam de chos kyi don du sta gon byas pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he replies, “I will sell it and use the money,”🔽the bodhisattva should not give him the book if he has prepared it for the purpose of the Dharma.

original: de la sbyin par mi bya bar /
analyzed: de la sbyin par mi bya bar /
translated: But if he has not prepared it for that purpose,

original: rin bdog na rin sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rin bdog na rin sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If you have the price, you should give the price.

original: gal te rin @39b mi bdog na gnyi ga ma byin na yang kha na ma tho ba med do //🔽gal te chos kyi don du sta gon byas pa ma yin na ni ji nas kyang bde bar yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rin @39b mi bdog na gnyi ga ma byin na yang kha na ma tho ba med do // gal te chos kyi don du sta gon byas pa ma yin na ni ji nas kyang bde bar yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If you do not have the price, there is no offense if you do not give the text, but you should give a Dharma teaching to the best of your ability.

original: glegs bam de nyid sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bam de nyid sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If you are not prepared to give a Dharma teaching, then you should give the text itself so that you can enjoy it yourself.🔽Similarly, if you do not give a text to someone who asks for it because you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.

original: de bzhin du gal te gzhung shin tu ngan pa 'dri bar 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba la ma byin na yang kha na ma tho ba med do //🔽gzhung shin tu ngan pa 'dri bar 'dod pa la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhung 'bring 'dri bar 'dod pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te gzhung shin tu ngan pa 'dri bar 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba la ma byin na yang kha na ma tho ba med do // gzhung shin tu ngan pa 'dri bar 'dod pa la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhung 'bring 'dri bar 'dod pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.

original: gzhung khyad par du 'phags pa 'dri bar 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba la ma byin na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung khyad par du 'phags pa 'dri bar 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba la ma byin na ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is no offense if you do not give it to someone who asks for it.🔽If you do not want to copy a very poor text, there is

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang zhing zang zing bcas pa'i sems dang phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i tshul gyis mdza' bshes kyi bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas🔽par 'gyur ro //🔽gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang zhing rnyog pa'i sems dang / dgra bor yongs su gzung ba'i sems kyis dgra bo'i bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang zhing zang zing bcas pa'i sems dang phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i tshul gyis mdza' bshes kyi bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro // gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang zhing rnyog pa'i sems dang / dgra bor yongs su gzung ba'i sems kyis dgra bo'i bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a transgression for a bodhisattva who, while cultivating the attitude of a friend toward those beings who are the objects of his helpful activity, does so with a motive of material reward and with a partial attitude that follows after signs of his helpful activity.🔽It is a transgression for a bodhisattva who, while cultivating the attitude of an enemy toward those beings who are the objects of his harmful activity, does so with a defiled attitude and with an attitude that holds them as enemies.

original: gnod pa byed pa yang ma yin phan pa byed pa yang ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la tha mal pa'i bsam pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa yang ma yin phan pa byed pa yang ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la tha mal pa'i bsam pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bsam pa skyed par byed na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a transgression for a bodhisattva who, while cultivating a neutral attitude toward those beings who are neither the objects of his helpful activity nor the objects of his harmful activity, does so with an attitude of indifference.

original: gal te rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa zhig 'ongs na /
analyzed: gal te rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa zhig 'ongs na /
translated: If someone comes to request ordination,

original: dus kyi skyon dang dus tha ma'i skyon gyi rjes su 'brang zhing rab tu 'byin par mi byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: dus kyi skyon dang dus tha ma'i skyon gyi rjes su 'brang zhing rab tu 'byin par mi byed na ni kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: if he does not give it because of a fault of time or a fault of the end of the eon, there is no offense.

original: gal te snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste rab tu 'byin par byed na yang kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gal te snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste rab tu 'byin par byed na yang kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: If he gives it out of a compassionate mind, there is no offense.

original: rab tu 'byin pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa dang / gnas sbyin par byed pa dang / 'khor sdud par byed pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byin pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa dang / gnas sbyin par byed pa dang / 'khor sdud par byed pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: As with ordination, so it is with full ordination, with giving refuge, and with gathering a following.

original: rnam pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de gsum yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de gsum yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Through these aspects, the bodhisattva’s aggregate of morality should be understood as fulfilled.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa rnams kyi mdor bsdu ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa rnams kyi mdor bsdu ba bstan par bya ste /
