translated: Here, the summary of the teachings on generosity and so forth should be explained.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni mdor bsdu na yon tan @40a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni mdor bsdu na yon tan @40a * //
translated: In brief, the generosity of bodhisattvas is as follows.

original: lnga dang ldan na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: lnga dang ldan na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: In brief, the generosity of bodhisattvas is endowed with five virtues and is called the perfection of generosity.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis so //
translated: nonattachment, nonobservation, nontransgression, nonconceptuality, and dedication.

original: sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Generosity should be understood in the same way as morality and so forth.

original: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad la chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment is the absence of attachment to all things that are obstacles to generosity and so forth.

original: de la mi lta ba nyid na zang zing dang de'i 'bras bu la sems 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi lta ba nyid na zang zing dang de'i 'bras bu la sems 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nonobservation is the absence of a mind that is attached to material things and their results.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of any basis for criticism is the complete abandonment of all the afflictions of generosity and so forth.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of conceptualization is the non-apprehension of generosity and so forth as having an imagined essence.

original: de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The dedication is the aspiration that the results of all generosity and so forth lead to the attainment of the unsurpassed, complete enlightenment of Buddhahood.

original: de la de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan rnam pa lngas yongs su zin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de la de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan rnam pa lngas yongs su zin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: Thus, the transcendences of the bodhisattvas, which are embraced by these five excellences, are called the bodhisattvas' generosity, and so on up to the bodhisattvas' wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi bar zhes kyang bya'o //🔽thams cad kyi sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi bar zhes kyang bya'o //🔽thams cad kyi sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: They are also called the transcendences of the bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab thams cad kyi bar zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab thams cad kyi bar zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called the wisdom of all.

original: dka' ba sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: dka' ba sbyin pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called the giving of difficulty.

original: dka' ba'i shes rab kyi bar zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i shes rab kyi bar zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the wisdom of difficulty.

original: rgyas par sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa thams cad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa thams cad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail according to the verses of the summary taught in the Stages of Yogic Deeds.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nang dang phyi rol la brten pa rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nang dang phyi rol la brten pa rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: There are ten types of secondary affliction related to the perfection of generosity, based on the internal and external.

original: de dag gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i sar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu bstan pa rnams gcig las 'phros pa'i go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i sar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu bstan pa rnams gcig las 'phros pa'i go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The ten types of purity of the perfection of generosity taught in the Bodhisattva Levels are to be understood as the antidotes to those, in the order in which they are presented.

original: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Among them, the secondary afflictions based on the external are of five types.

original: yongs su nyon mongs pa dang / spongs pa dang / byams pas zhen pa med pa dang / yid la bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyon mongs pa dang / spongs pa dang / byams pas zhen pa med pa dang / yid la bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: 1) complete affliction, 2) abandonment, 3) non-attachment through love, 4) fulfillment of mental intentions, and 5) maturity.

original: nang la brten @40b pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nang la brten @40b pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The internal proximate afflictions are also fivefold:

original: nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid dang / stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid dang / phyogs su lhung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / zad pa'i chos can nyid do //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid dang / stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid dang / phyogs su lhung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / zad pa'i chos can nyid do //
translated: 1) non-liberation, 2) affliction, 3) lack of strength, 4) partiality, and 5) impermanence.

original: tshul khrims kyi le'ur tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu bstan pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'ur tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu bstan pa la /
translated: In the chapter on morality, ten kinds of pure morality are taught.

original: rnam pa gcig gis ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: One aspect shows the purity of intention.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining aspects should be understood to show the purity of application.

original: de la sbyor ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Therein, application is fivefold:

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba'i sbyor ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyor ba dang / grogs kyi sbyor ba dang / bsrung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba'i sbyor ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyor ba dang / grogs kyi sbyor ba dang / bsrung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the application of uninterruptedness, the application of purification, the application of dedication, the application of assistance, and the application of protection.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa gnyis kyis ni sbyor ba dang po bstan to //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa gnyis kyis ni sbyor ba dang po bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the first application is indicated by the second and third aspects,

original: bzhi pas ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: the second by the fourth,

original: lnga pas ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni gsum pa'o //
translated: the third by the fifth,

original: drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa rnams kyis ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa rnams kyis ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: and the fourth by the sixth, seventh, eighth, and ninth.

original: bcu pas ni sbyor ba lnga pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu pas ni sbyor ba lnga pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The fifth application should be understood as indicated by the tenth.

original: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa bcu la rnam par dag pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa bcu la rnam par dag pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten kinds of purity of patience should be understood as twofold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa ni dgus bstan to //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa ni dgus bstan to //
translated: purity by the power of discernment is indicated by the first nine,

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa ni bcu pas bstan to //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa ni bcu pas bstan to //
translated: and purity by the power of meditation is indicated by the tenth.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /🔽kha na ma tho ba yongs su spong bas rnam par dag pa dang / de kun du mi spyod pas rnam par dag pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa skye bas rnam par dag pa dang / de'i rgyu yongs su mi spong bas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste / kha na ma tho ba yongs su spong bas rnam par dag pa dang / de kun du mi spyod pas rnam par dag pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa skye bas rnam par dag pa dang / de'i rgyu yongs su mi spong bas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That purity should be understood as fourfold:

original: rnam pa gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: purity of abandonment of the reproachable, purity of non-performance of the reproachable, purity of birth of the non-reproachable, and purity of non-abandonment of the cause of the non-reproachable.

original: mi bzod pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsu pa du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsu pa du rig par bya ste /
translated: The causes of intolerance should be understood as threefold:

original: ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / snying rjes med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / snying rjes med pa'o //
translated: lack of shame, lack of dread of blame, and lack of compassion.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa bcus rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa bcus rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of vigor is also pure in ten ways.

original: rnam par sbyor bas rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su 'dris pas rnam par dag pa dang / rtsom pas rnam par dag pa dang / thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dus 'bras bu yod par gnas pas rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par sbyor bas rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su 'dris pas rnam par dag pa dang / rtsom pas rnam par dag pa dang / thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dus 'bras bu yod par gnas pas rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: purification through application, purification through thorough acquaintance, purification through undertaking, purification through means, purification through abiding in the result of the time,

original: tshegs med par @41a * //
analyzed: tshegs med par @41a * //
translated: purification through abiding without difficulty,

original: gnas pas rnam par dag pa dang / nges par 'byung bas rnam par dag pa dang / grogs kyis yongs su zin pas rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / mi zad pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pas rnam par dag pa dang / nges par 'byung bas rnam par dag pa dang / grogs kyis yongs su zin pas rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / mi zad pa nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: purification through renunciation, purification through being supported by friends, purification through the swift higher perceptions, and purification through inexhaustibility.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcus rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcus rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration is purified by ten kinds of purification:

original: dag pa de nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / zag pa med pas rnam par dag pa dang / dngos gzhi'i thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dngos gzhi thob pas rnam par dag pa dang / dbang gi thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: dag pa de nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / zag pa med pas rnam par dag pa dang / dngos gzhi'i thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dngos gzhi thob pas rnam par dag pa dang / dbang gi thabs kyis rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is also pure by that purity itself, pure by being without outflows, pure by the method of the main subject, pure by attaining the main subject, pure by the method of empowerment,

original: gnas pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / mu stegs can tshar gcad pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: gnas pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang / mu stegs can tshar gcad pa la dbang bas rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: pure by mastery over abiding, pure by mastery in accomplishing the superknowledges, pure by mastery in ripening sentient beings, pure by mastery in refuting the tīrthikas,

original: 'bral ba bla na med pas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba bla na med pas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and pure by being unsurpassed in freedom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The purity of the perfection of wisdom is fivefold.

original: mtshan nyid rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / lung 'bogs pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / skyes bu'i byed pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / 'thob pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / lung 'bogs pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / skyes bu'i byed pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa dang / 'thob pa rtogs pas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: purification through the realization of the characteristics, purification through the realization of dependent origination, purification through the realization of the transmission of the scriptures, purification through the realization of the activity of beings, and purification through the realization of attainment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva abide in contemplation of the body in the body?

original: smras pa / mtshan ma'i lus la de bzhin nyid kyi lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //🔽lus la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan ma'i lus la de bzhin nyid kyi lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so // lus la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: He abides in contemplation of the body of reality in the body of signs.

original: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: As with the body, so also with feeling, mind, and the dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the unarisen unfavorable and unwholesome dharmas that the bodhisattva generates will to abandon?

original: smras pa / de de ltar de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len mi snang bar gyur pa thams cad dang / nang du yang dag par ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de de ltar de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len mi snang bar gyur pa thams cad dang / nang du yang dag par ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya'o //
translated: He says: Thus, in regard to the object of suchness, he generates will-power for the non-appearance of all signs and negative reflex actions in the mind, and for the non-production of those which have not yet arisen internally.

original: ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa snang bar gyur pa rnams dang / @41b nang du yang dag par skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa snang bar gyur pa rnams dang / @41b nang du yang dag par skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: He generates will-power for the non-production of those which have not yet arisen, for the appearance of those which have already arisen, for the abandonment of those which have already arisen internally, and for the production of the virtuous dharmas which are the antidotes to those which have not yet arisen.

original: skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dun ba skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dun ba skyed par byed do zhes rgyas par bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: He generates will-power for the stability of those which have already arisen.

original: de la dang por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la ni dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la ni dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtod par rig par bya'o //
translated: First, in the foundations of mindfulness, one should know that the mind is directed to the object.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyis rtsol bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyis rtsol bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to stabilize the mind on that very object, one should know that one strives with the right efforts.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: After that, in order to perfect the meditative stabilization that has been attained, one should know that one applies oneself with the bases of supernatural power.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyis lam yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyis lam yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to be free from all signs of the perfection of meditative stabilization and from all bad states, one should know that one begins the path with the faculties and the powers.

original: de la dbang po rnams kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam chung ngu yang dag par rtsom par rig par byed do //
analyzed: de la dbang po rnams kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam chung ngu yang dag par rtsom par rig par byed do //
translated: Therein, one should know that one begins the small path of application with the faculties.

original: stobs rnams kyis ni chen po'o //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyis ni chen po'o //
translated: One should know that one begins the great path of application with the powers.

original: de'i 'og tu sbyor ba yang dag par brtsams pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par byed par rig par bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sbyor ba yang dag par brtsams pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par byed par rig par bya'o // de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pas 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, it should be understood that the factors of enlightenment which are the correct application bring about the realization of the reality limit.

original: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su 'thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su 'thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Then, it should be understood that the factors of the path bring about the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, up to the realization of the reality limit, in order to be completely liberated from all obscurations.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba ni rnam pa bcu bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba ni rnam pa bcu bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The bonds of signs and negative conditioning should be understood as fourteenfold.

original: dbang po'i 'ching ba dang / yul gyi 'ching ba dang / sems can gcig la gcig chags pa'i 'ching ba dang / gnas kyi 'ching ba dang / shes pa mi shes pa'i 'ching ba dang / shes bya mi shes pa'i 'ching ba dang / yang 'byung ba la sred pa'i 'ching ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'ching ba dang / yul gyi 'ching ba dang / sems can gcig la gcig chags pa'i 'ching ba dang / gnas kyi 'ching ba dang / shes pa mi shes pa'i 'ching ba dang / shes bya mi shes pa'i 'ching ba dang / yang 'byung ba la sred pa'i 'ching ba dang /
translated: the fetter of the sense faculties, the fetter of objects, the fetter of one sentient being’s attachment to another, the fetter of abodes, the fetter of not knowing what is to be known, the fetter of not knowing the knowable, the fetter of craving for rebirth,

original: 'jig pa la sred pa'i 'ching ba dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dang / rgyu med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang / thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig pa la sred pa'i 'ching ba dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dang / rgyu med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang / thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang /
translated: the fetter of craving for destruction, the fetter of attachment to causes that are not concordant, the fetter of attachment to causelessness, the fetter of the pride of attainment, the fetter of attachment to the imagined nature,

original: gang zag gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang / gang @42a * //
analyzed: gang zag gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba dang / gang @42a * //
translated: the fetter of attachment to the individual nature,

original: zag yongs su shes par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba dang / chos yongs su shes par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: zag yongs su shes par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba dang / chos yongs su shes par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi 'ching ba'o //
translated: the fetter of the pride of understanding the individual, and the fetter of the pride of understanding phenomena.

original: de la gnas ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas ni 'di yin te /
translated: The place is as follows.🔽

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa ste /
translated: The basis is the physical world,

original: de la brten nas dbang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas dbang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense faculties arise in dependence on it.

original: stong pa nyid la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mdor bsdu na 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa drug las sems rnam par grol bar bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mdor bsdu na 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa drug las sems rnam par grol bar bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who strives to cultivate the applications of mindfulness in dependence on emptiness should liberate his mind from six kinds of bondage of ideation.

original: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six kinds of bondage of ideation?

original: lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la nang du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi 'ching ba dang po'o //
analyzed: lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la nang du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi 'ching ba dang po'o //
translated: The first is the bondage of ideation that consists of the ideation of the internal with regard to the body, etc.

original: de dag nyid la phyi rol du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la phyi rol du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the bondage of ideation that consists of the ideation of the external with regard to those same things.

original: de dag nyid la nang dang phyi rol du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la nang dang phyi rol du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the bondage of ideation that consists of the ideation of the internal and external with regard to those same things.

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa de dag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa de dag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The notion that he has of himself as one who has made the vow to liberate the immeasurable and incalculable realms of sentient beings in the ten directions and who then cultivates the applications of mindfulness is the fourth.

original: gang gi lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The notion that he has of himself as one who dwells observing the body, etc. is the fifth.

original: lus la sogs pa de dag nyid la rnam par lta zhing gnas pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi 'ching ba drug pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa de dag nyid la rnam par lta zhing gnas pa de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi 'ching ba drug pa yin no //
translated: The notion that he has of himself as one who dwells observing the very same body, etc. is the sixth fetter of notion.

original: de la lta ba'i gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa bcu gcig yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba'i gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa bcu gcig yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In this context, the fetters of notion should be understood as being of eleven kinds, in ascending order.

original: gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eleven kinds of fetters of notion in ascending order?

original: lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bden pa la don gyi mchog tu 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni dang po'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bden pa la don gyi mchog tu 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the notion that the truth of suffering and the truth of origination are the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la byas par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la byas par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the notion that the truth of cessation is the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: rnam par byad pa pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la ma byas par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byad pa pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la ma byas par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the notion that the truth of the path is the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: ma byas pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la rtag par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la rtag par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the notion that the truth of cessation is the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa byas pa la rgyun du 'jug par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa byas pa la rgyun du 'jug par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the notion that the truth of the path is the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: rtag pa nyid la 'gyur ba med par @42b 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la 'gyur ba med par @42b 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the notion that the truth of cessation is the highest object, when one dwells contemplating the body as a body, etc.

original: rgyun du 'jug pa de nyid la sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du 'jug pa de nyid la sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the notion that this very entry into the stream is of the nature of suffering, because it is associated with suffering and change.

original: de nyid la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the notion that it is associated with its own characteristics, because it is associated with arising, passing away, duration, and change.

original: 'gyur ba med pa dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni dgu pa'o ;
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i don gyi mchog de nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni dgu pa'o ;
translated: The ninth is the notion that all dharmas of defilement and purification are included in just this supreme object, which is both without change and associated with change.

original: ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag thams cad las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid med par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag thams cad las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid med par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The perception that all these phenomena of affliction and purification lack the identity of affliction and purification is the tenth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag nyid la ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bcu gcig pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag nyid la ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa gang yin pa de ni bcu gcig pa ste /
translated: The perception that these very phenomena of affliction and purification lack an inherent identity is the eleventh.

original: de ltar gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba'i rnam pa de dag shes shing mthong bas /
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du 'du shes kyi 'ching ba'i rnam pa de dag shes shing mthong bas /
translated: In this way, by knowing and seeing these aspects of the bondage of perception in a progressive manner,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed cing sems kyang rnam par grol bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la brten nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed cing sems kyang rnam par grol bar byed de /
translated: the bodhisattvas, based on emptiness, cultivate the applications of mindfulness and liberate the mind.

original: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba de las rnam par grol na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba de las rnam par grol na /
translated: When liberated from this bondage of perception,

original: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba thams cad las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi 'ching ba thams cad las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be liberated from all bonds of perception.

original: theg pa chen po pa la la rang gi nye bar bzung nas 'di skad ces kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa la la rang gi nye bar bzung nas 'di skad ces kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod la /
translated: Some Mahāyānists, having taken up this position, say, “Conventionally, everything exists.

original: don dam par ni thams cad med do zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad med do zhes zer ro ;
translated: Ultimately, everything is nonexistent.”

original: / de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa don dam pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: / de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa don dam pa ni gang yin /
translated: To them it should be said, “Venerable, what is ultimate?

original: kun rdzob ni gang yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni gang yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: What is conventional?”

original: de skad ces dris pa na /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa na /
translated: When asked this,

original: gal te de 'di skad ces chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te de 'di skad ces chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin la /
translated: if they answer, “The absence of an essence in all phenomena is the ultimate.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos de dag la ngo bo nyid du dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos de dag la ngo bo nyid du dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no //
translated: The observation of an essence in those phenomena that lack an essence is the conventional.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni yod pa ma yin pa dag la kun rdzob tu byed pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni yod pa ma yin pa dag la kun rdzob tu byed pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs par gyur na /
translated: Because it is the basis for the conventional, imputation, verbalization, and designation of what does not exist,”

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: then this should be said to them:

original: ci ngo bo nyid du dmigs @43a * //
analyzed: ci ngo bo nyid du dmigs @43a * //
translated: Are they observed as intrinsic reality?🔽

original: pa de mngon par brjod pa dang kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin par 'dod dam /
analyzed: pa de mngon par brjod pa dang kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin par 'dod dam /
translated: Do you assert that what is perceived as an intrinsic reality arises from the cause of verbal expression and superficial reality?

original: 'on te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob tsam zhig yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob tsam zhig yin par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it is merely verbal expression and superficial reality?

original: gal te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin pas yod pa ma yin pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rgyu las byung ba yin pas yod pa ma yin pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it arises from the cause of verbal expression and superficial reality, then it is not tenable to say that it does not exist because it arises from the cause of verbal expression and superficial reality.

original: gal te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob tsam zhig yin na ni des na gzhi med par mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob tsam zhig yin na ni des na gzhi med par mngon par brjod pa dang / kun rdzob ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is merely verbal expression and superficial reality, then it is not tenable to say that verbal expression and superficial reality are groundless.

original: de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir na gang dmigs pa de med pa yin zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir na gang dmigs pa de med pa yin zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, you should say to them, “Venerable, why is it that what is perceived does not exist?”

original: de skad dris pa na /
analyzed: de skad dris pa na /
translated: When asked this,

original: gal te de 'di skad ces phyin ci log gi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de 'di skad ces phyin ci log gi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs par gyur na /
translated: If he answers, “Because it is a mistaken entity,”

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then he should be asked, “

original: ci phyin ci log de yod par 'dod dam 'on te med par 'dod /
analyzed: ci phyin ci log de yod par 'dod dam 'on te med par 'dod /
translated: Do you accept that mistake as existent or nonexistent?

original: gal te yod na ni des na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni don dam pa'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni des na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni don dam pa'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it exists, then it is not tenable to say that the unreality of all things is the ultimate.

original: gal te med na ni des na phyin ci log gi dngos po yin pa'i phyir gang dmigs pa de ngo bo nyid med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te med na ni des na phyin ci log gi dngos po yin pa'i phyir gang dmigs pa de ngo bo nyid med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it does not exist, then it is not tenable to say that the object of a mistake is unreal.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde don rab tu dbye ba'i rgyu bstan pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde don rab tu dbye ba'i rgyu bstan pa ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The teaching of the cause of the discrimination of the meaning of the Mahāyāna sūtras should be understood as fivefold:

original: ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the teaching for the purpose of generating respect for the teacher.

original: 'khor yang dag par bsdu ba nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor yang dag par bsdu ba nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the teaching for the purpose of gathering a retinue.

original: chos la rim gro cher bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos la rim gro cher bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the explanation because it greatly increases respect for the Dharma.

original: dngos po nye bar dgod ba nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nye bar dgod ba nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the explanation because it sets forth the thing itself.

original: de kho na'i don mang du bstan pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni lnga pa'o //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de kho na'i don mang du bstan pa nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ni lnga pa'o // rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The fifth is the explanation because it teaches the meaning of reality in many ways.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la /
translated: The twelve sense-fields are to be understood as the antidotes to the ten errors, beginning with the investigation of the specific characteristics and the investigation of the general characteristics.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob bar bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob bar bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of unerring paths for the attainment of the Buddha's special qualities in regard to the twelve sense-fields.

original: de la rnam pa drug gis ni skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug gis ni skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa yin la /
translated: Among them, the first six are the investigation of the specific characteristics of the twelve sense-fields.

original: rnam pa bzhis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The last four are the investigation of the general characteristics.

original: mig la sogs pa'i ming dang brda rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid la sgra tsam gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su @43b shes pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam dang po'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i ming dang brda rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid la sgra tsam gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su @43b shes pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam dang po'o //
translated: The first is the knowledge of the mere sound-generality of the characteristics of the nominal and conventional designations of the eye, etc. It is the first unerring path for the attainment of the unshared qualities of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la log par yongs su rtogs pas skye ba sna tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la log par yongs su rtogs pas skye ba sna tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the knowledge of the characteristic of the various kinds of birth that are taken up due to the false imagination of the twelve sense spheres.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rgyu la brten te 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rgyu la brten te 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the knowledge of the characteristic of the engagement of the twelve sense spheres in dependence on a cause.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la skad cig la 'jig cing 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la skad cig la 'jig cing 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the knowledge of the characteristic of the momentariness and engagement of the twelve sense spheres.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rnam par dag par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la rnam par dag par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni lnga pa'o /
translated: Furthermore, the fifth is the thorough knowledge of the characteristics of the twelve sense spheres as they relate to pure engagement.

original: de la las rnam pa gnyis la brten nas rnam par dag rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la las rnam pa gnyis la brten nas rnam par dag rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, two kinds of purity should be understood as based on two kinds of action:

original: mngon par grub pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i rnam par dag pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i rnam par dag pa'o ;
translated: purity of manifestation and purity of appeasement.

original: / gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la mngon par brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa ste /
analyzed: / gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag la mngon par brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, the sixth is the thorough knowledge of the characteristics of the twelve sense spheres as they relate to the basis of verbal expression.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag gis ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par rig par rig bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag gis ni rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par rig par rig bya'o //
translated: Through these six aspects, one should understand the thorough knowledge of the specific characteristics.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the thorough knowledge of the essence of the general characteristics of the twelve sense spheres.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, the knowledge of the general characteristics of those very twelve sense-spheres as the characteristic of the domain of non-conceptual intuition is the eighth.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa nga ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa nga ni dgu pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, the knowledge of the general characteristics of those very twelve sense-spheres as the characteristic of the domain of supramundane intuition is the ninth.

original: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye mched bcu gnyis po de dag nyid la spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Furthermore, the knowledge of the general characteristics of those very twelve sense-spheres as the characteristic of the cause of purification is the tenth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob bar bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bcu pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thob bar bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bcu pa yin te /
translated: It is the unerring path for the attainment of the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su brtags par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these four aspects, the general characteristics are to be understood as imagined.

original: gnas pa dang sa rnams kyi gong nas gong ma'i khyad par ni khyad par rnam pa brgyad kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa dang sa rnams kyi gong nas gong ma'i khyad par ni khyad par rnam pa brgyad kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The differences of the stages and states are to be understood by eight differences:

original: bsam @44a * //
analyzed: bsam @44a * //
translated: difference of thought,🔽difference of mental purity,🔽difference of compassion,🔽difference of perfections,🔽difference of evolutionary development of beings,🔽difference of appearance of the Buddhas,

original: pa'i khyad par dang / sems rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / snying rje'i khyad par dang / pha rol du phyin pa'i khyad par dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i khyad par dang / sangs rgyas snang bar 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: pa'i khyad par dang / sems rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / snying rje'i khyad par dang / pha rol du phyin pa'i khyad par dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i khyad par dang / sangs rgyas snang bar 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: difference of worship and service,🔽difference of birth,

original: skye ba'i khyad par dang / mthu'i khyad par gyis se /
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par dang / mthu'i khyad par gyis se /
translated: and difference of power.

original: // / bas po sum cu bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bas po sum cu bdun pa /
translated: The thirty-seventh

original: don dam pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa yin te brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: don dam pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa yin te brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The ultimate has five characteristics: the characteristic of being inexpressible, the characteristic of being nondual, the characteristic of being beyond the domain of sophistry, the characteristic of being beyond sameness and discreteness,

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the characteristic of being of one taste in all things.

original: de la brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: As for the characteristic of being inexpressible and the characteristic of being nondual,

original: dgongs pa des par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
analyzed: dgongs pa des par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste / byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
translated: they should be understood as they are presented in the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la dri ba dris pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la dri ba dris pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Yathābhūtasampratiṣṭha asked the bodhisattva Arthavistara, who had been prophesied by the Blessed One,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras chos thams cad gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras chos thams cad gnyis su med pa /
translated: “O son of the victors, all phenomena are nondual.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na /
translated: All phenomena are nondual.”

original: chos thams cad ni gang ;
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gang ;
translated: What are all phenomena?

original: ji ltar na gnyis su med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyis su med pa yin /
translated: How are they nondual?

original: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gnyis ji tsam pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gnyis ji tsam pa ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, all phenomena, all phenomena, are as dual as they are.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: They are conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: Among them, the conditioned is neither conditioned

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
translated: The unconditioned is neither unconditioned

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor conditioned.

original: smras pa / kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa / kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: ” “O son of the victorious ones, how is it that the conditioned is neither conditioned

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin la /
translated: nor unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
translated: and that the unconditioned is neither unconditioned

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
translated: nor conditioned?”

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas kyang 'dus ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas kyang 'dus ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: “Son of noble family, the conditioned is a term that is imputed by the Teacher.

original: ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa las byung ba /
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa las byung ba /
translated: Whatever is a term imputed by the Teacher has arisen from conceptualization.

original: tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
translated: It is expressed conventionally.

original: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The conventional expressions that arise from imagination🔽

original: kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa gtan yongs su @44b ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas ma yin no //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa gtan yongs su @44b ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas ma yin no //
translated: The conventional expressions that arise from imagination are not conditioned because the conventional expressions of various imaginations are not ultimately established.

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
translated: Son of noble family, the so-called unconditioned is also included within the conventional.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su ma gtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid 'du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su ma gtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid 'du 'gyur //
translated: Whatever is expressed as not included within the conditioned and unconditioned is also just like that.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also be just like that.

original: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: Expression is not without substance.

original: dngos po de yang gang yin /
analyzed: dngos po de yang gang yin /
translated: What is that substance?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the inexpressible perfect enlightenment of the noble wisdom and noble seeing of the noble ones.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so //
translated: That reality, which is inexpressible, is designated as ‘conditioned’ in order to fully awaken to it.

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Son of noble family, that which is called ‘unconditioned’ is a term designated by the Teacher.

original: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
translated: It is a conventional expression that arises from conceptualization.

original: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba tha snyad du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
translated: That which is a conventional expression that arises from conceptualization is unconditioned because the conventional expressions that arise from various conceptualizations are not ultimately established.

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
translated: Son of noble family, that which is called ‘conditioned’ is also included within convention.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su rtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su rtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Whatever is expressed as the realization of the conditioned and the unconditioned will also be just like that.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That will also be just like that.

original: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is inexpressible because it is a non-entity.

original: dngos po de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that entity?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i ye shes dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i ye shes dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which is fully and perfectly awakened to as inexpressible by the noble ones through their noble wisdom and noble seeing.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags so //
translated: The unconditioned is designated by the name “unconditioned” in order to fully and perfectly realize that very inexpressible reality.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i ye shes dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir🔽'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i ye shes dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir🔽'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin /
translated: O son of the victors, how is it that the noble ones fully and perfectly awaken to that entity as inexpressible through their noble wisdom and noble seeing, and how is the unconditioned designated by the name “unconditioned” in order to fully and perfectly realize that very inexpressible reality?

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma mkhan na ma sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob pa mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma mkhan na ma sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob pa mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: “Noble son, consider this analogy. A skilled magician or magician’s apprentice stands at a crossroads and gathers together grass,

original: rtsva dag gam /🔽lo ma dag gam /🔽@45a * // shing dag gam /
analyzed: rtsva dag gam / lo ma dag gam / @45a * // shing dag gam /
translated: leaves,🔽wood,🔽pebbles,

original: gseg ma dag gam /
analyzed: gseg ma dag gam /
translated: and potsherds.

original: gyo du ma dag gcig tu bsdus nas sgyur ma'i lam sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gyo du ma dag gcig tu bsdus nas sgyur ma'i lam sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: He then displays various magical creations, such as

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta ba'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang / dung dang ; man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang /
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta ba'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang / dung dang ; man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang /
translated: an army of elephants, an army of horses, an army of chariots, an army of infantry, and collections of jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, and coral, as well as🔽wealth,

original: 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba'i tshogs dag rnam par bstan na /
analyzed: 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba'i tshogs dag rnam par bstan na /
translated: grain, treasuries, and granaries.

original: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can /🔽rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can / rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: If sentient beings who are foolish by nature,🔽who are deluded by nature,

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can /
translated: and who are of a foolish and deluded nature

original: rtsva dang / lo ma dang / shing dang / gseg ma dang / gyo du ma de dag mi shes pa de dag ni de mthong ngam thos na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rtsva dang / lo ma dang / shing dang / gseg ma dang / gyo du ma de dag mi shes pa de dag ni de mthong ngam thos na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Those who do not know that the grass, leaves, wood, pebbles, and gravel are not real will think, when they see or hear about this,

original: glang po che'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do //
translated: ‘The appearance of an army of elephants is real.

original: rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang ; dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang /
analyzed: rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang ; dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang /
translated: The appearance of an army of horses, an army of chariots, an army of foot soldiers, a collection of jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystals, and coral,

original: bang ba'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing /🔽de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing /
analyzed: bang ba'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing / de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing /
translated: wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses is real.’🔽“They will insist on what they have seen and heard,

original: mngon par zhen nas /🔽'di ni bden gyi /
analyzed: mngon par zhen nas / 'di ni bden gyi /
translated: and they will be attached to it.🔽They will say, ‘This is true.

original: gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed de /
analyzed: gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed de /
translated: The rest is false.’🔽“

original: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: They will have to investigate this matter further.

original: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: “Among them, those sentient beings who are not foolish by nature,

original: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: who are not confused by nature,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: who are by nature endowed with wisdom,

original: rtsva dang lo ma dang / shing dang / gsig ma dang / gyo du ma de dag ni mthong ngam thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma dang / shing dang / gsig ma dang / gyo du ma de dag ni mthong ngam thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: when they see or hear about the grass, sticks, leaves, wood, pebbles, and potsherens, they will think as follows:

original: glang po che'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med do //
translated: ‘The appearance of an army of elephants does not exist.

original: rta ba'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang /🔽bang ba'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med kyi /
analyzed: rta ba'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'ur+ya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru'i tshogs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang /🔽bang ba'i tshogs snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med kyi /
translated: The appearance of an army of horses, chariots, and foot soldiers does not exist. The appearance of a collection of jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystals, and coral does not exist. The appearance of a collection of wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses does not exist.

original: gang la glang po che'i tshogs kyi 'du shes dang / glang po che'i tshogs kyi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung @45b ba dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba'i tshogs kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / de dag gi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung ba'i sgyu ma byas pa 'di ni yod do //
analyzed: gang la glang po che'i tshogs kyi 'du shes dang / glang po che'i tshogs kyi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung @45b ba dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba'i tshogs kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / de dag gi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung ba'i sgyu ma byas pa 'di ni yod do //
translated: “There is this illusory display of a herd of elephants, and there is the perception of a herd of elephants, and there is the perception of the various members of a herd of elephants, and there is the perception of a collection of wealth, grain, treasures, and storehouses, and there is the perception of the various members of a collection of wealth, grain, treasures, and storehouses.

original: mig slu bar byed pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: mig slu bar byed pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing /
translated: “There is this deception of the eyes, and there is this illusion.

original: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
translated: “But those who see and hear this, who insistently grasp and cling to it as supreme,

original: 'di ni bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun no zhes rjes su tha snyad mi 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun no zhes rjes su tha snyad mi 'dogs kyi /
translated: do not make conventional distinctions such as ‘This is true, the rest is false.’

original: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de /
translated: They make conventional distinctions only in order to communicate a meaning.

original: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtags par bya mi dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtags par bya mi dgos pa yin no //
translated: Later, they do not need to investigate it further.”

original: de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Likewise, there are sentient beings who are of childish nature,

original: so so'i skye bor gyur ba /
analyzed: so so'i skye bor gyur ba /
translated: who are ordinary beings,

original: shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ma thob pa chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i chos nyid mngon par mi shes pa de dag ni 'dus byas dang 'das ma byas de dag mthong ngam thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ma thob pa chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i chos nyid mngon par mi shes pa de dag ni 'dus byas dang 'das ma byas de dag mthong ngam thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: who have not attained the supramundane wisdom of the āryas, and who do not understand the inexpressible reality of all phenomena. When they see or hear about conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, they think,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas snang ba gang yin ba 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing mngon par zhen nas 'di ni bden gyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas snang ba gang yin ba 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du de dag la nan gyis mchog tu gzung zhing mngon par zhen nas 'di ni bden gyi /
translated: “Whatever appears as conditioned and unconditioned exists.” They insistently grasp and cling to that as supreme, just as they have seen it and just as they have heard it, thinking, “This is true.
